11.content:
"Oh my head" you grunt as you sit up. looking around, you find yourself in what looks to be New York City. You immediately begin to wonder how you got to New York, but as you look closer, you see that this isn't the NYC you know. All of the inhabitants of the city appear to be humanoid animals! They walk like humans, have five fingers and five toes (You know this because a few of them aren't wearing shoes). But at the same they have fur all over their bodies according to the animal they are and the thing that worried you the most were the claws that some of them were carrying. After making all of these observations you then make another disturbing discovery... none of them are moving because they're all looking at you!

         You hear a lot of mixed questions from the crowd, the most common of which were 'a human?' and 'where'd it come from?'

         You were worried to say the least but unsure of what to do. Eventually, a female wolf in a police uniform came through the crowd followed by several other officers you assume as they all had 'POLICE' in bold print on all of their vests and uniforms. The wolf, who seemed to be the one in charge, approached you slowly. She looked at you up and down in astonishment. It was at this point that you realized that she actually stood somewhere around ten or eleven feet tall while most of the creatures were only about eight or nine feet tall. There where a few around her height, but not many.

What happens next?

1111.content:
You decide to keep your mouth shut as you don't know what they will do to you if you talk. Seeing this the wolf sighs before standing up to her full height again. "I guess he doesn't understand..." She then turns to a pair of leopards "You two, bring him with us, we're returning to headquarters."

         At that point you decided playing the 'blind and the lame' was no longer a good idea. The whole point of doing that was so that you could stay out of a lab or prison cell, and it turns out that your going to end up there anyway. Just as the leopards approach, you decide that it's time to go. You bolt between them and dive into the crowd. After you disappear into the crowd you stay on the ground in order to avoid being seen, because you know that even the slowest of them is easily faster than any human track runner, and while you were pretty fast... you knew that any one of them could catch you if you ran in the open. So you crawled through the assortment of paws, talons and occasionally tails as you went along. Eventually you reached the outside of the crowd. A few of which spotted you and started calling for the police to come and get you. However, you didn't stick around for them to arrive. You ran down the sidewalk and hoped that your head start would give you the advantage. It did for a while but it didn't take long for them to find out where you'd gotten to.

         "Get him!" The wolf called as she and the leopards came after you. You ran by several of the strange creatures as you went down the street.

         "This is stupid" You muttered to yourself "There's no way I'll out run them, I need to level the playing field." Seeing a building with a revolving door to your right you decide that if top speed and size is their advantage, you decide to take that away from them you need an enclosed space. So you enter the building getting a few surprised gasps as you do. Suddenly you realize, you don't know where to go next, as your eyes dart around, you find that your actually in a hotel lobby. Glancing around you find the elevators. You sprint towards the elevator and slap the button, the doors open shortly after and to your surprise, its empty. You then turn around and start jamming the button for the fourth floor. You knew if you were going to escape, you would need to get yourself back down to the ground fast without breaking your legs, winding yourself or tripping. As the door for the elevator closed the wolf and her leopard officers had just entered the hotel. They turned just in time to see the doors closing in front of you.

         "He's in the elevator!" One of the leopards shouted as she pointed at the elevator you where in.

         "He's not as primitive as he wants us to believe..." The wolf noted.

         "How can you tell?" The other leopard asked.

         "He knew how to work the elevator and he knew exactly what it was."

         Both of her subordinates were surprised but realized that this was true.

         Meanwhile, you were now on the third floor and watching your back like your life depends on it, and for all you know, it does. You find a window at the end of the hallway your in. Quickly and cautiously, you made your way to the window and looked down to find a street view. You hadn't noticed it before, but apparently their idea of transportation wasn't too different from the world you knew. They had, garbage trucks, semis, sports cars, and anything else you would find in the human version of, well, the world. As you were observing the public transportation system of this world you felt something behind you. Before you could turn around you heard a feminine but commanding voice shout "FREEZE!"

         You turned around slowly to find the wolf and her two officers approaching you from behind you. While she remained unarmed as far as you could tell, the two leopards were pointing what you assumed to be handguns at you. You slowly put your hands up in a surrendering fashion.

         "Mmhmm... that's what I thought" The wolf said as she approached you "You're not as dumb as you want us to believe. You can understand me cant you?" You narrowed your eyes and grunted in response knowing that they were on to you.

Well, cat's out of the bag. So what are ya gonna do now?

11111.content:
"Yes." You reply after a second.

"Now, since we've got that in order, you are going to have to come with us." The wolf stated.

"Why?" You retort. The strong-willed Kiba may be cooperating, but not just with anyone, and deep in your gut you feel that them pointing... whatever they have in their... paws, at you, is not a good start. However the wolf may be disgruntled, she hasn't made any aggressive moves towards you. She has only pointed out you were smart.

"You're being taken to the station for questioning." She responded.

"Why?" You repeat. The context of 'being taken in for questioning' was completely and utterly wrong. "You just found out that I'm intelligent, likewise, and as you said before, you don't really know what I am, a mythical thingy to you. Do you even know what I can do?" You continue. The wolf looks at her officers for reassurance as they adjust themselves.

Before the wolf could speak, you continued. "I'm willing to cooperate, but don't take that as a 'best friends' thing; I've just discovered a new species for myself- literally every living, breathing thing I've passed so far seems to be different. I don't know where I am, and you don't know how dangerous I am-" the wolf motioned for her officers to move forward. "so don't come closer, yet." You sigh as you finish your sentence.

"Is that a threat?" The wolf responded, then shook her head, "Fine, when we get to the station, I'll explain a bit." The leopards look at the wolf and then back to you. They are about four feet away from you. Her wording sounded off, as if she didn't even take the hint that she should be cautious.

"Hey- what do I look like to you? I don't look like anyone here, and I'm shorter, and different. No caution whatsoever? Just gonna, oh, take a mythical thingy in for 'questioning'?" You said sarcastically.

"Don't tell me how to do my job- just-" She sighs. One leopard pulls out a handcuff, and then realizes you won't fit, and you'll just slip out of it. So you're just guided between a triad of animals.

11113.content:
Kiba turns back and looks at the window behind him once more. He notices a garbage truck about to pass by, and thinks to himself "Am I really considering this?" A second after he thinks that, he launches himself out of the window. Now free falling down to what seems like certain death, he lands on top of the garbage truck with surprisingly great accuracy and breaks his fall.

"I can't believe i just did that and survived" he thought to himself.

Meanwhile, the wolf and her constituents are in absolute shock.

"Did he just....?" one of the leopards started to say in astonishment.

"Yes he did" the wolf interrupted in an annoyed tone. "We have to find that human and fast. We have no idea what he's crazy enough to do... (sigh) this is going to be more complicated than i anticipated." the wolf said.


"Ah, my arm" Kiba said while riding atop the garbage truck. He had already traveled about 6 miles on the truck and nobody had noticed. That was partly due to the fact that he had disguised himself with the many unique trash items piled around him. It was a very disgusting place to be, especially because the smell itself could make someone pass out, but it was a much better alternative to the prison cell he could be in right about now.

"I hope i didn't break it" Kiba said under his breath. "I need to get home. I don't know how i ended up here but i have a feeling this has to do with something bigger than me." Kiba thought to himself.

Right as he finished thinking that, the garbage truck came to a hard stop. It had arrived at what seemed to be a landfill of some sort. It was dark outside by now so it wasn't all too easy to see. It definitely looked like a landfill though. The only weird thing about it though was on the far left side. It almost looked like a large modern style house. It was completely white with more than enough windows wrapping around what seemed to be a living room. An extensive marbled driveway adorned by a perfectly symmetrical row of detailed topiary. It even had a grand infinity pool on the right side!

"What kind of person could possibly live in such a nice house right next to a landfill?" Kiba thought to himself.

As he was observing the grand house, Kiba notices a limo driving up the marbled driveway to the front doors of the house.

"Who is that?" Kiba thought to himself as he was trying to straighten himself out of his crouched position.

Out of the limo had appeared to be a nine tailed fox in a business outfit. She was even bigger than the wolf he had been encountered by earlier, only by a couple of feet, and she gave off a cold aura. Her golden eyes were masked by a set of frameless, oval shaped reading glasses which had a light tent of purple. She wore purple business slacks and a blazer to match, her foot paws could be seen poking out of the bottom of each pant leg. Under the blazer, she had a white shirt and purple tie. Her hair was brunette and stopped at about her shoulders. Behind her, nine regal tails swayed about in a calm yet unsettling manor.

She very confidently walked from the limo to the front doors of what appeared to be her house. Instead of opening the doors and going right into her house though, she stopped right as she touched the door handle and gazed in your direction. Afraid of being seen, Kiba resumes his crouched position but just because he can't see that well, doesn't mean he can't hear.

" Is something wrong miss?" the
chauffeur asked.

"No, Hugo... But do you ever get the feeling that someone is watching you?" she asked the chauffeur.

"No ma'am" said Hugo the chauffeur.

"Of course you wouldn't" said the fox in a rushed tone "nevermind me, you're dismissed for the day" the fox said as she opened the door to her house.

"Thank you ma'am" Hugo said as he turned to get back into the limo.

Once the fox was inside her house and the chauffeur had driven off, Kiba straightened himself again. The garbage truck revved it's engines and began to move forward into the landfill. After scoping out the area and observing that there was no one else out and about, Kiba decided to jump out of the garbage truck into a nearby pile of garbage. He scanned the area around him, looking for something useful, and happened to find an old mattress propped up against a pile of garbage. It even had a small makeshift canopy built over it. Kiba looked around once more to see if whomever built this still lived there. After waiting in a nearby pile for about fifteen minutes, Kiba concluded that it was safe.

"I guess it wouldn't hurt to camp out here until the morning." Kiba reasoned.

That being said, he went to go sit up on the old but surprisingly comfortable mattress and unintentionally dozed off into a light sleep.

111131.content:
When Kiba woke the next morning he found that he was not alone. A grey and black raccoon was watching him with an expression that could only be described as suspicious. He was wearing a dirty blue t-shirt and denim blue jeans. He looked like he would've been a couple of years older tan Kiba. But it was hard to tell, given the species gap. He had black fur around his hands and eyes. His tell had stripes of both grey and black fur like you'd expect to find on most raccoons. His eyes were brown and his fur was mangy and unkempt. "What in the world do you think you are?" The raccoon asked.

         "Um... human?" Kiba replied, unsure of the reaction he might get.

         "Human, huh? Never heard of one of those. Do you taste good?" The raccoon asked.

         "I don't think so..." Kiba replied starting to wonder if he should be concerned for his safety.

         "Well I suppose I'll just take your word for it, still though. Don't you get any ideas about eating any of my food or taking my valuables!" The raccoon warned as he pointed at a pile of trash that was indistinguishable from the other piles.

         "You don't have to worry, I'm not interested in any of your... um... valuables," Kiba replied. A thought then crossed his mind "This raccoon may be a bit crazy. But he probably knows more about what's going on around here than I do... Kiba then turned to the raccoon, "Actually, I was wondering if you could tell me who lives in that house."

         The raccoon gave you a perplexed look, "You mean that mansion? That's Mayor Deluma's place. Everybody knows that!"

         Kiba shrugged and chuckled awkwardly, "Sorry, I'm not from around here. I'm trying to get home and I was wondering if she could help..."

         "Well, I guess that would be why I've never seen an anthro like you before. As for Deluma helping you she might or she might have you killed like that other poor guy..." The raccoon continued.

         Kiba was now confused, "She had him killed? Was he a criminal?"

         "Don't know," The raccoon replied as he shrugged his shoulders, "But I don't have time to be answering these questions about things that concern city folk."

         "Er... okay?" Kiba shrugged.

         "You can stay here for now, but don't think your gonna live here. I got family coming into town tomorrow!"

         "I see," Kiba muttered, "Then I'll be on my way by the end of the day."

         The raccoon nodded, "Hmph, see that ya are! And don't even think about taking any of my furniture! It's mine! I found it so I own it!"

         Kiba rolled his eyes, "Okay, fine I won't touch it!" This seemed to be enough to appease the raccoon as he scampered over a hill of garbage to do whatever it was that he did.

while Kiba was trying to come up with a strategy to get into the house an opportunity presented itself to him as an anthro shark opened the back door. She had brown skin with a white underbelly. Several sharp teeth lined her maw while a rather sleek and subtle find protruded from her back.overall she had a rather slim and sleek form. But it was also clear that she was also a predator. 111131211.content:
Kiba quietly and briskly begin searching for a way upstairs when he found it in the form of a grand staircase with wooden stairs. He cast another glance toward the back door to make sure that he the shark woman was still outside. The splashes in the pool indicated that she was still swimming and he was clear to head up. The human ascended the stairs like lithely and silently as though he were only a shadow. Upon reaching the top of the stairs he found himself at the end of a large and long hallway. Their were two door on either side and one at the very end. He then realized that he was standing in the center of another intersecting hallway, putting two more doors two his right and left at. Each about thirty feet away. There were a total of seven rooms to search up on this floor alone. But the Kiba also knew that he wouldn't have to search all of them, he just had to search until he found the office.

         "Given the layout of this hallway and how conceited and prideful Deluma seems to be, I'd bet that it's that door at the end of the hall," He thought as he made his way towards the door. Every few steps he'd check behind him, fearing that the shark or Deluma herself might make an unannounced visit. After what felt like several minutes, he made it to the door only to find it locked. Jiggling the knob and putting a little force behind the door he realized very quickly that he wasn't going to get in that way. "Argh.... what now?" He muttered as he leaned against the wall and shut his eyes to think. However, he found it difficult to do so with The air conditioner blowing just behind him. His eyes then shot open as he spun around. A tall wooden cabinet sat in the wall in front of him, and below it, there was a large grate. Feeling around the edges and looking at the frame itself, the human realized that it was a pop-out, meaning with enough force he could pry the grate off and replace it without anybody knowing. He positioned his fingers in the grate in an attempt to pull it off using his nails to grip it, but quickly realized there was a far better chance of him ripping his nails of than pulling the grate out. He sat and thought for a moment before his eyes lit up with an idea. Feeling his pockets he reached in and found what he was hoping he still had; his keys. Using his keychain bottle opener, he pried the right side of the grate off. After working his fingers under the frame he was able to easily pop the grate out of place.

         Looking into the cool, dark hole he took in a breath of air, "Here we go," he murmured as he climbed in sideways. He then pulled the grate up with the arm closest to it and used both hands, gripping it with his finger nails, to pull it loosely back into its slot. He then turned to begin crawling down the dark passage. Inside the duct it was cool, dark, loud and windy. Kiba moved along slowly, feeling out a few feet ahead of himself as he moved along. The metal floor felt grimy and cool to his touch as he crawled painfully along with his knees digging into the steel that lie beneath him. He suddenly came to a halt when his hand struck a metal wall. He then felt the airflow change as it was now also being drawn in from his left and his right. "The air is different here, its being drawn up. Looking to either side of him he saw a light on each end. He opted to turn left, given that from his position outside the vent that seemed to be where the office vent would have been located. After a few seconds he makes it to the vent grate and starts to push it out. When the vent grate falls to the floor with a less than quiet 'Clang' Kiba finds...

1111312112.content:
Finding himself in a bedroom, Kiba sighed in frustration. He needed to be in Deluma’s office not her bedroom. He turned to go back into the vent before he paused. He began to think that maybe this wasn’t a total waste. After all, most people kept their valuables close. Some people even slept with there most treasured keepsakes under their pillow. After the thought lingered in his mind for a moment, Kiba began tearing into the room.

         ”There has to be something,” He muttered. He checked the closet, the dresser drawers, the rugs and even under the pillow and found nothing. The human ran a hand through his hair as he stared at the mess that he had made. In all his effort he didn’t turn up a single useful clue that could help him. He was still just as confused and lost as he was the night before, only now he was actually in the bedroom of the person that was hunting for him. Figuring the best thing to do would be to cover his tracks, Kiba began putting everything back the way it was when he found it. It took time, but eventually he finished. Just as he was turning to leave, he froze. He found the shark woman from earlier standing in the doorway with a toothy grin on her face.

         ”Hiya!” She says in a bright and pleasant tone. Her hair is black with orange highlights and hung down at shoulder length, while her eyes have an orange color along with slitted pupils. She was tall, far taller than you were. She was seven feet tall, at least. Of course, that was about how tall Deluma was so no surprise there. A large tail could be seen swaying behind her while she flexed her webbed hands along with her clawed digits at the end of them. “Seems you were busy,” The woman continued, “It’s rather inapropriate to go through someone else’s belongings without permission. Though, it is nice that you cleaned up after yourself.”

         Kiba remained on edge, he inched along the wall. Trying to keep his distance from her while slowly making his way to the vent.

         The shark smirked and casually swung her tail to the side before resting it against the vent. “What’re you gonna do now?” She asked as Kiba scowled at her. “I don’t suppose you’d consider giving yourself up? That would be the more reasonable thing to do, but after what I saw on the news last night I doubt that you’ll be doing that.

         Kiba sighed, “Okay, you caught me,” Ray sighed as he began walking towards the shark.

         The shark frowned somewhat putout by the sudden surrender, “Well... that was dissapointing.”

         However, no sooner than the words left her lips did Kiba throw a pillow at her face. Reacting out of instinct the shark caught it while Kiba dove head first and slid between her legs and out of the bedroom door. Of course, it doesn’t take long for the large predator to register what’s happened, but by the time she does, Kiba is already halfway down the stairs.

         The shark runs to the first step before stopping and taking a few steps back. By now, Kiba is almost down to the last step when a rush of wind and large shadow glide overhead. The predator that he thought he had outsmarted was now crouched in front of him at the bottom of the stairs. She grinned at him in an almost playful manner, “What else do you have up your sleeve?” She asked as she took a step toward him. Kiba bolted over the side of the railing and made a run for the back door. He could hear the aquatic huntress chasing behind him as he ran through the house. He reached the backdoor and turned the handle. But just as he opened the door, a large gray hand planted itself on the door above his head and slammed it shut. “You can’t leave now! We’re just starting to have some fun!” The shark chuckled. The human turrned to run off again but found himself caught by his shirt collar. “Now then, I think we should get to know each other better...”

1112.content:
"Y-yes... I can understand you" you reply. You're still trying to understand what's happening but so far, you're doing a great job of keeping it together... In your opinion at least.

"Remarkable" the wolf gasped.

"What's remarkable?" Ask genuinely confused at her question.

"You, you speak perfect zoplage, dispite the fact that your a completely different species!" The wolf exclaimed. However, she soon remembered that she was in a public setting and on duty. She knew that you were an incredible discovery (to them at least) and this was history in the making for her world, but as an officer, duty came first. She took a brief moment to compose herself before regarding you once more. "I have to take you into custody now."

You stare up at the wolf dubiously, "Custody?" You ask, "Why?"

The wolf, seeing you were frightened, tried to calm you, "it's not that you've done anything wrong, it's just that I'm concerned that some of the less civilized or more questionable citizens here in this city may take advantage of you being defenseless and disoriented."

"I see...." You reply confused.

"Good," The wolf gave a gentle smile and stood back up to her full height. You only came up to just above her stomach, if that. Looking at the crowd you start to realize that even though she is one of the bigger anthros, just about all of the anthros outsized you more than a little bit.

"We still haven't been formally introduced, I'm Captain Luna Barker, but you can call me Luna," 'Luna' said as she smiled down on you.

"It's nice to officially meet you Luna," You reply, "I'm-"

"-A very interesting specimen" a new voice interrupts. The crowd and officers turn to see who had spoken. Not far from where you were, a limo had pulled up, the back door was already open and standing before you in a business outfit was a nine tailed fox. She was even bigger than Luna, only by a couple of feet, and she gave of a cold aura. Her golden eyes were masked by a set of frameless, oval shaped reading glasses which had a light tent of purple. she wore purple business slacks and a blazer to match, her foot paws could be seen poking out of the bottom of each pant leg. Under the blazer, she had a white shirt and purple tie. Her hair was brunette and stopped about at her shoulders. Behind her, nine regal tails swayed about in a calm yet unsettling manor. Her voice was very smooth and calm, yet it had a powerful resonance behind it. "Allow me to introduce myself; I am Silvia Deluma, and I own everything in this city and the region around it.... Including you," She stated with a toothy smile. She then leveled her head and peered down on you through her glasses while extending a hand toward you, palm up, "and you are?"

(From this point on you will become one of three characters, each of which has a different personality and skillset)

Kiba Lockheart- Adventurous and very athletic, hates to be contained and loves to explore. He's kind to everyone he meets unless they're hostile towards him. Despite the fact that he likes to avoid fighting, he isn't afraid to fight if he has to defend himself. He's very modest and easygoing, but hates dishonesty and won't tolerate anyone pushing him around. While he can be curious, he also has a strong sense of caution that will prioritizes his well being over indulging his curiosity. He also is a lot less likely to start a fight that he can't win than he is to surrender and wait for his opportunity to turn the tables. He's not incredibly social as he tends to be shy around new people, but he warms up to most after a while.

Terra Westfield- A strong willed and high strung girl who comes from a family of acrobats. While she never actively took up the family business, she still retains her skills as a gymnast. She's very sarcastic when she becomes annoyed (which happens frequently) but she's also smarter than she seems. When she chooses to fight, she likes to fight on her own turf in an area she either knows well or has prepped beforehand. She's a bit of a loner so she lacks social skills but she's not at all a lone wolf.

From your point of view it looked like she had a few inches on her daughter in height, which meant she was somewhere around eight and a half feet tall.

         "I'm trying to get him to lay back down but he just won't! The more I try to force him the harder he pushes!" The younger fox frantically explains.

         "Oh? It seems we have a fighter on our hands don't we?" Her mother replied with a smile. "Here, let me handle it sweetheart," She says as she walks over and replaces her daughter at the bedside. You start to give her a defiant glare but she just smiles and wraps one of each of her tails around your wrists and gently starts to slide your hands forward. Slowly but surely, the pressure of your upper body weight is being shifted to your back and abdomen. You can't maintain your upright position and slowly start to lay back. You fight it though, tightening your stomach muscles to slow your decent to the mattress like a wrestler refusing to be pinned. "My, my... you are a feisty one aren't you? It's no wonder that you survived that fall with a spirit like yours!" The white fox chuckled. "Lay down and rest, no one's going to cause you harm here. We'll take care of you, you've done a fine job of surviving. It's time to rest now."

         Her words were so gentle, but you didn't know who she was or where you were. There where questions that had to be answered, you couldn't afford to sleep yet. Unfortunately, you found that your body was agreeing with the fox woman. "No... I can't sleep... Deluma will... find me..." You moaned trying to resist the urge to sleep.

          The white fox shook her head and laid your head on the pillow before putting a finger to your lips, "Shhh... she won't find you, not if we have anything to say about it... now sleep..."

         "Have to... keep moving..." You murmured before once again, succumbing to sleep.

         "I have to say..." The white fox said as she stood up, "He's quite the feisty fighter. I've seen quite a few strong willed kids in my time but none like this one. And he's a human no less, I must admit that if I were in his shoes I would have surrendered long ago."

         "You should've seen him last night! He actually tried to run from us!" The younger fox exclaimed.

         Her mother shook her head, "The poor thing, he's been trying so hard to survive and stay ahead of the Deluma and her police that he's run himself ragged."

         "I'm going to stay and watch him in case he wakes up again," The red fox stated.

         "I think that would be wise, who knows what he would attempt if we didn't watch him. I'll go and see if I can make him something to eat" The white fox decided as she left the room.

111211211.content:
After a few hours, you wake up yet again. You sit straight up in the bed and not too long after that, pain begins coursing through your body. You groan in pain putting you're weight on your good arm's elbow to support yourself. The red fox rushes over immediately and gently tries to lay you back down.

         "Shh... You're okay, just lay back down..." She says as she uses one paw to support you're back and the other to carefully press on your chest to force you back down. You decide at this point, if they wanted to hurt you or turn you over that they would have done that by now. Of course, that still doesn't mean that you trust them... not completely anyway. Once you're down again the fox stands up straight and looks down at you with compassion in her eyes. "So... are you hungry?" She asks. You don't say anything and look away from her but she persists, "Do you have a name?" She asks. You continue to look away from her quietly, "I heard you talk already right before mom put you back to sleep so I know you can," She informs you. You still don't reply, eventually she gives up and starts to leave. You decide that you can't just ignore her, and you don't want to be on bad terms with anyone else. You're already on bad terms with Deluma and the police force, look where that got you.

         "I am a little hungry," You quietly admit. Her ears twitch as soon as she hears your words before she turns around and rushes to your bedside.

         "Did you say you were hungry?" She asks, her eyes filled with hope and excitement.

         "Y-yes..." You answer.

         "My mom is cooking you something right now, if you're patient she'll have it up here in just a bit..." the fox replied.

         "Oh... Thank you..." You reply, not sure how to react. "I... don't mean to be rude, but could you tell me where I am and who you are... and... what happened?"

         The fox anthro grins at you, "I'll tell you what, how about a deal hmm? I'll answer any question you can think of for the next ten minutes. After that you have to answer all of my questions. That sounds fair right? So do we have a deal?"

         "Deal" You reply with a nod.

         "Well what would you like to know first?" The fox asked, as her tail swayed from side to side calmly.

         "What's your name?" You ask.

         "How rude of me not to tell you! I'm Shira" The fox replied, "And the fox that put you to bed earlier was my mother 'Tonya'."

         "I see..." You nod, "And where am I exactly?" You ask.

         "You're in the guest bedroom of our house," Shira explained, "We brought you here after you fell through our skylight. My boss and I smuggled you out as a late night food delivery and the police never caught on. Though they did search the store for you and they know that you were there, but they have no clue where you are now."

         "And once you got my back here you treated my injuries..." You realized.

         Shira nodded, "You were banged up pretty bad, you were lucky not to have broken anything."

         You then have a brief flashback and recall your fall... "Yeah, not one of my finer moments..." you admit. "I have one more question... why help me?"

         Shira looks shocked and taken aback, "Why?" She asked, "You were injured, defenseless and being hunted down. For us, that's reason enough. We couldn't just leave you to fend for yourself..." You open your mouth to ask another question but Shira wags a finger in your face, "Ah, ah, ah" She chides, "Your time is up, it's time to hold up your end of the deal. You sigh and nod in agreement.

          So what's her first question? Or will her mother come in and interrupt the Q and A session?

1112112112.content:
Before Shira can ask you any questions, her mother returns with a bowl of soup in hand. "Oh good, you're awake!" She says as she smiles warmly at you in the way that only a mother could. "How are you feeling?" She asks.

         "I feel better, thank you..." You reply.

         "Good, I've brought you some vegetable soup. It'll help you get your strength up" She says as she brings the bowl to you and sets it in your lap.

         "Thank you, I won't forget the hospitality you've shown me..." You tell her while staring into the bowl of soup.

         Tonya looks at you confused and tilts her head slightly, "You talk as if you're going to leave."

         "Well I am," You reply, "I should be well enough to leave by tomorrow night, and you've done more than enough for me by taking me in and tending to my injuries."

         Tonya folded her arms and gave you a stern look, "If you think you're leaving tomorrow in you're condition, you've got another thing coming. There's no way that you'll be well enough to go back out on your own in a week, let alone a day. How far do you honestly think that you'll make it without a place to rest or without any medical care for your injuries?"

         "I'll manage," You reply, "My injuries aren't that serious and I can look after them myself."

         Tonya raised an eyebrow in response, "And while you're busy looking down at your bloody arm and wrapping it, how will you see the police coming to snatch you off the street? Hmm?"

         You opened your mouth to respond, but paused as she had a valid point. Still, you couldn't spend a whole week laying in bed. You needed to find out what was going on and start working on a way to get home. "I escaped them once, I can do it again" You state confidently.

         Tonya deadpanned while before leaning down so that her snout was level with your face, "You weren't injured when you escaped the first time, and you only got out of that mess with the help of my daughter and her boss. And on top of that, how many times do you think you'll be fortunate enough to escape even if you do manage to get away the first time?"

         You look away from her, unsure of how to answer her question, you didn't want to admit it but she was right. At the same time though, you knew that if you could find a place to lay low you could still manage on your own without involving anyone else in your problems. That's what really bothered you the most about the whole situation, you hated that these two anthros were having to go out of there way to care for you. You didn't want to bother them with your troubles any more than you already had. Besides that, you hated the fact that you were having to depend on them, you were an independent person. It pained you to need to rely on someone else. Not because of pride or ego... but because you genuinely felt that if you relied on someone too much, you'd either become a burden for them or be shattered when they suddenly weren't there for you anymore, regardless of the reason. With these thoughts swirling around in your mind you felt that you had to leave this home, you couldn't leave the situation as it was, "I think I'll be fine, so long as I find a place to lay low and make sure that I cover my tracks..."

         Tonya didn't reply right away, but instead seemed to think for a minute before a sly look briefly flashed across her muzzle. It was only there for a moment before it was replaced by a disappointed expression, "Well..." She sighed, "I guess I can't change your mind. I may not agree with you're decision but its your choice."

         Shira stared at her mother in disbelief, "Mom! You can't-"

         "Shira," Tonya sternly interjected, "You know how things work around here. This is no different than when you tried to leave the house after you graduated."

         Shira's eyes seemed to light up for a moment before returning to a darkened and disappointed stare of disbelief. Shira sighed before nodding, "I understand."

         "Good," Tonya replied before standing to her full height and regarding you again, "We'll leave you alone now, if you need anything don't hesitate to call us. I'll check on you later on tonight." With that, both Tonya and Shira left the room.

What now?

11121121122.content:
"I guess this is it," You mutter to yourself as you get out of bed and dress yourself in your clothes from before. Shira had washed them for you and returned them to your bedside when you had fallen asleep the night before. You carefully put your shirt and jeans on so as not to aggravate any of your injuries. The good news there was that because anthros were animal based, they naturally had an instinctual knowledge of plants and the way the body works. Because of this, the natural remedies that they came up with and their treatments were far more effective than they were back home. So injuries that should have been in the early stages of healing, were actually in their last stages. Despite this advantage, you still had one or two injuries that would impede your physical performance and cause you pain but nothing that would keep you in a bed.

         Once dressed, you make your way out of the room that you'd been bedridden in for the past three days, when you exit the room you find yourself in a hallway with carpeted stairs leading downstairs to your left. The hallway continued on you right with two more doors before hitting a dead end at a window. You head down the stairs and find yourself at a wall when you reach the bottom which forces you to turn to your right. There you are faced with another hallway that has one open entryway on the left and another on the right. And at the end of the hallway you find Tonya standing in front of what you assume to be the front door.

         "I take it your all set to go?" She asks with a faint smile.

         "Yeah," You reply. "Thanks for everything you've done for me, I mean it. I can't tell you how much what you've done means to me."

         Tonya gives a dismissive wave before giving you a warm grin, "Oh it was no trouble at all dear."

         "Are you sure you won't change your mind about staying with us?" Shira asks from behind you.

         You turn around to find her standing in the hallway behind you, she looks sad... but there's something else about her expression that you can't put you're finger on. It seems almost like she's showing a bit of... remorse? You dismiss it from your mind, "Yes, I'm sure. I've burdened you two enough and besides that I need to figure out where I am and how to get home.

         "Well, if that's the way you feel..." Tonya sighed.

         You nodded, "It is..." You walk towards the door, but Tonya doesn't move. You think its odd but ignore it as you reach for the doorknob. Before your fingers can even touch it, one of Tonya's tails moves in front of the doorknob preventing you from touching it. "Um... could you please move so I can go?" You ask as politely as possible.

         "Sorry," Tonya says as she shakes her head, "No can do sweetie."

         "Wait what?" You ask in disbelief.

         Tonya shrugged before explaining herself, "I'm not letting you leave this house so that Deluma's officers can hunt you down and drag you away to who knows where."

         "We've been over this though!" You reply, "I told you that I'd be fine and you said that if I wanted to leave, then that was my choice."

         Tonya nodded, "That's exactly what I said. I said that I couldn't change your mind either. But I never said that I wasn't going to stop you."

         You stare at Tonya in disbelief, "So what you're saying is, unless I can get past you you're-"

         "-Going to keep you right here in this house where its safe..." Shira finished, "For you're own safety."

         "We can't let you go out there on your own in good conscience... this is our decision," Tonya stated.

The ball's in your court, its your move. What're you gonna do kid?

You back away from Tonya, but only for a moment. "I'm not going to let you stop me," You warn.

         "And I'm not going to let you by me," Tonya replied.

         Your eyes scan over her looking for any advantage you can use. But initially all you can come up with are disadvantages to yourself. Tonya starts to slowly advance towards you and away from the door. You see this as the opportunity that you'd been waiting for. You see a small gap between her and the wall. You figure that if you can stay low enough, you can use the size difference between you and her to your advantage. You sprint for Tonya head on, planning to break left at the last possible minute with a dive. Tonya spreads her arms and legs to block as much of the hallway as she can. You don't slow down though, when you get close enough you dive for the gap between her body and the wall.

         "Oh! That's quite clever!" Tonya admitted.

         Your expression saddens slightly as you think about how they must feel. They're only trying to protect you and your about to- "Oof!" Your shot into complete disarray as you feel something connect with your chest. It didn't feel hard, it actually felt like someone hit you with a pillow. But the force behind the impact was so strong that it stopped you in midair and caused you to fall facedown on the ground at Tonya's feet. You look up to see Tonya lowering her left hand back down to her side. "How'd you know I'd dive left?" You ask as you get to your feet and retreat to a safe distance where she couldn't reach you... or so you thought.

         "I didn't," Tonya admitted with a sheepish smile, "I just used my tails to cover the areas I couldn't." Her smile then faded and turned to a sly grin, "If you want to get through this door your going to have to fight me." You must have looked reluctant because she actually laughs, "Oh don't worry dear, you won't hurt me."

         "Well... if your sure..." You reply as you charge up to her. Before you can even reach her though, her tails actually extend in length. You don't have any measuring tape handy on you, but you'd guess that they were now about twelve feet in length. "What in the-" You cut yourself off was one of her tails makes a low sweep for your feet. You stop immediately and pull you feet up off of the ground so that your basically crouching in mid air. Her second tail comes straight for your mid section and you drop to the ground on your stomach to evade it. It then comes down on you like a newspaper squishing a bug on the table. You roll out of the way and jump back up on your feet. Once your on your feet you find Tonya herself closing in on you to pounce on you. You backstep to avoid her form which now covered the area that you were standing on a few seconds ago. You would think that because she's anthropomorphic, she'd be as awkward as a human would be on all fours. But to your surprise she actually seems comfortable and closes the gap like a normal fox would. She stalks up to you faster than you can dive out of the way and while your still moving your body she actually goes back to a typical standing stance before back handing you with her left hand. She didn't hit you too hard, but she still knocked you off of your feet and through the entryway to her left.

         You fall with a thud onto your back, but you keep your momentum going and yourself backwards like a ball and back onto your feet where you once again assume a defensive fighting stance. "Impressive," Tonya notes with a genuine spark of interest in her eye, "I wasn't expecting you to recover so quickly," She says as her tails strike out at you, one after the other.

         "And I wasn't..." You pause to duck under one of her tails, "Expecting your tails... to... become tentacle whips, WHOA! JEEZ!" You exclaim as her tails begin rapid firing at you, aiming to knock you onto your back again. You back step away from her once again and bump into something soft. You turn your head to find Shira standing directly behind you. She grabs you right wrist, but you move your body away from her before she can get your left. She sweeps her foot against your feet in an effort to make you lose your footing, but you use the arm that she's holding to support yourself. Eventually, she yanks you towards her before wrapping you in a bear hug and tackling you to the ground all in one swift motion. Now, your pinned facedown to the ground underneath her body.

         Tonya's tails recede to their normal length as she walks over to where your pinned. From your point of view, all you can see is a pair of white paws with black claws. "Now then..." She begins, "If you couldn't get by Shira and I, how are you going to avoid the entire police force?"

         You grunt in annoyance knowing that she's right. There were only two of them, one of which didn't really even do anything. And on top of that, you were in your element, a tight enclosed space where your size was your biggest advantage. You struggle to get up and squirm and writhe underneath Shira, but you can't get her to budge. In fact, she laughs because you somehow tickle her with all your movement.

         "Don't feel too bad dear," Tonya continues, "You actually did a lot better than I expected."

         "Yeah!" Shira added, "You were way more agile than those humans in the books and the stories!"

Well, you gave it your best go right? And you managed to impress the two vixens. But you still lost, however the question is are you ready to accept that or will you continue to struggle?

You continue to twist and writhe under Shira's body. However, despite your effort you simply aren't strong enough to lift yourself up under her weight or pull yourself free. Still though, you refuse to give up and continue your struggles.

         Shira sighed, "Your only going to tire yourself out, just give up already."

         After another few minutes of struggling, you face the cold hard fact that she's right, there's absolutely no way for you to break free of her. In addition to that, your best chance for survival probably meant you staying right where you were. "Fine... I give..." You groan as you lay face down and rest from your struggles.

         Shira's ears perk up and she rolls off of you slightly, "What was that?" She asks.

         "I give... you win... I'll stay..." You reply with a defeated sigh.

         Shira looks down at you sympathetically as her mom comes into the room. "I think that's a very wise decision."

         "It was a forced choice," You reply, "One that probably saved my hide though..."

         "Well, since your staying, we'd better lay down some ground rules," Tonya said as she raised a hand to her chin. Most of what she listed was common sense stuff like 'don't go outside' and 'stay away from open windows.' The rest of the night proceeded relatively quietly. You all sat down and ate dinner together, which was pasta. You loved pasta, and the fact that Shira's mom could cook, made it that much better. Shira and Tonya would ask you the occasional question about your life back home and what you thought of their world in comparison. You answered their questions to the best of your ability, but most of them where viewpoint questions, so there really wasn't a right or wrong answer.

         After dinner, Tonya officially declares it bedtime. "But I'm not tired, and its not even that late..." You argue. Tonya then gives you a sly and confident look that says 'you can get in your bed or I can put you in your bed, choose wisely.' At that point you decide to reevaluate your stand on the matter. "However, getting a goodnight's rest is important for humans with injuries." You then excuse yourself from the table and head up to your room.

11121121122111.content:
Later that night, you lay in your bed thinking about your current predicament. You really hadn't had an opportunity to think about it before, but now that you were safe and everything had slowed down a bit, you were able to fully grasp the gravity of your situation. You honestly couldn't sleep, seeing as this was the case you rolled yourself out of bed and quietly slipped downstairs doing your best not to wake either vixen. When you get downstairs you wonder around for a bit until you find the living room. It had two large couches in it and a coffee table as well. There was a large cupboard on the wall which you assumed to be some kind of entertainment center. There was only one window in the room and it had blinds and curtains draped about it so that it was safe for you to sit in the room without fear of discovery from the neighbors.

         You sat silently for what felt like hours before tears started to stream from your face as you realized that you could be stuck here for the rest of your life. However, that wasn't quite as bad as knowing that where you came from your life wasn't exactly picture perfect there either. In fact you were having a difficult time there as well. But at least where you came from you didn't have an evil anthromorphic kitsune with the strength of ten men out to get you. While you were lost in thought about what to do, a noise from the hallway startled you. You snapped your head up to find Shira standing in the doorway wearing white pajamas with a urgent expression on her face, "Kiba!" She hissed, "What are you doing down here? If mom finds you out of bed she'll flip and... and...." Her expression changed from urgent to concerned as she saw the tears in your eyes. "Hey, what's wrong?" She asked as she approached you.

         You wipe your tears off your face and into your sleeve, "Nothing," You reply, "I'm fine."

         Shira raised an eyebrow at this as she continued to draw near you, "If you were a wolf that lie might've been more convincing."

         "I'm just thinking, that's all..." You assure her.

         "About what?" She presses as she sits down next to you while her tail wraps around your midsection and pulls you a bit closer to her while the tip of her tail rests in your lap. You can hear her heartbeat as your head is now pressed against her ribcage with both of your arms pinned to your side while one of her arms is wrapped around your body.

         "Stuff," You answer almost nonchalantly.

         Shira frowns and shoots you a glare, "Alright, I'm done playing catch a tiger by the toe," She states flatly, "Why were you crying and what's keeping you from telling me?" She demands sternly.

         "I was just thinking about what my life is going to be like here and if I'll ever get to go home," You tell her "Though I'm not sure I'd be better off there," You mutter under your breath.

         "What do you mean by that?" Shira asks. Apparently your last statement was loud enough for her sensitive ears to pickup.

         "Well, where I come from I'm not exactly doing all that well. I lost my job and my girlfriend, my siblings have no respect for me and my parents either don't care or don't know how what they say affects me. Not that any of that really matters because I may never get home to see my family ever again. And on the flip side how am I supposed to live here? I'm physically outmatched by nearly every occupant that lives in this world. Its a miracle that Deluma hasn't caught me yet. I feel like I'm all alone... no friends or family, and no other members of my kind to help me."

         Shira whimpers a little, similarly to the noise a puppy might make before turning and wrapping you in a hug, "I'm so sorry, I don't know why or how this happened to you. And I can't promise you a way home... But I promise that we'll take care of you, we'll be your family here."

         You aren't sure why but that seems to make you feel a lot better. "Thanks Shira," You reply as you try to return her hug the best you can, but lets face it; her arms almost wrap around your frame twice and her body about completely covers yours. You can't help but smile as you think about how silly it must look for an anthro to be hugging a human two thirds of her size that's sitting next to her. "This would look so awkward to someone walking by," You quietly chuckle.

         Unbeknownst to either of you, Shira's mom was watching and listening to the entire exchange from just behind the wall in the other room, "It doesn't look awkward to me..." She whispered with a warm smile before heading back to bed.

111211211221111.content:
Its been a week now and you've settled into your daily life in this world... er... reasonably well. Living with the two foxes has definitely gotten easier for you. Shira's mom; Tonya is pretty easy to predict for the most part... she's a mom. However, because she's a mom, she still has that whole 'no matter how old you are I have a way to deal with you' thing going on. So there are times when you know she has something planned, but you're never quite prepared for it. That being said, she's also a fox... so... yeah... playful/impish/cunning is all natural to her. Though, despite all this, Tonya genuinely is a kind and loving person albeit a bit strict at times.

         Shira's story is similar to her mother, again she's a fox, so the whole playful/impish/cunning thing is still there. However, she's also her mother's daughter, which means that she completely understands when you want to defy her every now and again. Primarily when you sneak out of the house. You're really not supposed to but its hard not to. You're cooped up in there all day everyday with nothing to do. But when you do sneak out to explore or just to get out for a bit, Shira usually covers for you. That's a double edge sword though because she also blackmails you from time to time with your 'extracurricular' activities. Though in the end, Shira isn't unlike the older sister you've always wanted but never had. You often spend time together when she comes home from work and watch movies late at night when she has the time and occasionally, you even team up against her mom to win arguments.

         Today is the start of your second month living with the two anthros whom have become your family in this strange new world. Currently, your reading a history report report to Tonya while she takes down notes and grades the reports, Tonya was a teacher so she often brought home papers to grade. You, having nothing better to do, sometimes read the reports to her so that she can easily grade them and you can learn about the world you live in.

         "Well, that was the last one Kiba," Tonya said as she got up and stretched.

         "Good," You replied as you handed her the paper, "I'm starting to get board of reading these honestly."

         Tonya chuckled a bit as she got up from her desk before approaching you and ruffling your hair with her paw, "Well don't worry, I have some current event papers coming up pretty soon that I'll have to grade, and I'm sure that there'll be a lot of reports on you."

         You grin a bit, you feel somewhat like a newly discovered superhero. But you know in reality that your closer to a fugitive. "It'll be a welcome break from reading all of this stuff about the 'Wolf and Lamb Treaty' and 'The Battle of Stray Alley'" You scoff.

         Tonya laughs and nods before walking out of her bedroom and heading to the kitchen, "Make sure you have an appetite tonight, I'll be cooking a lot for dinner."

         "I will," You promise as you head upstairs, "I'm just going to take a quick nap before then!" You call back. You head to your room and close the door before locking it. When you turn around you find Shira standing directly in front of you grinning down at you. You yelp in surprise and nearly fall over, "Shira! That isn't funny, you scared the life out of me!"

         "Hmm... you look pretty alive to me" Shira chuckled.

         "Oh ha-ha very funny," You reply flatly.

         "Consider this payback for the time you rubbed that balloon all over my fur when I was asleep," She says as she walks past you and unlocks the door before slipping out of it. You immediately walk back over to it and close it. You then head over to the window, grabbing one of Shira's hoodies off of the bed along the way and making sure the coast is clear, you climb down the side of the house using the gutter drain pipe.

         Once you hit the ground, you don the hoodie and scamper around the house to the front yard. You easily climb over the fence and shove your hands in your pockets before walking along the sidewalk quietly. Its funny really, if you were to take your hoodie off right where you stood, it would only be minutes before a police squad was coming around the corner for you, but put on an oversized hoodie, hide your hands and face and everyone assumes your an anthro. You laugh to yourself about the concept before heading down towards the ocean. That was where you went when you snuck out the other times before hand, it was so peaceful and calming to watch the sea and listen to it and with night fast approaching, there was almost nobody there. It took you about an hour to make it to the beach. Once there you stood near the waterline and watched the waves roll in as the sun sank below the waves. You were never able to do this where you came from. Honestly it was a welcomed distraction from all that was currently going on in your crazy messed up life. You watch the waves for a little longer before someone calls out to you.

         "Hey you!" They shout. You turned your head keeping your face hidden well within the shadows of the hood.

Who is it that's calling for you?

1112112112211111.content:
Behind you, you find an anthro lynx standing behind you. By the looks of it, you think he's from some kind of S.W.A.T. team. He's wearing a tactical vest and utility belt. He's also wearing a pair of black field pants and tactical boots as well. He begins to approach you and as he does, you notice that he's only about an inch taller than you.

         "Good evening," He says as he approaches you.

         "Good evening," You return. You're not sure if he knows whether you're human or not but you figure its best to play it as if you were an anthro.

         "What brings you here tonight?" He questions as he stops a few feet away from you.

         "The view and sound of the sea," You reply, "It puts me at peace."

         "I see," The lynx replied.

         "And may I ask what brings a field officer here on this night?" You inquire.

         "I think you already know the answer to that human," The lynx stated with a smirk. You don't say anything as the wind blows between the two of you and the sound of the waves lapping at the shore continues as you stare each other down. "I guess I should explain that I'm with Deluma's H.R.T. or the Human Recovery Team."

         "Not standard police I take it," You return.

         "Not at all, in fact the regular police don't even know what we do. They just know to get out of our way when we're coming," The lynx replied. "But enough about me, you my friend have avoided the police for over a week now. That's a feet in itself, but you've managed to do better than that and kept yourself fed and healthy it looks like. What bothers me is that I just can't understand how such an average looking human's managed to do all of that on our turf."

         "Average looking?" You ask, then it hit you. He's with the Human Recovery Team, he's probably seen a couple of humans before... which would mean that your situation was not an isolated incident.

         "Yes," He replied, "I've had to hunt and catch many humans who were unusually athletic or strong... but you appear to be average." The lynx then sighs and shrugs, "I guess it doesn't really matter how you did it, in the end all humans are the same; afraid of harm and death." He then begins walking towards you and pulls out a pair of handcuffs from his belt, "Well, let's get this over with. Give me your hands..."

         "Gonna have to pass on that thanks," You reply.

         "Oh your resisting, what a surprise," The lynx says with mock shock. However, as he takes your hands and tries to put the handcuffs on you, you snatch both of your wrists out of his hand and deck him in his jaw. The lynx staggers backwards and drops his cuffs before holding a paw up to his jaw to see if you'd drawn blood while still staring at you in disbelief, "You hit me..." He murmured, "You actually hit me..."

         By now your hoodie had become useless, and as such you cast it off of you. "Well what did you expect?" You demand as you glare at him.

         The lynx snapped out of his stupor and put his cuffs away, "Honestly? I expected you to come quietly like all the others... or try to run away from me along the shoreline... but you're the first human who's ever hit me... it doesn't matter though, you'll give up like all the others in the end. But if you don't, I'll be forced to kill you."

         You grit your teeth and narrow your eyes at the lynx, "I'm not ready to die..." You admit causing the lynx to sprout a smug grin, "But I'm not afraid to die either," You continue.

         The lynx' grin faded at hearing your stern declaration, "That's brave talk coming from such an inferior creature," The lynx spat "I think its time you learned your place in the world human." He drew what looked like a baton which extended into a staff or rod type weapon with a tazer at its tip. You could easily see the ark of electricity flowing between the two prongs at its tip. He then pointed the dangerous end of the weapon at you, "Last chance to give up," The lynx warned.

         "Funny," You report, "I was about to say the same thing to you."

         "Just remember you brought this on yourself," The lynx growled.

         "Take your best shot," You spat.

         The lynx ran toward you, charging you like a knight with a lance. You waited until the last possible second to dive to you right while the lynx charged over your footprints in the sand before sliding to a stop on his feet. He turned to face you, but by then you had already begun running back towards the suburbs. He growled before giving chase. You knew that with the way things were currently going, you weren't going to outrun him... and now everyone on the streets is staring at you like when you first came here. But you can't afford to pay attention to them, you need to focus on what you're doing.

So, just a recap; S.W.A.T. lynx trying to capture you, running through the suburbs on the sidewalk to escape and every anthro that sees you feels the need to stop and stare at you... Did I get everything? Oh yeah, that's right! And your not even supposed to be out here because your forbidden from leaving Shira's house... Man... when it rains it pours huh? So what are ya gonna do? You know that you can't out run this guy.... and your not sure if you can fight him and win...

11121121122111112.content:
Honestly, what you want to do is knock the guy's lights out. But let's face it, the smart play here is to keep moving and only fight when necessary. That being said, you keep moving along the street casting a glance over your shoulder every so often to check his progress, you were only barely able to keep ahead of him, but you suspect that he's holding back for some reason. You return your attention to navigating through the pedestrians and lamp posts ahead of you. You cast a glance over your shoulder once more to find that your pursuer isn't behind you.

         Before you can even begin to wonder where he'd gone you feel a harsh impact from your left side. You feel like a snowplow hit you as you crash through the window of the restaurant you happened to be in front of. You bounce across a table and onto a bamboo chair while crushing it in the process and landing on a hardwood floor and slide across the ground along with shards of broken glass and pieces of bamboo until you come to a stop in the center of the restaurant. All of the patrons have stopped eating and turned their attention towards you, They're not who you're worried about though as you find the lynx walking in through the door. You slowly get to your feet and hold your right arm as it was sore from the impact against the glass window you went through.

         The Lynx looks you up and down for a moment before showing a small smile, "I'm impressed, you have good instincts human." Your confused by what he means and he obviously sees this so he continues, "Most of your kind would have tried to make their bodies stay still or stop after taking a fall like that. What they don't realize is that they put all of the force and weight of the impact on whatever part of their body they land on. You, however, allowed your body to roll with the force that I hit you with and therefore distributed the force of the impact."

         You grunt in response, "He must've hit me from the side when I was looking for him," You think as you watch him wearily.

         "Now then," The lynx continued as he drew and extended his tazer rod once more. "Now then, lets end this before I really have to hurt you."

         You glance around looking for someway to defend yourself as he approaches as you back away from him you feel something bump against your foot. You look down and find the pieces of bamboo from the chair you accidently broke. The ties that were holding the chair's form had broken, but the bamboo was still intact. You quickly grab two pieces of bamboo each equal to the length between your fingertips to your elbows and brandish them like swords. "The bamboo is light but strong, it won't break easily and on top of that its a type of wood which means that it wont conduct the electricity from the tazer should I strike its tip..." You thought.

         "Still refusing to surrender?" The lynx replied momentarily put out by your sudden defensive posture. He then renewed his approach, "It doesn't matter whether you run or fight," The lynx stated before raising his rod above his head and swinging it down on you with both arms. You crossed your bamboo 'swords' in an 'x' and stopped his rod just above your head. He drew back and attempted to thrust you in chest which you blocked again using a single bamboo pole, deflecting the dangerous tip away from your torso. The lynx growled and faster than you could've anticipated he lunged at you while still drawing back from his last attack. His shoulder smashed into your chest sending you into the wall on the far side of the restaurant. You shake the dizziness out of your head and glance up to find the lynx charging you holding his rod like a lance like he did on the beach you roll to your right as he plunges his rod into the wall causing it to break in half. You take the opportunity and rush up to the lynx before slamming the bamboo stick in your right hand against the side of his head cracking it on impact. He yowls in pain before falling onto the floor. You take the opportunity and run out of the front of the restaurant as multiple stares and gasps follow you out of the door. When you reach the door you find a crowd of anthros had gathered to watch the fight between you and the lynx. You didn't stick around for a post fight interview, but instead ran off toward Shira's house praying that you don't wind up on some news channel and hoping that that lynx was the only one they sent after you.

1112112112211111212.content:
You decide that sticking to the streets and sidewalks is drawing far too much attention and putting you in a vulnerable position. So you branch off and decide to take an alternate route back to Shira and Tonya's house. There's a wooded section between where you are and the house. But its double the length of your previous route. But at this point, the distance is the last thing on your mind, you're more concerned with ridding yourself of any extra attention. The woods are somewhat difficult to navigate, lucky for you there happens to be a few trails that lead to the opposing end of the trails... however, that also meant that every now and then there was an anthro on these trails and it would be rather dangerous to run into a less than pleasant one in the forest.

         Things are going smoothly for you as you jog along the trail, you've been in the forest for a little over twenty minutes, and if you can keep your pace up it shouldn't be more than another thirty minutes to get back. You slow to a walk to conserve your energy and pause to survey your surroundings. "Doesn't look like I was followed..." You think to yourself before continuing on your way. Broken beams of moonlight shined down on you from the trees above. As you walked along the faint dirt path you got thee distinct feeling that someone was watching you, you felt a chill run down your spine and that's when you realized it. The crickets weren't chirping and there weren't any sounds of any animals fleeing from you... which meant something else had already scared them off. "I really hope I'm just being paranoid..." You groan to yourself as you do your best to pretend that everything's normal.... well.... as normal as things can be for you.

         "Well what do we have here?" A voice echoed through the forest.

         "I hate it when I'm right," You mutter as you stop walking and begin searching for the source of the voice while holding your ground. The owner of the voice was female, no question about that, but there was also power behind that voice. It sounded like it was coming from someone who demanded respect and got said respect whether you wanted to give it or not.

         "Looks like a human, all alone in the big bad forest," The voice continued with a hint of mirth.

         "Who are you!?" You shout while continuing to scan through the treetops and nearby bushes searching for anything out of the ordinary.

         "Who am I?" The voice echoed, "An interesting question with many answers. But the which is the answer you seek I wonder?"

         "What do you mean?" You demand.

         "I could ask you the same question," The voice replies, "Do you want to know my name? Are you interested in my personality? Is it perhaps my social life that you're asking about? Or are you asking me who I believe myself to be?"

         "I'll settle for a name," You reply.

         "Ah, then a name you shall receive" The voice replied, "My name is Sam."

         You nod while staring up into the trees allowing the moonlight to illuminate your face "Uh huh, and what is it you want 'Sam'?"

         The voice laughed, it wasn't a cackle but rather a musical laugh "You're asking the wrong question human. The question is not what I want, its who I want and the answer is you."

         "I was afraid you'd say that" You reply.

         "Oh come now," Sam answered, "Surely you knew this from the beginning of our little chat."

         "I had a feeling..." You admit, "But I was hoping that it was just a feeling and nothing more, guess that was too much to ask for."

         "It certainly seems that way," Sam returned.

         You start to walk backwards on the trail towards you destination when you feel yourself bump into something soft and furry. You close your eyes and sigh, "Sam I presume?"

         "You certainly are a perceptive little thing aren't you?" Sam laughed.

         You spin around to find a lioness, She was huge and not just in the height department. She had tone muscles and her arm alone was about as thick as one of your legs. She was yellow in color with blonde hair that hung over her shoulders and yellow eyes. Two rounded ears stuck up above her hair while a long yellow tail swayed from side to side behind her. You backpedal to put some distance between you and her while taking in her form. You notice that she's wearing a denim jacket with a tight black t-shirt underneath it which stops just above her navel. from her waist down she's wearing a pair of loose fitting jeans that leave her four large toes one each foot exposed as she's not wearing any shoes. She stands at about double your height and was definitely aware of her advantage. After sizing her up you notice that she's doing the same to you, "Probably a list of vulnerabilities to exploit..." You think grimly.

         "So how do you want to do this? Will you come quietly or will you resist?" Sam inquired with genuine curiosity.

         "I've got somewhere to be, and your in my way," You reply somewhat bitterly.

         "Hmm... must be an important engagement, but you failed to answer my question," Sam replied.

         "I will resist if you try to stop me," You declare.

         Sam tilted her head with a puzzled look, "You are not afraid of me?"

         "Afraid? No... Concerned for my wellbeing? Yes" You returned.

         "I see, well you'll be happy to know that I'm to deliver you to mayor Deluma alive," Sam replied.

         "'Alive' and 'in one piece' are not the same..." You returned.

         "True, but perhaps you'll yield to me before any unnecessary injuries?" Sam offered.

         "I'm not the type to put my health before my goals," You reply.

         Sam gave a small smile, "Interesting, you told me a moment ago that you were concerned for your welfare, yet now you risk it?"

         You took up a boxing stance, "The way I see it, if I lose and you take me to Deluma I'm in trouble anyway and there's no doubt in my mind that she'd kill me on a whim... on the other hand if by some off chance I win or escape, probably the latter... I get to live another day."

         Sam nods in understanding before sprouting a grin, "You seem to be a bit of a gambler... I like you human."

Well, I have to say there's nothing like a civilized conversation between you and the 'Grim Reaper'. Maybe not the conversation you'd want to have but at least its civilized right? Now the question is who makes the first move? You or Sam... either way your gonna escape.... but the question is, how bad are you gonna come off at the end of this encounter? It all depends on who makes the first move. Your call Kiba....
