11121121122111112121.content:
You decide to make the first move and advance cautiously but quickly while maintaining your stance, Sam readies herself in a general stance as if she's not sure what to expect but she doesn't seem worried at all. When you get to her you try for a left hook, hoping that your fist will connect with her ribs and get you some kind of result. Sadly though, this is not the case as she easily uses her paw on that side to stop you punch in mid swing. You scowl in frustration, you knew this was going to be a losing battle to begin with but now its really starting to sink in. Suddenly your fist starts to throb as Sam begins to slowly squeeze it in her palm. You feel as though she might break it if she keeps this up, and she very well might. From your point of view, her paw is so large that it looks like its actually consuming your fist.

         "Will you give up now?" Sam asked casually. You scowled as a drum beat picked up in your mind followed by a guitar, as if someone was playing the theme song for a action sequence. You placed your free hand atop of Sam's paw which is slowly crushing your left hand and using your right hand as leverage you jump off of the ground and rotate your body so that your feet are positioned just in front of Sam's muzzle and give her a powerful double kick to the face. She immediately releases your hand and you fell to the ground clutching your aching arm... it hurts but you don't think its broken. "I'll admit," Sam spoke as she recovered, "I didn't expect that... you drew blood, very impressive." As you watch her you notice the there's a faint trail of blood trailing down from her nose. "But I wonder how will you'll do if I take the offensive.

         You scramble to your feet and just as you get to your feet, you find that she's already looming over you, "She's fast!" you think to yourself as you through yourself backwards to avoid a backhanded swing from her right paw; the same paw that nearly crushed your hand moments ago. She then swiped at you with her left paw horizontally, you ducked under it feeling the rushing air just above your head as her paw passed over you. She then swept one of her feet against your legs, sending you tumbling though the air, though disoriented you instinctively crossed your arms over your chest just before a huge weight smashed into it sending your body rocketing backwards. You bounced across the ground twice, rolling like a ragdoll before your back slammed into a tree. When you hit the tree you were about five feet off of the ground, so after the initial impact you fell to the ground before groaning in pain. Your vision was hazy and your body felt heavy. You felt yourself beginning fall asleep but you shook the drowsiness out of your head, "How in the world am I supposed to survive against that!? Another attack like that and I'm done!" You think as your vision clears. You shakily attempt to stand, but even doing that sends pain surging through your body. Against your protesting body, you force yourself to stand... "Still nothing broken," You mutter to yourself as you shift all of your limbs and muscles experimentally.

         "I'm truly impressed human," Sam admitted, "I thought you would've been unconscious after that but you've managed to maintain you consciousness AND stand, I'm beginning to understand why the police are having such a hard time catching you but what I can't understand is where you get the strength from..."

         "I can't just... give up, but..." You pant as you ready yourself for another attack, "I can't fight her and I can't outrun her, all I can do is evade her and hope that a miracle happens."

         Sam pauses briefly, waiting to hear what you'll say next, "But what?" She asks.

         "But I know I can't win either," You admit grimly.

         Sam nodded in agreement, not smugly or condescendingly but as if acknowledging a simple fact of life, "All the more reason for you to stop resisting and turn yourself over to me."

         "Sorry," You reply with a faint smile, "But I refuse!" You shout as you throw a branch that you'd found laying on the ground. Sam easily swatted it aside but when she did she left her right side open and by the time she realized it you were already within striking distance. You lower yourself as low as you can to the ground without falling while running and drive your shoulder into her right knee. She winces in pain as her knee recoils backward further than it naturally could. Sam swipes at you with her claws but you manage to skirt around her attack and get behind her. Using her loose fitting jacket you climb up her back and somehow manage to get your arms around her neck to put her in a chokehold. She begins to gag, but this is short lived as she encompasses your face with one of her paws and literally rips you off of her back and tosses you to the ground. Your body does a full flip before you hit the ground on your back, the air is forced from your lungs and most of your strength is gone after taking that last hit. You're pretty sure that she probably could have crushed your skull or splattered you across the ground, but you assume that since she did neither, she really is trying to take you alive.

         "You..." Sam started, "You're more resourceful and resilient than any human I've encountered before. Your spirit is unbreakable and you adapt unlike anything I've seen yet." By this time you'd gotten to your feet, but you were so tired and sore that standing in itself was a chore. "However at the end of this you must realize your limitations, after all, you're only human."

         "Wow, a line that transcends dimensions..." you think to yourself. You then realize something that you never thought about before, "You're not a cop are you?" You ask.

         "No, I feel that its a bit too... restrictive for me," Sam admitted, "I'm a bounty hunter by trade."

         Great... so now you were being hunted by the police, that secret human hunting group AND you had to worry about bounty hunters now! "This day just keeps getting better and better," you mumble.

         "You put on quite a show little one... but now your mine," Sam said as she approached you. You backed away from her but it seemed like for every step back you took, she took another two forward.

         Eventually your up against a tree and have nowhere to go as she looms over you. As she begins to reach out for you shadow literally dashes between the two of you before grabbing you and darting off into the woods. It happened so fast that you were still processing what happened, after getting over your initial shock, you realize that an anthro has grabbed you and slung you over their shoulder. You look up and see Sam hot in pursuit, but you 'rescuer' is far more agile than she is and easily out maneuvers her weaving in and around trees, across branches and over logs. Eventually Sam gives up while glaring at you. That solves that problem but now you have another potential threat... who's carrying you? And what are they planning on doing with you?

Okay, so you survived the fight! Congrats! And on top of that you almost held your own against an anthro! Even if she was going easy on you, that's still an accomplishment, not to mention you did it without breaking anything! But now the question is... who's got you now?"

111211211221111121211.content:
After a couple of minutes, your mysterious savior slows down and finds a clearing to rest in. You feel yourself being set down on the ground in front of the anthro who'd saved you. Still though, you weren't sure whether you'd been saved or just changed hands... either way, at this point you physically didn't have the energy to do anything about your situation. You felt your back gently touch down against the ground.

         As you lay on the ground and tried to catch your breath the mysterious anthro spoke to you, "Are you alright?"

         You knew the voice, you looked up to find a friendly and familiar face. "Shira!" You exclaimed.

         "The one and only," She replied with a faint smile. She was dressed in a black hoodie and a pair of baggy cargo pants. It made sense, with clothes like that, narrowing down who she was without a good look would be pretty hard. After getting a clear look at you under the moonlight, her faint smile turned into a worried frown. "Your hurt..." She muttered.

         You shook your head before laying flat on you back and closing your eyes, "Yeah, but I don't think it's serious."

         "I'm glad your ok... but this was reckless especially for you!" Shira scolded. "What were you thinking!? Fighting two anthros back to back? And one of them could have quite literally eaten you!"

         You assume that she's talking about Sam, "Honestly, I didn't have a choice in either case, I was cornered both times with zero chance of outrunning them," You reply as you sit up. You then attempt to stand but falter as your legs quiver.

         "What's wrong with your legs?" Shira asked with concern.

         "I don't think its just my legs," You replied as you fell to your hands and knees shakily, "I think my whole body's exhausted, I don't have the strength to even stand anymore."

You make your way back towards the urban area and as you do you realize that your getting a lot of stares. You need to find something to help you blend in. As you move through town you spot what looks like an oversized blanket draped over a railing in front of a shop. You grab the covering as you pass by and cover yourself with it like it were a cloak. As you begin to cross into an urban environment, you find that you get less stares; your camouflage seems to be working and the fact that its dark out also helps. After another twenty minutes of dashing through the suburbs you find yourself in Shira's backyard. You scale the side of the house as quietly as possible using the gutter drain for handholds and crawl over the edge of the roof and onto the shingled rooftop. You sigh in relief as you crawl in through the window before closing it and collapsing on your bed and closing your eyes.

         Just as your settling in though, you hear a knock at the door, "Can I come in?" Tonya asks.

         Your eyes shoot open before you leap off of the bed, "Uh... just a second!" you call before discarding your new 'cloak' and tossing it underneath the bed. You then slow your breathing as much as possible and try to keep the tiredness off of your face as you open the door. "What's up?" You ask nonchalantly.

         Tonya gives you a smile, "Oh nothing," She says, "Just checking on you, so, what've you been up to?"

         "Oh... uh... I've been taking in the scenery of the sunset," You state which wasn't a complete lie.

         "For three hours?" Tonya asked.

         "I was contemplating the turn my life took when I came here afterwards," You return.

         Tonya crossed her arms, "I see," She replied but where did you get that bruise on your arm from?" She asks as she nods pointedly at your right arm.

         "Must've been from when that lynx pushed me through that window..." You think to yourself. "Oh, I didn't notice it..." You muse as you look down at your arm, "It must've happened when a fell."

         "You fell?" Tonya asked.

         "You didn't hear it?" You asked, "It happened not too long ago but I though you would've heard it... guess it wasn't as loud as I thought."

         "I guess not," Tonya replied. There's an awkward silence between you two before Tonya sighs and leans against the doorframe, "Before you make this any worse for yourself you should know, that I know, that you know that you're lying to me.

         You give Tonya a confused stare hoping that you can call her bluff by dragging out the conversation and playing dumb, "So... I know, that you know, that I know that I'm lying?" You ask, "I'm just trying to understand this."

         "Don't play games with me Kiba," Tonya says as her tails flare up behind her and she straightens up, "Now I'm going to ask you this once... Did... You... Leave... This... House?"

         "I've never left this house..." You reply solemnly. But a withering glare from Tonya prompts you to quickly add on to your statement, "More than twice."

         Tonya groans and shakes her head, "Kiba! You know you can't do that!" You quietly look away from her.... "What if something happened to you and you got caught? Or what if they followed you home?"

         "I was careful! I'm always careful!" You reply in an attempt to defend yourself, "I've never once come back without making sure that I wasn't followed."

         Tonya's face goes blank before being replaced with an expression that could fit the definition of 'divine wrath'. "You said 'never once' just now," Tonya growled, "That would imply that you've left the house on multiple accounts..." She surmised.

         You kicked yourself for not being more careful with your wording, but then you saw Tonya's expression... "Ooooh heaven help me..." You groaned under your breath.

         "Kiba.... I understand that you've been feeling pent up in here for the past couple of weeks, I really do..." Tonya started with an unnervingly calm voice, "But that does not justify sneaking out of the house and running around out there like nobody can see you! It puts you at risk and it puts us at risk!" You wanted to shrink into nothing, you hadn't meant to put anyone at risk... you just wanted a little fresh air is all. Tonya sighed, "I'm upset with you but I'm glad you made it back safe... I was very worried about you and so was Shira..." Tonya replied as she calmed herself.

         "I'm sorry," You reply say quietly.

         "I'll figure out how I'm going to punish you for this later... but right now I need to know that you weren't followed home," Shira stated while looking at you with a piercing gaze.

         "I wasn't followed, I'm sure of it," You stated. Shira gave you a dubious look, "You are the only family I have now... I know that if the track me to you I'll have nowhere to go and we'll all be arrested so I made sure nobody followed me."

         Shira stared you down for a few minutes before sighing and resting her paw on your head, "Good" Was all she said as she began to walk away.

         "Before you go," You call after her causing her to pause, "How did you know I was gone?"

         She smirked at you before continuing toward the stairs, "You made the news," She called back.

         After she's out of sight you hear the doorbell ring. Shira answers the door and there's a brief exchange of words in which your name and species is mentioned before what sounds almost like an argument breaks out. You get curious and decide to get a little closer and do some investigating.

Meanwhile at the same time that you were getting your bandages changed, Mayor Silvia Deluma was sitting at her desk reading over a stack of reports and initialing various documents. As she did she heard a knock at her door. "Yes? Who is it?" She asked in an irritated and tired tone.

         A gruff voice replied from behind the door, "I've brought you the human you asked for."

         Deluma immediately set her papers aside and looked up at the door, "Oh good," She answered, her voice taking a more pleasant tone, "Please send him in."

         The door opened and a middle aged man was roughly pushed into the room, "H-hello Mayor Deluma..." He shakily greeted her.

         "Hello Tom," Silvia replied, "Please come in." Tom carefully nodded and did as he was told. He heard the door slam shut behind him as he went further into the office. "Please," Deluma implored while gesturing to the two chairs sitting in front of her desk, "Have a seat." Tom did as he was told and sat in one of the two vacant chairs. Once he was situated, he stared timidly up at the Mayor's towering form. "How are you Tom?" She asked.

         Tom thought about his response carefully, he was a prisoner against his will. He'd been tortured and forced to bring other humans from across time and space to this accursed world where they would either serve Deluma or suffer her wrath. He lived in constant fear of her and all of the other anthros that inhabited this world. He was stripped of his dignity and technology with no hope of going home... he wanted to tell her that he was horrible, that he wanted to go home. He wanted to jump on her desk and shout how angry he was at her... but he knew that whatever relief he'd gain from that outburst would be very short lived. So he told her what she expected him to say, "I'm doing well... how are you?"

         Deluma sighed and took her glasses off, exposing her golden eyes, "Honestly Tom, I'm a little distressed and frustrated."

         Tom was confused, he still didn't even understand what he was doing there, but he guessed it had something to do with how she felt. Not knowing what else to do he asked the obvious question that she'd left for him to ask, "What has you feeling that way?" He inquired.

         Deluma stood up from her desk before walking over to her window which overlooked the city. "I don't know if you're aware... but your device has brought three new humans to our world."

         Tom shrugged, "I was aware that it was supposed to bring three new humans to our city, but I wasn't sure if it actually did the job as they never appeared at the target coordinates that you provided me with." Tom was a quantum physicist by trade, and he'd invented a machine that would take him to other worlds and parallel dimensions. However, he never could have predicted that it would bring him right to Silvia Deluma's doorstep. He came prepared in a powered armored suit to repel any threats... but he hadn't considered the possibility that the trip to the world he was now trapped in would damage said suit. Deluma took advantage of the opportunity and seized him. She then made him an offer that he literally couldn't refuse. He was to modify the machine to bring her more humans with more ideas and technology that she could use and sell for her own benefit, she would then dispose of said humans when they were 'no longer of use'. Tom had so far outlived every human he'd brought to this world, only because Deluma needed him to work the machine.

         "See, that's what distresses me Tom. I gave you the target coordinates and the machine sent them to open and public areas where the whole world could see them and then they were afforded the opportunity to escape," Deluma explained while keeping her back to him and staring out of the window.

         "I see," Tom replied, "That is rather-"

         "-I suppose..." Deluma interjected, "What this means is there's a malfunction somewhere in the machine."

         Tom nodded, "It probably has to do with the targeting sensor. I'm sure I can figure it out with a few-"

         "And what explanation might that be?" Tom asked.

For you, that night was rather uneventful after your bandages were changed. You slept, had a dream you couldn't remember and then woke up after sunrise. You decided to just be lazy for a moment and lay in bed, not like you had a pressing engagement or anything, right? It was then that you heard noise coming from the room next door; Shira's room. You didn't think much of it first, but then you realized that more than likely, today was her day off. You leapt out of bed and scrambled towards your dresser where you kept the clothes that Tonya had bought you (Some were from the store Shira worked at and others were picked up by Tonya at the anthro equivalent of a thrift shop). You hurriedly grabbed some jeans and a t-shirt and flung your bedroom door open. Just ahead of you, Shira had stopped to look at you after getting only one foot out of her room.

         Shira stared at you and then down at the bathroom at the end of the hall, "Don't even think about it," She warned.

         You glared at her, "You know I can't let you go first right?" You asked. The fact was that Shira was a fox... that being said, an anthro with fur will typically take twice as long in the bathroom as a human because of their fur. But Shira was also a girl, which meant that her showers were double the length of the typical anthro of her species. Long story short, what this meant for you was if she got into the bathroom first, there would be no hot water to shower with and you wouldn't be able to use the restroom until she was done... thirty five minutes later... This resulted in you and Shira fighting over the bathroom on mornings when she was off of work and at the house.

         Shira inched a little further into the hall, "You know you can't stop me," She stated.

         You took a torturously slow step out of your room, "I don't need to stop you, I just have to get into the bathroom before you do."

         Shira smirked and took a step towards the bathroom, "Not gonna happen shrimp." Without warning, Shira turned and made a break for the bathroom.

         Thinking fast, you balled up your t-shirt and threw it just ahead of Shira's face. The shirt opened up like a parachute and blanketed her face, the result was immediate as she stumbled into the wall and fell onto the floor. You took the opportunity to run past her, you're goal was nearly in sight, but before you got too much further you felt a paw grab your right leg causing you to fall as well.

         Shira then bounced up and barreled towards the bathroom, "Nice try," She chuckled as she ran past you. But you noticed that she was still on the rug that sat in the middle of the hallway. You quickly got to your knees and gave the rug a hard tug, tripping the vixen up a second time.

         You took that time to capitalize on your latest move, you sprint over Shira and into the bathroom. Shira was still getting to her feet when you ran through the doorway. She charged at the doorway in an effort to get through the door andd knock you down before you could lock her out. "Oh no you don't!" You called as you slammed the door shut as fast as you could.

         Shira's face fell as she saw the door closing in slow motion, "Noooo!" She shrieked. You were able to close and lock the door just before the desperate vixen crashed into it with a loud thud, "Ow!" Shira cried as she fell to the ground in a crumpled heap and massaged her sore snout with one paw.

         You pumped your fist in victory, "Nice try," You commented, making sure that it was juuuuust loud enough for Shira to hear.

         You could hear Shira growling on the other side of the door, "I swear Kiba, if there's no hot water left by the end of my shower I will crush you!"

         You chuckle a bit to yourself. You knew for a fact that she would have hot water at the beginning of her shower, but you also knew that there wouldn't be any hot water by the time she was halfway done. '

Well, life's never dull with you is it? You get to savor victory in the form of soothing hot water and a non damp bathroom to take a shower in. The question is, what happens when you get out?

         "Find him," The feline ordered, "A hooded figure entered the house, it closed the door and ran into the living room.

It was about your height and there was a set of ears poking up through the top of the hoodie the figure wore. It stood there in blue denim jeans and a plain black hoodie. You staggered backwards, you weren't by any means a world class featherweight boxer but you knew a thing or two, and the punch that just landed on you was not the punch of an amateur. You decided to take the defensive and planted yourself while squaring your shoulders and guarding your face with your fists. The figure on the other hand, charged you. You figured if you could dodge its initial attack, you could follow up with a counter attack. The figure leapt impossibly high and threw its knee at your face. You ducked and avoided the knee, but before you could even turn around, you felt a force constricting around your neck, making it difficult to breathe. It didn't take long for you to realize that you were in a headlock. You desperately try to pry your attacker's arm from around your neck but you can't seem to find the leverage you need. You're vision was starting to blur, you had to think of something quick! You decide to let gravity help you with your problem. You leapt into the air before hitting the hard wooden floor on your back, sandwiching you're attacker between you and the floor.

Maaaan it looks like you're in for the fight of your life! The audience came expecting a blowout... BUT THIS IS A BRAAAAAWL. So the question for right now is... can you find a way out of this headlock or do you pass out?

You find yourself in an enormous workshop. It looks almost like a small warehouse. Computers and screens lined the walls, tables with various colored chemicals spread upon them in beakers and test tubes sat at the back of the room, and in the center of the room was what looked like a robot. It was humanoid and about six feet tall in appearance. It was suspended by chains under its arms and a hook on its back. It reminded you a lot of the wing gundam; a machine from an anime you used to watch. But there were several differences. The faceplate was white and featureless with the exception of two darkened 'eyes'. Besides those, the only significant feature was that at the base of the jawline one either side of the head there where what appeared to be fins that extended vertically one either side, each one stopping a few inches over the head which gave the appearance of almost foxlike 'ears'. The body itself had no real special features with the exception of its wings which seemed to com right off of the wing gundam. The overall color of the machine was blue and white. Its torso was blue while all other extremities with the exception of the wing were white. You also notice that on its shins where what looked like air intakes, most likely for additional thrusters underneath the feet.

         You walk around the machine for a few moments stricken with awe before you bring yourself to ask the question that plagues your mind, "What is it?" Shira, who was also shocked by the discovery snaps her attention over to Sandra who'd been watching the scene with an amused smirk.

         "We call it EF-01," Sandra explains as she moves so that she's standing face to face with it, "This machine, according to what we've uncovered is actually an armor... a powered suit... or as it's known in our database, an exoframe."

         "What was it designed for?" You ask as you step behind the 'exoframe' to get a better look at its wings.

         "It was designed to help humans fight on equal terms with anthros," Sandra replied.

         Shira exchanged glances of surprise with you, "How can that be? Nobody from where Kiba comes from has any idea we exist."

         Sandra nodded, "That is true... but Kiba and this exoframe did not come from the same world."

         "What do you mean?" You ask, suddenly losing all interest in the exoframe.

         "EF-01 was discovered here, in our world about two weeks ago," Sandra continued, "However, carbon dating places it back approximately two hundred years in the past."

         "Is that even possible?" Shira asked, "It looks more advanced than anything I've ever seen before."

         "While I do play a serious role here I also work at a museum. Lately, we've been doing a little research about our history as well as a little digging around in the sand and dirt both literally and metaphorically," Sandra explained. "Over the past year or so we've been finding strong evidence that humans once coexisted in this world with anthros. In addition to that, we found that the humans that were living here were actually indigenous to this world."

         "So, they naturally lived here?" Shira asked.

         "That's correct," Sandra confirmed as she nodded her head.

         "I don't understand, if they naturally lived here... then why was I brought here from another world filled with only humans while this one has anthros as the dominate species? Shouldn't we be native to where I came from?"

         Sandra sighed, "Actually no, you're native to this world like we are, or more accurately your ancestors are. It appears that they did the reverse of what Deluma is doing now. They invented a device to take them to another world."

         Shira's eyes lit up, "So that must be the world that Kiba came from, right?"

         Sandra nodded and grinned, "Precisely!"

         "But... if that's the case, why did the humans leave this world to begin with?"

         Sandra frowned and adjusted her glasses, "Well, unfortunately while we are still in the process of trying to confirm it, we do have one prevailing theory. Anthros and humans went to war with one another... which unfortunately is why this exoframe was created."

Wow... Didn't see that one coming, that was like a sucker punch to the crotch! Somebody needs to go back and rewrite those history books because they left that part out! This can't possibly get any more mind boggling... can it?

She leads you down a series of hallways until you come to a room that reminded you of the mission control room at the Houston Space Center. Finally, a bear walked up to Sandra before handing her a piece of paper and going back into the controlled chaos of the room.

         Before anyone could ask any more questions or say anything else a male badger sitting at one of the consoles turned in his chair to face Sandra, "I have a confirmed visual!" He called out.

She was on the sidewalk in front of a store. Many anthros had stopped to stare at her, much like they had when you first appeared. The girl seemed to be somewhere between fourteen and sixteen years old. She looked scared and lost as she ran into a nearby alley.

         "We have to help her!" You shouted more out of urgency than anything else.

         Sandra glanced down at you out of the corner of her eye before returning her attention to the matter at hand, "Do we have any responders in the area?"

         "Only one ma'am, but he's two miles away and there's an seventy five percent chance of exposure," An otter on the other side of the room replied.

Tom is dead silent, his hesitance louder than anything in the room. He opens his mouth to speak, but his words are dry, none spoken. Deluma stands across from him, angered, as if ready to strike.

"I..." Tom starts. He remembers that, the door behind him, wasn't locked. "I-"

"You what?" Deluma growls. Her tails flicker with hatred. Tom flinches.

"I- I've got to go!" Tom exclaims. He scrambles out of his seat to the direction of the door. Deluma jumps forward, her tails lashing out in different directions, whipping and twirling around the space above the two. Tom rushes to the door, preemptively sticking a hand out to grab the knob. His left leg is surrounded by two of Deluma's tails, which they both suddenly start clenching and dragging him back. Tom shouts in protest and tries to keep his grip on the door handle.

"Get back here-" Deluma grunts. She grabs him with more of her tails then yanks Tom off of the door.

"No no no!" Tom panics. Deluma quickly silences him. She, using her tails, lifts him up in the air.

"Ah. There we are, quiet. I take it that you weren't exactly on my side. Figures; I knew from the start you'd be trouble, but no matter. You were going to die the moment I knew you had betrayed me. I just wanted to know why, but I figured that out by myself- you don't like what I'm doing." Deluma smirks. She brings Tom closer to her face. "But that's too bad for you, because I like it, the money, the power. It feels so... perfect." Deluma chuckles, her smile growing sinister. Tom struggles in her grasp.

"Oh, still trying to get away are we?" Deluma laughs. "You humans make meals so enjoyable." Tom's eyes widen as he is hung over Deluma's opening maw.

Outside of the office, no one heard a thing as Tom met his fate.

         The sound of chains clattering nearby came to Kiba as he resurfaced from the darkness to consciousness. As he opened his eyes the remained glossed over and unfocused. Kiba looked up to find Deluma, sitting across the room with a smug look on her face. "Where am I?" Kiba demanded.

         "Where I want you to be," Deluma replied, "This room," She continued as she swept a hand around her to indicate the space she was referring to, "It's going to be where you spend your time when I don't need you."

         "When you don't need me for what?" Kiba asked, the malice; though still present in his voice had taken a backseat to his curiosity.

         "Humans, as far as we know are virtually non-existent here... yet there is so much I can learn from your species. But of course since humans aren't really around anymore I can't study them." Deluma explained, "So imagine my surprise when one just popped up in a bright flash of light, right in my living room. It turned out that he was a scientist from your world. Apparently, he was experimenting with a new technology to transport people and supplies over large distances. Obviously it hadn't worked out quite the way he imagined it would. It turns out that he'd reinvented the same device that allowed humans to leave this world in a mass exodus."

         "It was a teleporter..." Kiba realized, but his astonishment soon turned to rage when he realized how he had come to be trapped in the world he was pulled into, "And now you're using it to bring humans from my world to this one! Why!?"

         "Why does anybody do anything? To benefit myself, that's why," Deluma laughed. She then snapped her fingers causing several lights to shine down on Kiba and illuminate his new room. It was barren. Concrete walls, ceiling and floor. A single bed and basic bathroom. It was at that moment he realized he was in a prison cell. "Aside from that, the other reason is to satisfy my curiosity. I want to know everything about your race. I want to understand them, learn how they can be useful to me and of course... learn how to conquer them."

         Kiba's eyes widened, "You... want to conquer... my world?"

         Deluma grinned, "Yes I do. I believe I've already told you... I own everything in this region, including you, this city... and a private military corporation. Ruling this little slice of a single continent simply isn't enough for me anymore... not when I can rule an entire world."

         Kiba shook his head as he began to realize Deluma's plan, "You're going to take an army to attack my world..."

         "And why stop there?" Deluma asked, "I'll take your world for my own, remake it in the way I see fit and offer it as a place to live for the wealthiest anthros of this world. They'll get their choice of prime land with human servants to tend to them. And they'll all live under my rule!"

         "One lone PMC won't be able to handle something like that, anthros or not," Kiba argued.

         Deluma smirked down at him, "Of course not! I'm a business woman. I'm closing deals with some of those other wealthy anthros I mentioned earlier. It'll take some effort and doing, and of course we'll have to fine tune the teleporter... but it won't be long before we're able to use it to send our troops all over your world in an instant and take the humans by complete surprise!"

         "Why tell me all of this?" Kiba demanded, "Do you plan to kill me?"

         "If I were going to do that I wouldn't have you in chains... I did say I needed you earlier didn't I?" Deluma replied with a snide smirk, "No, I need to know how humans think. I need to know what they're capable of and gauge their physical strengths and weaknesses. So I have you, I'll put you through tests of strength, endurance and of course intellect," She finished as she tapped her forehead with one of her index claws.

         "I won't cooperate," Kiba replied.

         "Oh I think you will," Deluma returned, "Because if you don't, you will be the last one to suffer."

         "What's that supposed to mean?" Kiba asked with a quizzical expression.

         Deluma tilted her head to look at the steel door that allowed access into your cell, "Bring her in." Two German Shepards opened the door and dragged in a human woman. She had fair skin and looked to be in her early twenties, she had black hair and wore denim jeans with a white tank top. You couldn't really tell much else as she was kept a fair distance away from you. "There are four other humans here besides you, this is one of them," Deluma stated as she gestured to the girl they'd brought in. "If you refuse to cooperate with the tests, attempt to escape, refuse to obey commands or annoy me, you will not be punished, they will. As far as how they're punished, that depend entirely upon my mood. I might let them slide every now and again, then again I might have a bad day and decide to break a bone or two... or..." Deluma licked her lips, "I might get hungry and indulge my more... predatory nature..."

         "You monster!" Kiba shouted as a thrashed in his chains, "And you expect me not to fight this?! Or are you just looking for an excuse to kill humans and torture my conscience for your own sick and twisted amusement!?"

         "On the contrary! I expect you to," Deluma replied, "That flame of defiance that burns in you is what I find myself absolutely enthralled by! From the moment I met you, a strong will and lack of fear combined with an agile body and strong bones is what has set you apart from the other humans I've seen thus far. I'd be a fool not to expect some level of defiance from you, but I expect you to be smart enough to know when to reign yourself in... otherwise, I might lose my temper and take it out on someone... who isn't as strong as you are..." Deluma replied as she cupped the young human girl's face in her hand. The girl silently cried and tried to look away but was unable. Deluma then released her and waved a hand to the two officer holding the poor girl. They nodded and dragged her out of the room, "So then, do we have an understanding?" Kiba said nothing, he could only glower at Deluma with disdain. "Good!" Deluma smiled as she walked out of the room, "Be sure to get plenty of rest! You're going to need it~" With that Deluma left the room and locked the door behind her.

Kiba hears mumbling on the other side of the speakers, a conversation accidentally leaking in to the booby-trapped room. There’s not much to listen to, but Kiba tries his best anyways. It’s about numbers. Kiba sighs, the room opens in front of him and the normal guards come out and escort Kiba back to his cell. Hours pass.

He sits there, angry with his options, and disappointed that he couldn’t do anything about it. A scowl forms on his face as he thinks of Deluma and her annoying voice telling him what to do and threatening him if he doesn’t. Across from him, when he looks through the glass screen in the door, are the humans that Deluma keeps threatening to kill. Deluma seemed to have gotten two more humans. Obviously there was the first from before, then eventually a man in an older age was brought here, then a young girl who couldn’t have been more than fourteen. A Definite pattern between these people is that none of them were expecting to be here, all of them dressed for different occasions. THe older man had short, gray hair and was dressed for golf, and the girl looks like she was just ready for school, she was just brought here a week ago.

The four of them were startled when the door to the hallway was opened. Kiba gets up and jumps, catching the lip of the glass’ frame to hold himself up. He looks through the small window to see two anthros holding another human. A fifth human. He doesn’t struggle when they lead him down the hallway. The anthros stop between Kiba’s door and the opposite door. They communicate and turn their attention towards Kiba’s door.

With flawless reaction, Kiba lets go and backs up from the door. It opens and they toss in the human. He stumbles a bit but doesn’t fall. He turns around just as the door closes.

“You must be Kiba, right?” The man guesses.

“Yeah, how’d you know?” Kiba responds. He then answers his own question, “Deluma right?”

“Yes. Where are we.” The man says. He turns around again and faces Kiba. Kiba finally gets a good look at the man. He has glasses, and wears a polo that looks like it belongs in a college. He wears normal pants and running shoes. “My name is Niel.”

“For one thing, all I know is that we’re stuck in a cell together. And if you’re in here, it must mean that maybe Deluma decided you were fit for tests.” Kiba explains to the best of his knowledge. “Across from us are the others.”

“The others… yes Deluma said she’d… she’d kill them if we didn’t comply, right?” Niel whispers, he walks over to the door and realizes he’s too short.

“Yes.” Kiba grunts. Niel seems to be inspecting the door, and the whole room in fact. Kiba stares at him while he goes around. “What are you doing?”

“What are you doing?” Niel retorts, “I’m inspecting the room.” Niel explains.

“Why? I’ve checked, there’s nothing here but what you see.” Kiba sighs.

“You sure about that?” Niel responds. Kiba shakes his head.

“You trying to escape? You’ll get them killed.” Kiba repeats. Niel doesn’t respond. After minutes of inspecting the room, Niel pumps his fist as if something good happened. “What’d you do?” Kiba accuses sarcastically.

“I can open the door- pop it off in fact, it would fall anyways.” Niel mumbles.

“Already? I can see why Deluma put you in here with me then…” Kiba exclaims. Niel walks back to Kiba. “You’re really smart.” Niel nods.

“Don’t know if she knows how smart I really am, which is good, we can use that to our advantage…” Niel mumbles to himself. “I’m done looking around, actually.” He says normally. Kiba looks at him with an idle expression. Suddenly Niel looks like he’s about to fall. “I should have just sat down when I got the chance, they chased me for so long…” He wobbles over to the wall and Kiba checks to make sure that Niel won’t fall. He sat down, fidgeting with his glasses. “Why are {i{you in here, Kiba?” He asks.

Caught off-guard by the question, he says “I don’t know. Maybe I was the most fit?” Kiba makes a gesture towards the other humans, “Deluma probably considered that an old man couldn’t run, a young girl wasn’t fully developed, and…” Kiba pauses, “Actually I don’t know why the woman is in there. She looks to be the same age as me. And with these walls I never got to ask her.”

By the time Kiba had done answering Niel’s question, Niel had fallen asleep. He shakes his head. “Not like I’ve been talking to myself for months or anything…” Kiba thinks.

------

Another few hours later and Niel had still been asleep. Kiba, being the strategist that he is, has well learnt the times that the guards came to get him for testing, and knew that they were coming soon. He looks over to Niel who seems to be peacefully unaware of his situation.

“Hey, Niel.” Kiba says. He gets up and walks over to Niel. He stands over him. “Niel.” Kiba says more sternly. He crouches, slightly annoyed. “Niel!” Kiba exclaims. He shakes the heavy sleeper. Niel wakes up startled.

“Where am I?” Niel gasps. Kiba rolls his eyes. Niel looks around, “Sorry.” he apologizes to Kiba. Kiba nods.

“Get ready, they’re about to take us to a test.” Kiba explains.

“A test?” Niel asks. Just then, the door to the concrete room opens and four anthros flood in. Kiba helps Niel up, who looks slightly perturbed. Two anthros grab Kiba, who doesn’t struggle. Niel tries to copy Kiba.

They are taken to the same room Kiba is tested in. They’re forcefully shoved into the room. Deluma’s static voice floods the room again. “You know the drill, Kiba.” She says. Niel looks around the room for something. “However, Niel, you’ve got to find out for yourself.” There is a menacing chuckle on the other side of the microphone.

“Aha!” Niel exclaims. Before Kiba starts walking forward, he turns to Niel, who’s crouched down near the door. Niel places a hand on the wall, obviously inspecting something. “Kiba come here.” He beckons. Reluctantly, Kiba scoots over to him. “Kick right here.”

“What are you doing?” Deluma exclaims with a worried voice. Kiba looks around and smiles. Niel just found something important. Kiba turns to kick the wall with all his might. Unexpectedly, the surface crumples from the force of his kick, in fact, his foot got stuck. Wires and sparks flew everywhere and immediately everything went black. “What is-- no, no, N-!” Deluma’s angry protests were cut short. Kiba yanks his foot out of the wall. Alarms were blaring and echoing through the halls.

“Come on! Let’s get out of here!” Niel exclaims. Kiba couldn’t believe this was happening, he was going to escape! As he exits the testing room, however, he remembers that the other humans would need help.

“Niel wait!” Kiba shouted, Niel was down the left hallway a bit. He turns around. “The others- we have to help them! This way!” Kiba turned and sprinted down the hallway to the right, Niel following. After multiple twists and turns, (and thanks to Kiba’s knowledge), the two finally end up at Kiba’s cell. Luckily, they had not run into any guards. Niel was panting and heaving, clearly he doesn’t run. The door across, the others, was open. Kiba rushes in to see the humans all looking around, anxious and afraid.

The woman looked to Kiba, “You’re- you’re Kiba right?” She exclaims. He nods. “What’s happening?” She asks.

“I can’t explain right now, because I don’t know myself, he knows, but he’s outta breath. We have got to go, now!” Kiba explains. “Come on!” He yells. The three humans rush over to Kiba and Niel.

“Young man,” The old man gets Kiba’s attention, he then looks into Kiba’s eyes with a relieved expression, “Thank you.” He nods. The child stays silent, too scared to say anything. Kiba motions for them to leave.

Niel, the old man, the woman, and the child were all following Kiba through this maze of corridors. Kiba suddenly stops. The rest abruptly stop as well. Kiba turns around. They were just ahead of the exit. There were always guards there, in fact, a whole squad. Kiba looks on at the four with a lost expression, mouth agape. He has lead them into a dead end…

“Kiba?” The young girl whispers. Kiba looks down at her. “I wanna go home.” She says, tears start to form in her eyes, her face turning red. Kiba kneels down and meets her at eye level.

“Don’t worry,” Kiba comforts her, though stuttering. “Just-...” Kiba suddenly gets an idea. It was a big risk. He stands up as the woman hugs the child. He turns to Niel and the old man. “Niel, make sure you all get out.” Kiba commands cryptically. Niel looks puzzled for a moment, but the old man saw through Kiba immediately. The old man was about to protest, but Kiba had already taken off.

“I know where to take them, Kiba! We’ll come back for you!” Niel exclaims, then leads the other three humans out.

As you awaken, you have a hard time seeing much of anything. Your vision is blurry and you can barely move. Your body feels weak and what little movement you can manage causes you considerable pain. In the background you can hear a steady beeping coming from somewhere nearby. "What happened, and where am I..." you wonder. Just as your vision starts to clear up you hear a door open and close. Even in your current state, you know that someone is in the room with you. You hear footsteps moving toward you, they seem to stop right next to where your laying. Not long after that you hear what sounds like humming and some kind of faint scratching sound. You blink a few more times and find that you can see clearly enough to make out where you are. You were in a large room with white walls and a single window. You yourself were laying in a bed, a hospital bed to be precise. This also explains the beeping noise that you've been hearing. Without moving your head, you look to your left where you'd heard those footsteps stop and find an anthro collie standing by your bed in a nurse outfit. In her hand was a clipboard which she was currently writing on, which would explain that scratching noise from before. She seems to be paying more attention to the monitors than to you. Suddenly, all your memory comes back to you. Showing up in this strange world, the police coming after you and even falling off of that rooftop. How you survived that was beyond you... but you definitely didn't want to be in the hospital if the police were chasing you. Police departments and hospitals go together like T.V's and DVD players. They don't always have to work together but they are more than willing to do so and share information happily. Information like when someone running from the police checks into a hospital room with major injuries.

         Your situation wasn't good, and it was getting worse by the second as your heart monitor was picking up your accelerated heart rate. By the time you realized this, you found the collie nurse looking down at you with wide eyes. Your first instinct was to get out of the bed. You were able to sit up and set one foot on the ground before pain shot through your body. Unable to do anything but cry out you fell back onto the bed. The pain slowly subsided as you laid back on the bed. You started to get up again but the nurse dropped her clipboard and held your arms against the bed, preventing you from sitting up. "Shh... you need to rest. As far as we can tell you cracked two ribs and fractured your right shin. You've got a contusion on the back of your head too along with a bruised trachea along with countless other bruises all over your body."

         "And now I know why it hurts to move and breath," You thought as you remained still so as not to cause yourself any more pain.

         "Now I'm going to let you're arms go," The collie warned. "You won't try to run again will you?" You shook your head as she slowly removed her paws from your wrists. "My name is Cindy, I'm assigned to watch over you. The doctors have done all they can for you and expect you to make a full recovery. But for you to do that you must rest."

Oh perfect, you've been immobilized and hospitalized at the same time. Well, at least it can't possibly get any worse, right?

You slip off of the pipe and swing over onto a nearby window-sill, it creaks very loudly. It doesn't matter if your the strongest, or the smartest, or the most acrobatic-- when you're above such a high height, you will be frightened.

You freeze for a moment, and try to breath-- that was a thrilling adventure. There's still the matter at hand, the two anthros who are now on the roof. There is a very fast way down, and the way down would be to parkour. You are no acrobat, so you look to the window. When you try to open it, it's locked. You curse under your breath.

"Did you hear that?" Mira exclaims. "Someone's definitely here!" She says. The tiger immediately runs back down the stairs, but stops. "Stay here!"

"Pfft, whatever..." Sarah said. She wanted to go back to swimming, but now she's on the hot roof. She mumbles under her breath, "I'm a shark, not a lizard." She grunts. You hear thunderous footsteps fly down the stairs, and a door opens at the bottom floor. Mira runs out and looks around. Eventually, she sees you and gasps. You curse under your breath once again for letting yourself be seen. Was there really anything you could do about it anyway? I mean, you would have to get down eventually.

A couple minutes later, you hear the room's door unlock. There are curtains on the other side of the window, and to your left and right are no window-sills. You get ready for anything, but your hair stands on edge with your back to the open space below you. The curtains fly open. You meet the gaze of the two anthros who chased you. You've got a better look at them now, but they're just as surprised to see you... at least, the shark is. The tiger, Mira, expected to see you there. You see her slowly unlock the window, and try to open it. She opens her mouth to speak...

But you push the window open and land on Mira, who shrieks because of your sudden outburst. You roll off of her as she tries to get up. Sarah blocks the doorway, attempting to grab you. You juke her by dodging her arms. You roll under her legs and she doesn't expect it. Just as your about to get out of their grasp, something large hits you in the back of your head, completely stopping your forward motion. You look up to see the shark's tail had beat you down. You land on your stomach, pushing yourself off the floor, you try running again. Mira tackles you and pins you down. Apparently she got up.

"You're not going anywhere!" Mira exclaims. You struggle to get out of her grip, but she simply overpowers you. You grunt.

"Let me go!" You scowl. You have no intention of being turned in.

"Stop that, we're not going to hurt you." Mira growls. You immediately stop struggling. That growl was was of annoyance, and in your position, you don't want to have another stronger, larger anthro against you. "We're with you, and we don't want to hurt you-- now if you want to not be captured by Deluma's stupid goons, then I suggest you stop struggling." She calmly states.

You do so, and she gets off of you.

"What do you want?" You ask, obviously defeated. Mira starts asking you almost everything she can think of. It's repetitive, but you three get along over time. The three of you discussed about how and where you'll be going... except it wasn't your decision.

High efficiency internal combustion engines, solar powered lights and battery chargers, cellular phones, night vision goggles. There's plenty of other stuff that she's had made in that lab too, and she's profiting from it all. The problem is, these products and concepts are virtually alien to us..."

         "That's exactly what we thought, so we put someone inside the police force here to get close to Deluma and investigate her, while I kept my distance and reported from afar," Natasha paused and smiled, "You might know her as, 'Captain Luna Barker"."

         "She also happens to be my cousin," She added.

         "So she's a cop that's also a spy for the government and happens to be your cous-" You cut yourself off in mid sentence before throwing your hands up "Sure! Why not? It's not that farfetched compared to everything else so far."

All she has to go off of are the miscellaneous items and markings laying around Deluma's office and in some of the corners of the city hall every now and again. She's definitely doing a good job of keeping everything tidy, or at least she was until you and the other two showed up."

         "What about me?" You ask, "Aren't I 'clear cut evidence'?"

         Natasha sighed, "Unfortunately not, you literally appeared out of nowhere. So as of right now, your appearance and that of the two other humans' are just 'random anomalies'. If I tried to hang Deluma on that she'd easily find a way out, and then she'd know we were on to her and make my job even more difficult than it already is."

         "So what do we do?" You asked.

         "For now," Natasha said as she sat down next to you and pulled you close to her, "We keep you safe and hidden. Until we can explain how Deluma is pulling humans from your world to ours we can't do much about her. The only other thing we can do is keep an eye out for those other humans, and try to find them before Deluma does."

         You sigh and nod in agreement, "I understand, but what about my friends?"

         "Friends?" Natasha asks. You briefly explain how you were kidnapped from Haylee and Amy's place and recount the events leading up to that very moment. "I see... I'll track them down and contact them, I'd rather not move you in public so I'll see about having them come here to see you." You nod and thank her.

Well, lots of developments... So, Deluma is a crazed, power hungry, cut throat business tycoon... who knew? Well I guess deep down we all knew but, well you know. So you survived the lioness, made a new friend and managed to uncover Deluma's plan all in forty eight hours. What's next for you Mr. Lockheart?

The undercover agent, Natasha, had left after your semi-brief talk.

"What did she mean by, 'the other two'?" you ponder. This peaks your interest, then you think about how many humans actually were needed for Deluma's twisted actions. What happened to them? How are they getting here? How did you get here? You stopped thinking.

"Uggh!" you sigh, facepalming yourself. This whole scene felt so... cliché. Like this has happened before in movies, but you were experiencing the real.

From where you sat, you could see the almost the whole apartment. You were sitting at a wooden table where its edge reached just above your ribcage. Glancing around, you could see the occasional shadows from under the entrance to the door. There was a beautiful white vase filled with a type of flower you don't recognize... you shoulda paid attention in that herbalism class you took. Back to the point, Natasha had a kitchen that you could peer into where the counter is just below your field of view and you could see hints of the counter opposite of it. The paint was tan, it relaxed you.

You wait for 7 hours, thinking of things to do to keep you entertained, so to speak. Like, you picked up at the flowers to inspect them, and then you sat on the couch, only to get back up again. You explored the rooms of the small apartment, keeping away from the windows and possibly closing then when you could. If you walked up to the west window, you could veer your head to the left to see the end of an alleyway and on the opposite side, a locked chain fence that connected the two complexes together. Further down, there was another street.

Before Natasha left, to collect your newfound 'friends', she gave you a password so that you knew it was safe to unlock the door for other anthros who were working with her. The password was, Kabob. No idea why, but I guess that was the code-word, as awkward as it was... 2 hours later, you hear a knock on the door. Obviously, you had come up with something to say 4 hours ago, it went like this... .

11121222121221111111121111221.content:
"Who is it? My parents said not to let anyone in!" you say, trying to mask your voice in innocence. You hear scuffling outside.

"Uhh, umm, K-kabob!" said the shaking voice of a woman. You perk up to this word. You peel through the spyglass to see a human girl who looks like she is scared, she was holding her arms around her waist. She had golden blonde hair that reached past her elbows, her eyes were pale green, but keen. She was constantly looking over her shoulder as if in search for something.

"Come on, get in quick!" you quietly rush. The door flung open surprisingly fast but very silent. She ran in, head low, you brush past her to glance outside the hallways, you could hear running footsteps and some voices shouting. You don't take a single second to close the door, you locked it and moved a nearby desk in front of it. It took a lot of effort, but you managed to do it, considering it was as high as your shoulders.

The woman twisted around, falling down onto the floor pre-emptively. She glanced around, it was very dark in the house now, because of the time. You were reminded of that when the light turned off. Literally, the lights just shut down for some reason, and the whole building's power shut down! You take a glance at the girl, she was pretty much your age in looks. You were 22. She looks up at you as if she were scared, while on the other hand, you were dumbfounded by the sight of another person!

"Is your name Kiba?" she asks.

"Yes! How did you know?" you respond, shocked.

"It was Natasha, right? Was that her name?" she replied. Yes, Natasha, this came back to you.

"Yes, you know her? Did she tell you everything?" you ask, walking towards her.

"No, she didn't. but she had Luna bring me and Neil here so you and her could explain. Natasha said you and Luna knew everything." she informs. You were put on the spot, I guess... wait, Luna? And another human! This was good news for you, but you took it as more confusion to the mix. You crouch down with one knee resting on the carpeted floor.

"Who is Neil?" you ask.

"Some guy that I met before some, thing, tried to get us. We found out her name was Sam before Natasha saved us." she quickly spoke.

"Wait, your confusing me," you reply, "Luna and another person?" you continued.

"Yes!" she said. She was starting to get wound up. You need to calm her down.

"Wait, calm down, explain slo-" you attempted to say before you heard someone slamming on the door.

"KABOB, KABOB!!! LET US IN!!!" shouted an anxious voice from outside of the door. "Come on!" said another, you recognized this voice as Luna, so you sprinted back towards the door, shoving the desk aside. The door swings open as you see two shadows run past you, one was your height, and one was an anthro's. You slammed the door shut, and then you turn around to see Luna and what you think is Neil.

You want answers, but everything is dark, there are four of you, and there seems to be some group of anthros chasing them. In general, us!

What happens?

"What about th-" Niel tries to say. "There's no time!" Luna cuts in. She motions towards an open window. The girl follows Luna closely. You and Niel do the same. Niel is getting out the window, a large, stable window, when the door bursts open. Niel flicks his head towards the door, shocked. He's stunned. You pull him off the ledge, and the 4 of you continue down the railing. Luckily, some buildings looked the same, so going down an apartment railing was simple.

Luna jumps the last step, and remembers that the 3 smaller humans could not survive the jump if they, well, had jumped. "Jump down! I- I'll catch you!" Luna shouts with confidence. "Come on! We can't wait!" Luna shouts, again. The girl starts heading for the street. You look at the stunned Niel. He looks back at you.

"I won't let you get caught, Kiba." Niel exclaims to you, looking back frantically. He couldn't survive if the anthros had captured him. You look down and up again, you're biding time. You look at Niel then Luna, and you think you figured out the best option...

Push Niel down to safety?

Or listen to Niel's wish.

You're not gonna let Niel be taken. So you push him down to Luna. He falls with a small yell. But that yell was of surprise. The girl looks up to you and sees the anthros in armor grab you. Kiba Lockheart was not a pushover, nor was he going to allow anyone but himself to take a risk. Luna catches Niel perfectly, his glasses bounce as he is let go. Luna, your protector, looks up in astonishment, and regret. She couldn't save everyone, but you did help her with saving one more. The anthros are violently dragging you back up the apartment stairs while you're kicking and punching. You're not going down without a fight.

Niel tries to push back and go to Kiba. He sees Kiba being pulled back into the apartment window, glass scraping away at his legs as he's being dragged away.

"We'll come back for you, Kiba!" Luna yells. She finally gets angry at Niel's pushing and picks him up.

"No!" Niel butts in, feeling defeated. He was upset obviously. The girl follows Luna as Niel hesitates to leave. Meanwhile, with your status, you've been trying to get out of the grip of these four, larger, equipped anthros. "Let go of me!" You yell angrily. You kick one of the anthros who is holding your leg, as they're carrying you via one anthro to limb. It hits the anthro in the chest, winding him. He looks angry and for a moment you regret what you did. This, bull anthro, looked to be the angry one out of the four. He drops your right leg, but pushes forward, making the other anthros move as well, looking back to see what's the trouble. The bull elbows you in the chest so hard you start black out. You become less resistant, focusing on trying to breath. You grunt in response and pain.

"Now why'd you go and do that? You know that might've killed it. Deluma wants the humans alive, for now." One of the anthros say, you catch it before you get hit again by the bull anthro, but this time, in the ribs. You black out.

You really don't want to-- but Niel pushes you down before you could protest.

"No!!" You yell. He looks into your eyes as you fall. Luna catches you, but it takes a lot of effort. Luna looks at your stunned face before looking back up at Niel. She lets you down and yells up to him.

You're only running because you won't allow Niel's sacrifice to go to waste, though he isn't going to be immediately harmed, you know something bad may happen to him.

There's nothing to do in this room other than sleep, or stay awake. The lioness comes in to bring you food and water twice a day. Wait... is it twice a day? It's hard to tell when there aren't any windows. You just know that no one has found you yet, and it's starting to both bug you and make you nervous. The lioness... you think you could take her if you had the chance... and a metal pipe... and the first hit, but you have no energy.

You sigh, going to sleep once again. You think about what the others are doing... trying to find you? Or have they given up.

You dream-- but it's really just a dream, nothing about home or anything about anthros. You're simply flying above the city, unrecognizable figures and cars driving down below. There's nothing that could make you happier or more relaxed at the moment. You hear a voice... wake up... wake up! You open your eyes and see the lioness standing at the doorway, leaning against it. You sigh groggily.

"Finally, you're awake." She says. You groan, looking at your arms, still chained, not free in flight. That was a memorable dream. She smiles a with a devilish grin.

You look at her with apprehension, "What do you want this time?" You say. She hasn't broken your will, but she has broken your strength.

"Nngh, what do you want?" You demanded, your voice full of venom and spite.

111212221212211111111212212.content:
You hear the front door open followed by general conversation , you assume they're talking about you, but it's too muffled to really hear anything meaningful.... Not that it matters. After a few moments you hear movement, sounds like they're finally coming to get you. You're not all that eager to meet your new... 'owner'... but whoever it was couldn't possibly worst than who had you now.

         The door to the room swung open and as you expected, the lioness walked in. However, the buyer who followed her in wasn't quite what you'd expected. She was a black cat with matching shoulder length hair. She wore a loose grey t shirt and black cargo pants. She wore no shoes and was a head shorter than the lioness, but she still stood at least a head taller than you. "Not exactly in prestige condition is he?" The cat asked.

         The lioness shrugged, "I guess not... but He's well enough."

         The cat sighed and shrugged, "Yeah, I guess..." She then walked around you, inspecting and observing you. You returned her gaze as best you could, given you were chained to a pole and that she was literally walking circles around you.

         The lioness seemed to be getting impatient, her tail began flicking from side to side in a very deliberate manner while she stood with her arms crossed. Her right ear began twitching as her eyes narrowed. She exhaled in exasperation, "This isn't a museum, are you gonna buy him or not?"

         Your potential buyer finally stops pacing around you and pauses in from of you, she remains quite as she stares at you for a moment before answering the lioness, "Yeah, I think I'll take him."

         "Finally," The lioness replies with an exasperated huff, "I'll take it in cash, right here, right now or no deal."

         The cat turned to the lioness, "No, you must've misheard me. I said I'll take him."

         The lioness seems to be taken aback, "Is that supposed to be some kind of joke?"

         The cat shrugged, "I'm being totally serious, but I guess I can see how someone could find it amusing."

         The lioness growled, "If you value your life, you'll either give me my money and take the human or leave empty handed and never come back.

         "Actually, neither of those work for me and I'd rather not waste any energy fighting you, so why don't you just hand me the keys to his cuffs so I can take him and you can go back to doing whatever you like to do," The cat replied, her tone nonchalant and her attitude was very casual.

         The lioness was now seething with rage, "You come into my home, lie about buying my human and then tell me you're just going to take him?" I'll kill you where you stand!"

         The cat sighed, "You can try if you like, but I don't think you can."

         That tore it, the lioness roared and charged at the cat with fangs bared and claws extended. The cat easily sidestepped the lioness and evaded her. The lioness slid to a stop and attempted to slash the cat, however she was prepared for this as she dropped to the ground on her back before using both feet to deliver a powerful double kick to her opponent's jaw. The lioness staggered backwards in a daze as the cat leapt back onto her feet. Jumping into the air she smashed her left leg into the side of the lioness head causing her to violently slam into the wall and fall to the ground with a pained moan and a thud.

         The cat dusted her clothes off before searching the lioness' unconscious body for the key's to your handcuffs. After finding them she stood back up to her full height, "Now why don't you stay there and sleep off all that stress, m'kay?"

         She then turned to you and gave you an unabashed and lopsided grin, "Now then, let's see about getting you out of here hm?"

As much as you hate to admit it, you were far too weak to fight back and even if you got loose she would easily catch you. Combine that with the fact that the rest of the world is out to get you and add that you have no idea where Haylee and Amy are to the equation. What's that equal out to? Nothing good... "What?!" You exclaim. "No! No you're not gonna touch me!" You continue. She shakes her head.

"I wanted this to be easy, get some mythical creature, and get some quick money." She says simply. "No buyers-- so that means you--" She points at you with a hungry grin. "Are my dinner." She smirks. What was this to her? The adrenaline in your body starts to flow. You're not going down without a fight.

"Is this a game to you? We're both conscious creatures. Do you even ca-"

"No, and don't worry, it's not dinnertime yet." She cuts in, growling. "You are just a smaller, pathetic creature, I have no interest in keeping you like a pet or an animal in an exhibit. So, since we both know who's dominant..." She grins as her claws extend. She moves very close to you as you try to put as much distance as you can between her, you struggle out of her reach, but your arms are chained. She grabs your jaw and forces you to look at her. Her fangs are showing, she's obviously getting happy. "I'm gonna eat you." She laughs in your face. You scowl at her as she licks your cheek. She lets go of your jaw. You try to hit her but your arms are inevitably settled by the chains.

"You're despicable." You spit.

"You're delicious." She responds slyly. She stands up and unscrews the light bulb, then leaves the room, locking the door again. There's nothing you can do right now. It's dark, and there is no light beaming into your room.

--------------------------------

You sit there, restless, you're not gonna let yourself be eaten. That's-- that's just-- no! There must be something you could do... it's been a while and you're expecting the worst. Your mind flashes back to Haylee and what happened. You've been trying to get the chains off of you, but you were only able to chip the wood it's attached to.

The door to the room shuffles a bit. You swing your attention to the door, it actually scares you for a moment, but you're not gonna be eaten today! You ready yourself for the lioness, prepared to defend yourself with whatever you can do. The handle unlocks and the door swings open, light finally flashing into your eyes for the first time in a while. The tall, dark shadow of the lioness stands there. You hear her stomach grumble.

"You know what time it is." She growls with a certain hunger in her voice. She walks forward, ears shoot straight up. "After tasting you earlier, I just couldn't wait. You're so much more worth in food than money." She says. You sit up and it puts some slack onto your chains. Your eyesight hasn't adjusted to the light.

"Don't touch me!" You yell angrily. You kick at her, but she simply stands out of reach. She turns around.

"We cats can see in the dark, so I don't even know why the light's on." She says simply. You barely adjust to the light as she closes the door, chuckling. You make another attempt to get out of your chains, it won't work. It's dark again, and you can only see her eyes. They stand above you at a staggering height. You see them move down to your eye level before you feel the chains come off your hands. You take this as an opportunity to swing blindly. You push yourself up onto the wall and find a corner. You don't hear her move, but you can hear her growls and purrs and grumbles. With her constant noise, you can hear her. When you blink it doesn't make a difference.

"Back off!" You scowl assertively. She laughs. You're slammed against a wall and lifted up. A paw grips your throat and another holds you up. You slam your hands against the furry arms that are choking you. You see her eyes right in front of yours as you feel a punch hit you in the stomach. You stop your kicking and try to breath... is this it?

"You know... I always wondered what humans tasted like." She purrs. You feel her sharp tongue lap your face as she growls. Her breath is overwhelming as she envelops your head. Her soft tongue tickles your neck as you try to scream.

(Does someone save you at the last second?)
11121222121221111111121222.title: "I guess you're dinner now."

111212221212211111111212221.content:
No one comes to your rescue as her large paw moves from your neck to your other arm, pinning you in place. She shovels you into her mouth as you feel the slick, soft warmth of her neck as your head slides down her throat. You kick her multiple times, but she doesn't care as it simply just doesn't do anything.

"No!!" You yell out, but it's muffled. You feel hers claws dig in to your shirt, tearing part of your clothing. Her body makes it a struggle for you to move. You feel and hear the happy growls and purrs that emanate from her body. She pushes your arms together as she gulps your shoulders down. The lioness uses her tail to grapple your legs together. You struggle as if in the grip of a snake as she continues to eat you. Your hands are enveloped by her soft cheeks. Slowly she dominates you as your head reaches her stomach. Your clothes are slick and damp thanks to the saliva from her mouth. Her teeth brush against your legs as she pushes them in.

There is not much left of you outside of her body now. She gulps down your feet and you feel her tongue once again licking your body, savoring the flavor. You are now completely inside of her, and there's no escape.

"Ahh." She purrs with content. "Better as food." She says. Her purrs rumble deep as she eventually goes to sleep, happy with her catch.

111212221212211111111212222.content:
The door to the room bursts open. At least, you think it did.

You hear muffled words coming from... well, outside her maw. Suddenly you're pulled out of her mouth, and dropped to the floor. You squint your eyes, putting your hands up. You make fists with your hands as you hear a conversation going on. You're practically malnourished, but not so much that you can't defend yourself. The light and her saliva blur your vision.

"Put your hands up--!" A strong, feminine voice yells. You hear scuffling and the stomping of shoes scatter around the room.

"All right-- all right!" The lioness retorts. You hear her lick her chops, she's not really quiet about that, is she? You hear some steps walk towards you. Nuh-uh, no-one's gonna touch you! You swing blindly.

"Hey, hey! Stop that." The unfamiliar voice exclaims. "Stop-- I'm here to help you!" She says assertively. You stop swinging your arms.

You start saying some of the names of anthros you know, hoping that one of them is her. You have already forgotten what some of the people sound like... so you try. "Sarah? Amy?--" You ask. "Haylee? Mira?" It was very unlikely. "Luna?" That's it, no more names.

"Luna?" The voice asks. "She's-- yeah, I know her." She said convincingly. You hear a growl and a tumble. Did the lioness just-- they're fighting! You hear the thuds and growls of them fighting.

"This one's mine!" The lioness roars. "No cop is gonna take it away!" She continues, you hear the tearing of fabric, and the rippling clink of a metal plate. You try to get up, looking around. You still can barely see, so you wipe off the saliva with your arms. A little better, now you just gotta get used to the light. A paw grabs your leg as you tried to walk, the lioness' claws dig into your left leg. You yell in pain as you fall. You're pulled back a little as the paw is torn off of you. You try to get up again, your eyes have adjusted to the light. You limp towards the door, a single tear of pain forming in both of your eyes. That hurt! It pisses you off a lot. You look back to see a husky fighting the lioness. There is a slight glimpse of a badge on the husky's shirt. How'd they find you in time?

You stumble out of the doorway and into the hall, looking left, there's a window, and to the right is a larger room. Before you could make a decision though, your tackled and are being forced at the wall in front of you. You hear the lioness roar as she bites down on your shoulder. You're slammed onto the wall and your head hits it. The lioness is yanked off of you as you fall backwards onto the ground. You black out.
