1112122212122111111112122222.content:
You wake up on the floor, your eyes squint to see the shadow hovering over you. It's that husky, the badge glitters from the light. You have a massive headache, and you feel beat up. Pfft, boxers always deal with that kind of thing... if it were normal. She sighs with relief as you wake.

"Whew, o.k!" The husky said, "Man that woulda been a lot of paperwork." She grumbles. She tries sitting you against the wall as you protest this.

"Who are you?" You demand, quietly. You look her in the eyes as she tries to help you.

"Your savior." She smirks, almost like it's a joke. You look at her with a disgruntled face. She frowns and rolls her eyes. "Sorry, I've always wanted to say that. I'm Natascha Howlings. More people know me by Agent Howlings. You don't know me, but I'm here to help you." She explains. You don't trust her.

"Really? Are you gonna try to eat me to?" You say, exasperated. She shakes her head.

"No, of course not!" She retorts, she looks down at your leg. "Y'know, you were out for about twenty minutes. You need help." She notions. You shake your head as it pounds. "Look-- I don't know what's happened to you, but I'm trying to help-- wait, here. I can convince you." She says. You look at her, puzzled. She pulls out two pictures of humans. One is a girl, another is a guy with glasses. "The agency I work for helps them get out of Deluma's grasp." You start to believe her.

"Really? Tch--" You try to say, you put your hand against your head. She looks to her right. What position are you in to argue? Your head is pounding, and both your leg and shoulder are bleeding. You want to find that lioness and beat her up-- you're so angry. Actually, many emotions are flowing through you at the moment, ranging from anger to fear.

"Stay here-- well, I mean, just wait here for me." She asks, she seems to care about what's happened to you. Not like you're going anywhere anyway. "The person who held you here is tied up and locked in the bathroom." She gets up and walks out. At this moment in time, you realize she tried covering your leg with a bandage. She really does want to help...? You don't fully trust her, but she seems to trust you.

It's hard to believe she came alone. Then again, have you ever known of an 'agent' who doesn't have a mission?
----------------------------------

Two hours go by, it seems there's not much to do other than wait. Natascha is not here yet, and that lioness' angry shouts are not getting any less annoying.

"Could you stop and shut up for a while?!" You yell at her. With all that yelling, it seems that loud noises are indifferent to the apartment.

"Let me out! I have other business to attend to!" The lioness' dampened yells pierce through the crack under the door. You jump at that, pushing yourself back up onto the wall. "I know that stupid husky left, but you're still mine! When I get outta here, you're food!" She growls. She pounds against the door.

"Jesus..." You mumble, you hear the knob being twisted, it's still locked-- wait, is she out of her ties?!

"I'm coming for you, and I haven't eaten in a day!" She scowls. Can you just get a break once in a while?

Should you try to hide?
OR
Stand your ground... well... not like you're gonna move, but you can just stay there and rely on that door...

You wake up.
111212221212211112.content:
No! Of course not! It's a good spot, and she isn't exactly looking around like a normal perso- anthro... should. Y'know, as animals, they should be thinking about the smaller spots to hide, and they're bigger, shouldn't they have bigger brains too?

Anyway, you decide to stay there.

After a bit of waiting, and Haylee staying in the kitchen, suddenly Amy throws her remote. It scares you for a moment, but you're not in a position to move so you didn't expose yourself. Haylee looks around the door to the kitchen too see an upset Amy, crossing her arms and clenching her lips.

"Now, why'd you go and do that?" asked Haylee, as her eyes darted around.

"There aren't any shows... UGH!!" Amy grunts. "Geez. Don't they ever come up with anything good anymore?!"

"Psht, who even watches tv? We've got wifi." Haylee responds as she pulls a device out of her pocket.

You are thankful that you never moved, because your hair would've definitely been in Haylee's sight. Might as well be silent for now.
----
A bit later...

"Come out!! Oh my god! How does a thing like you hide so well!" Haylee shouts in frustration. Hehe, you've got her now, though, you've had the dedication of staying in one spot for almost 20 minutes. You're kind of cramped and your muscles are starting to tighten, as if you were crouching. Oh wait... you were.

You forgot when she said the game would be over. Nice memory there bub, but then again, did she say anything? You start to ponder this as you hear the tapping of a phone. It's Amy. You're sort of bored at this point to have been hiding like that for a while. Crouching, breathing soft, staying still... just like prey. You know what she was playing at, which it does make you ponder once again... "what he tastes like". It's been repeating in your head for quite some time. It almost feels like you've been behind this couch for a whole millennia.

Funny enough, Haylee walks out of the kitchen for the third time in 10 minutes. Good thing you didn't pick the kitchen to hide in, because that would be like a spec. ops mission level of hide and seek. Now you're just playing with the back of the couch. It's made of a different material than you know of, and it's very... slick. Slick like leather, but it's not sticky and it practically glides your hand across when you touch it. Like, Dopey trying to hold soap, but your hand is the soap bar and the couch is clumsy. But that's where you're wrong, as the couch looks simple.

As you're exploring the couch's backside, you slide your hand across the back-end one more time. You slide your hand too far and end up sticking out behind the couch. Unluckily for you, Haylee was there.

"Aha!" She exclaims, as she starts to sprint towards you. You get up as quick as you can, frightened momentarily, and adrenaline kicks in. Haylee dives towards the couch, and ends up sliding over it. You get up and run around, now you're both on opposite ends.

You and her make eye contact, her fangs slightly showing from over-excitement, your eyes widening and darting around the living room. Wolf and human, fits the description perfectly. You see the kitchen door on Haylee's side, and you know the exit to the stairs is behind you. 'Maybe I cou-! You tried to think, but Haylee starts coming towards you. Kicking off, you run behind towards the exit, Amy tries to move her head around the two of you to see the tv.

"Move it!" Amy whines, motioning her paws to dart the edges. Clasping the edge of the wall, you use it to propel yourself towards the stairs, but suddenly, you trip. Looks like being cramped for a while stunned your movement a bit, continuing on, yet slower, you get to the top of the stairs.

Looking around, there are 5 doors... but before you could pick one, Haylee jumps the final step to the top of the stairs and grabs onto your legs, with her huge, wolf-like paws. You practically fall like a baby.

"WHA-!" You exclaim. Bracing for your fall.

"Gotcha!" Haylee yips gleefully. She uses her knees to get up and her huge paws to drag you back. Your arms sting, but you had found a way to swing them around a door frame. She lets go of your legs suddenly. You use the chance to get up, but get interrupted again because she picks you up and pins you to the wall.

"Augh!!" you mutter, now you're facing her, and she is to you. Her fangs look to be widened in her large, wicked grin. You can smell her breath as she talks...

"Finally, " she inhales quickly, "I've gotten you. Gosh! You hid amazingly! Now though, *huff* I've got my prey!" She huffs.

"Wa- wai- wait wait! What?!" you get out quickly, but she stuffs your head into her mouth. Struggling ferociously, you try to get your head out. You scream, but it's muffled. The feel of the wet, slimy tongue against your face feels weird, but her teeth are brushing against your back, and it's giving you a soft, tickling feeling that sends a chill down your spine.

"Help!!!" You scream, yet again it's muffled. This is unearthly. How is this even happening! You had no time to think, and panic is attacking you. You strain your fists and tighten your fingers, pushing against her huge paws holding your arms in place. This isn't working. She shovels you in further. Arms feeling slimy, and your neck and head being pushed against by her soft, large throat. There is nothing you can do but kick the wall.

You are terrified, screaming, this is not the Kiba you know, you're stronger than this, man! You are... you're... no. You black out.

1112122212122111121.content:
Your vision slowly comes to you as you awaken. You find yourself staring at a ceiling in a bedroom while laying in a large bed. Your vision starts to clear when the events of the day came back to you in a tidal wave of memories, the latest of which was the most frightening. Even more frightening was the fact that the same anthro who had been consuming you earlier was at the foot of the bed watching you. You bolted upright and crawled back against the bed's headboard.

The white wolf chuckled, "Settle down, you're alright."

"Y-you ate me!" You shouted as you held yourself against the headboard.

Haylee put a finger to her lips and glanced at the ceiling as if she were in thought, "Mmm, I think 'sampled' would be a more accurate description. See, after you passed out, I released you and carried you in here."

You relaxed yourself from your position on the wall, "Well, don't ever do that again!" You ordered. You secretly hoped that your assertiveness would make her reconsider turning you into a meal.

Haylee giggled at your request, "I promise nothing," She stated with a sly grin. You rolled your eyes and sighed. "However, what I will say is that you are safe here. There's a reason Sarah brought you here, we'll take good care of you." You sighed again, there wasn't really much you could do about the personality of the wolf, but at least you were safe with her.

Safe, but sore. It hurt to have been violently stopped in your tracks, bracing your fall was easy enough, but you still hurt. How long had it have been since... she ate you? Gosh, that's weird to say, considering it's just not physically possible for humans. How could an anthro do that... wait, no, that's a question for another day. You look at your arms, elbows, they have small bruises. Haylee finally notices what she did.

"Oh... " she looks out the window for a moment, frowning with regret, "sorry about that. It's just, you're a weird thing from a completely different universe or something. I didn't mean to hurt you." Haylee apologized sincerely. You think about it for a moment, you debate if your sustained bruises and rigid, stiff legs are forgivable things. After all... maybe you should forgive her, better to make friends with, well, the only anthros who have been nice to you.

Will you forgive Haylee?

(Extra note, the first paragraphs are from a different line by Metra, the same thing happened, just differently.)

11121222121221112.content:
You decide your going left. You figure there's probably more rooms up there than downstairs which would make you a bit harder to find... or at least you hope that's the case. You dart up the steps with some difficulty, remembering that they were made for anthros. When you make it to the top of the stairs you find a wall to your left, a closed door directly in front of you and a hallway with three doors in it that dead ends to your right.

         "Ten seconds left!" Haylee shouts from downstairs.

         You open the door to the room in front of you but you don't go in. Instead you move quietly down to the end of the hall and open the last door you find. The door was already cracked so you slip into the room and leave the door the way it was when you found it. You sigh and catch your breath for a moment before turning around to survey the room. The room itself is painted purple, you find a large crescent moon painted on the ceiling and small stars dotting the borders of the walls. The bedspread is purple as well with small crescent and full moons worked into the stitching. You find a large mirror next to a door which you think is the closet and a window beside the head of the bed. You continue to observe the room when you here an unsettling sound from downstairs.

         "Ready or not, here I come!" Haylee called.

         You sigh and shake your head, "What am I even doing here?" You wonder. You silently stride to the window and open it. You find that it actually sits just above part of the roof over the first floor as you are greeted with a view of slanted, overlapping shingles. You tentatively step out of the window and onto the roof before closing the window behind you. You can't get it to close all the way, but you really don't care. It's not like they'll notice or care if you're gone. You look out ahead of yourself and find that the next housetop isn't too far off. You stand up and get a running start before jumping over the gap between the rooftops and landing on the house next door. You glance back at the window you'd exited out of earlier, "I'll come back... but I need to go where I can just be alone for a bit..." You scale the housetop and get to the other side before getting a running start and leaping to the next house. You continue doing this for some time, occasionally changing direction. Eventually you find yourself panting and decide to rest on the next house you land on. When your feet touch down you sit down on the slanted rooftop and lay back against it. You stare up at the sky wondering if you'll ever get to go home. You really wanted to, but you knew that in reality the odds were that you probably wouldn't.

****
         Meanwhile, back at Amy and Haylee's house, Haylee was still looking for you. It had been around twenty minutes since you left, and Haylee was running out of places to look. "Hmph... that human is a lot better at hiding than I gave him credit for. I thought for sure he'd be in Amy's room since the door was open..." Haylee muttered. "I've looked all over the place upstairs and downstairs but I just can't find him... The only place I haven't checked is my room." Haylee shrugged as she climbed the stairs again and headed for the end of the hallway. She pushed the door open and turned on the lights. Her room happened to be the room you were in right before you escaped her game through the window. "Alright, you won... you can come out now" She called, expecting you to pop out from some dark corner of her room. But you didn't, she sighed before looking under the bed and then in her closet. She kept looking and tore apart her room until she noticed that her window was cracked. "I never open my window," She muttered before walking over to the window to close it... however before she closed it she noticed a pair of small footprints on the roof. Her eyes widened as she realized why she couldn't find you.

         Downstairs, Amy was lazily laying on the couch watching her favorite show when Haylee's head popped into her view and blocked the television from her sight. "Haylee... you're in the way..." Amy grunted as she tried to watch the show around the wolf's head.

         "Sorry Amy, but I have something important to tell you..." Haylee replied as she bit her lip.

         Amy paused and stared at the wolf expectantly, "What is it?" She asked in her standard, neutral tone. She then glanced around the room before focusing on Haylee again, "And where's the human? I thought you were watching him."

         Haylee bit her lip, "About that... I think he may have, sorta left the house without telling me..."

         Amy blinked at Haylee as if trying to comprehend what she had said. Amy gritted her fangs before sitting up on the couch, "Define 'kinda, sorta' and 'left the house'."

         Haylee gave a sheepish laugh, "Definitely and ran away..."

         "You lost him!?" Amy shouted in disbelief.

         "Well, yeah..." Haylee admitted, "But he couldn't have gotten far!" She quickly added.

         "How far is 'not far'?" Amy demanded.

         "A couple of blocks give or take?" Haylee replied.

         "In other words he's still in the neighborhood but we don't know where exactly in the neighborhood... right?" Amy hissed through gritted fangs. Haylee nodded shamefully. Amy shook her head. "Come on, we've gotta find that kid before someone else does." With that, the pair dashed out the door.

111212221212211122.content:
You were still laying on the rooftop you last landed on. You solemnly gazed up at the sky which was beginning to fill with more and more clouds by the second. You hear the rumble of thunder in the distance before you feel the sprinkle of raindrops on your face. You sigh and close your eyes before cover them with the back of you hand. "This is someone's cruel idea of a joke..." You mutter as the rain begins to pick up.

         "What makes you say that?" A curious female, almost childlike voice asked.

         "It's just to ridiculous to be anything else," You reply.

         "Maybe its just bad luck?" The voice suggests.

         "I don't believe in luck" You reply.

         "Then what do you believe in?" The voice inquired.

         "I don't know anymore," You answer, feeling defeated. You're about to sigh when you realize that for the first time in your life. You talked to yourself and got a reply. You remove your hand from your face and open your eyes and find a raccoon anthro staring down at you with a curious expression on her face. She has teal eyes and brown fur that covered most of her body and a bushy tail with black and brown stripes. She was wearing a pink tank top that exposed her midriff and black runner's shorts with pink tennis shoes. She had black hair that stopped just above her shoulders and wore a tennis visor (basically a baseball cap without a top) that sat just under her large pointed ears. Her underbelly was a cream color as were her forearms, while her hands/paws were black with teal polished claws at the end of each finger. The bottom of her muzzle was also a cream color and her eyes and the top of her muzzle were covered by black fur that formed a 'mask' on her face (typical of a raccoon fur pattern). You leap up and make a dash to jump off of the rooftop and over to the next one to make an escape. However, in your haste you completely for get about the rain. Its made everything slick, and while you may have been ok jumping off one rooftop that didn't mean you were ok landing on the next one. When you touched down on the next housetop you slip and fall belly down on the roof. You begin to slide off of the roof feet first, you glance down at your feet just in time to watch your shoes disappear over the edge knowing that you'll follow and probably die from the fall... or break several bones in your body.

         Just before you go over the edge, you feel something engulf half of your fore arm in its grip. You look up and find the raccoon girl from before holding on to you with a inquisitive yet concerned expression on her face. She hefts you up the roof and sits down on her but with her legs spread apart and pulls you to her so that your sitting between her inner thighs and your back is resting against her torso. Her arms wrap around your chest and stomach as you try to catch your breath. "Are you ok?" She asks.

         You nod you head as you try to respond but can't seem to find the breath to do so yet. You can't see her face but you're sure she's looking at you worriedly. Once your breathing regulates you verbally answer her to calm her mind, "I'm fine," You tell her.

         She sighs in relief, "I'm glad... I thought that you might have gotten hurt when you slipped or when I pulled you up..."

         "No, I'm ok... really" You try to assure her.

         The two of you sit quietly in the rain for a little bit before she breaks the silence, "You should believe in yourself..."

         You look back at her confused, "I... what?"

         She responds by hugging you tighter before repeating herself, "You should believe in yourself. Earlier you told me that you weren't sure what you believed anymore, but I think you should believe in yourself."

         You sit there wondering what she means by that when you feel a soft weight resting on your head. "I should believe in myself huh?" You muse, "How can I do that when I can barely survive in this world without people like you snatching me out of the fire every five minutes."

         "Hmm..." She hums, the vibration of her voice actually vibrates your skull causing you to realize that weight you felt earlier is her head, She's holding you like some kind of teddy bear. "Well, if you won't believe in yourself, I'll believe in you!" She decides.

         "Um... thanks?" You reply, not sure how to feel about what just happened. "I don't mean any offense but, who are you?"

         "My name's Kathy, but everyone calls me Kat" She replies with a bubbly and cheerful voice, "What's your name?"

         "I'm Kiba," You tell her.

         "Nice to meet ya Kiba!" She says, "So are you that human that everyone's been talking about?"

         "Probably..." You sigh. Before you can think about anything else, a question pops into your head, "Hey Kat? How old are you?"

         "I'm eighteen!" She happily exclaims, "How old are you Kiba?"

         "Me? I'm twenty one..." You answer.

You two continue chatting for a bit until someone spots you... Oh don't look at me like that... You're the only human on this world sitting on a rooftop with a raccoon girl holding you like a teddy bear in the rain... how could you not get spotted? Anyway, the question I should be asking is who spotted you?

She smiles down at you and bends over to hug you again before hoisting you up and over her shoulder like a fireman carrying a child to safety and runs off to catch up with Amy and Haylee.

She sighed and pulled back from you, "I know I haven't exactly been all smiles... but I've had a rough couple of weeks. Finding out that I've gotta take care of a trouble magnet didn't exactly make me feel better."

         "Yeah, that's all well and good," You interrupt, "But what about her?!" You ask as you gesture to Haylee. "She hinted at EATING ME!"

         Amy crossed her arms and stood upright before giving Haylee an irritable stare, "Please tell me you didn't."

         "Well... maybe a little... but I would've let him out!" She insisted.

         Now everyone in the room was awkwardly staring at her. Amy shook her head and sighed, "From now on no more running away..." She said as she glared at you, "And I promise," She continued as she softened her face, "To be more... welcoming." You nodded quietly, she gave a quick nod herself before turning to Haylee, "And you... try to behave yourself. And if you say your going to watch the kid then WATCH HIM!"

         Haylee sighed and rolled her eyes, "Fine, sure whatever."

         "Good," Amy said, satisfied with everyone's answers.
11121222121221112211.title: You make it back to the house without any issues

choices: The next morning (Get up sleeping beauty!)
Something Else wakes you during the night (Oh God, I Just Wanna Sleep!)
111212221212211122111.content:
After your... discussion, Amy took you upstairs to an empty bedroom, "This will be your room," The only thing in it is a bed and a light "I know its kind of barren... but nobody's supposed to know you live here, so it has to look like nobody lives in here."

         You shrug, "It's fine, I've seen far worse."

         "Alright," Amy sighed, "Well, I'm going to bed, so I guess I'll see you in the morning."

         You nod and bid her goodnight as you climb onto the bed and lay your head down on the pillow. It didn't take long for you to fall asleep after the day you'd had. Within a few minutes you were sleeping soundly in a dreamless sleep. Later that night though, you were stirred awake, you groggily opened your eyes and glanced over the room, nothing seemed to have indicated that it was morning, and you were still sleepy. It wasn't until you tried to get out of bed that you felt two furry arms constrict around your stomach and chest. You tried to turn yourself to see who was holding you but you couldn't. You tried to get out of bed, but you couldn't do that either. Whoever was holding you had a strong grip on you. Eventually the grip loosened just enough for you to slip out of your captor's grasp. You slid out of bed and turned on the lights to find Kat laying in your bed, she slowly stirred in her sleep before waking. At first her expression was blank, and then concerned when she noticed you were missing but when she saw you by the light switch she gave you a tired smile.

         "Kat, what are you doing in here?" You asked.

         "Amy told me to sleep on the couch but I couldn't sleep. It felt hard and lumpy and it was cold downstairs too. So I came up here to sleep with you..." She explained. The way she spoke made it seem like she was a child.

         You shrug, "Well ok then... I guess I can sleep on the couch-"

         "No!" She shouted causing you to jump a bit, "I don't want to sleep up here by myself. I slept by myself last night and the night before that... and I don't like it. I get lonely at night, please sleep next to me? Pretty please?"

         "Now she's really starting to sound like a child," You think to yourself as she stared at you with misty puppy dog eyes. You meet hold your gaze with her for a while longer before giving in, "Fine, fine... ok..." This makes her very happy as her expression changes to one of pure joy and relief. You turn out the lights and crawl back into to bed. The second you lay down Kat wraps her arms around you like your nothing more than a teddy bear to her.

         As the two of you settled in, Kat sighed happily, "You have no idea how lonely I've been for the past couple of days. Being on your own is hard."

         "I know the feeling," You murmur as you stroke one of Kat's arms. You find it odd how something nearly twice your size is afraid to sleep alone, but you understand how she feels. She's never had family, and the only place she could call home was off limits for her now, if you combine that with the fact that she was never really raised then its not hard to see why she acts the way she does. Eventually you feel sleep creeping up on you once again, you mumble a 'good night' to Kat as sleep takes you.

         Kat's ears twitch and her lips curled into a small smile, content with your company and happy that she's found a kindred spirit she too began to drift to the dream realm. "Goodnight... big brother..." She muttered.

         You were barely able to catch it, but you heard her response just as you fell asleep, "Big... bro.. ther?" You mumble.

1112122212122111221112.content:
A while later, as you were sleeping, you felt as if your throat was raw and your face was freezing! You glance around the room, squinting your eyes open. The light was still on, and the window was wide open! You dont want to disturb Kat again, so you wait a moment and carefully move out of the bed and get onto your feet. A cold breeze surrounded you as you stood, shivering, you walk over to the lamp and turn it off. Now, the problem was the window, you close it shut. The breeze of the wind stopped. There was silence... nothing... you keep gazing out the window, and you see the silent neighborhood, dark, the moon shining upon every surface it touched. You relax, the -apperently- stunning view was nice, but you were only on the second floor. You think for a moment...

"Wait, I thought I did turn off the lights." You think to yourself but then you look back at the window, looking out into the streets.

You started to feel warm, quite literally, taking in the sight of the view. But wait, a few moments later, you realize something, that warmth wasn't coming from you! Someone was behind you! You start to notice big furry paws, moving slowly around your head, you don't turn your head, to avoid suspicion to glance at the paws. They were not Haylee's, Amy's, or Kat's, they were yellow. You have to act fast!

What do you do?!

11121222121221112211121.content:
You instinctively take to the ground, tucking and rolling backwards underneath whoever was above you. You stop and jump up, you feel the chain of the lamp, and pull. You step back, looking at the anthro standing before you.

The anthro was a yellow furred lioness, she was tall and she had blonde hair, just reaching past her shoulders and her eyes glared at you, they were yellow. She was also, you noticed after looking a second time, very strong, her arms were about just as thick as one of your legs. She was wearing a black suit, obviously to avoid detection when in the dark. You walk backwards some more, she is looking at you as if she was determined to do something. She is rushing forward, staring you down intensely, you open your mouth to say something.

"K-kat!" You stutter, obviously loud, the lioness swings at you. You dodge to the left, hitting the corner of the room, you continue sliding to the left, trying to dodge all of the lioness's punches and swings.

"KAT!" You say a little louder, she is obviously still asleep. Seeing as you are tired too, you think of a way you can try to get out of the lioness's line of fire, you end up dodging her punches still. Finally, you hit the desk, and you fall over with it among the lamp, the desk hit the floor with an unmistakable noise.

"What? Who?" Kat flings up, looking around, the lamp had broken into a bunch of shards, some cutting into your skin. But hey, your a tough guy, the glass doesn't seem to bother you, but from the shock of the fall, you definitely know this happened. The noises were blasting through the house, waking everything that was living. The yellow furred anthro was still attacking you. She pulled out a cloth, some white patch of material, and jumped on you. Her hands hit your face, generally near your mouth, and Kat saw the lioness strangling you! Kat was scared and ran out into the hallway, flinging the door open.

"Amy!! Haylee!!" She cried out, getting the two's attention. Back in the room, you tried to breath, but when you inhaled the material that was soaked into the cloth, you started to immediately go to sleep without even getting her off of you. Kat rushed back into the room and dropkicked the anthro that was now about to pick you up. You could not catch the rest of it, as you finally had fallen asleep due to the material.

And, you wake up in the same spot that you fell asleep in. (If you read the other storylines, you would've been captured if not for meeting Kat)
11121222121221112211121.title: Duck and roll, hopefully away from the stranger.

someone suddenly comes through the door. (friends)
111212221212211122111211.content:
"Ughh," you moan as you sit up, "wait, what?" You held your hand on your head, spinning it around to see the room. You recognized the room immediately, and memories flooded back to you. Your head was feeling like it was being pushed back, and the corners of objects suddenly felt as if you were hurting your eyes. You get up, moving the blanket that was on you and as you glance around, and the room is empty. There was a slight ring in your ear as your right eye started watering, you rub it and your vision is clearer. The sun hit your face as you see the window open, giving a pleasant breeze, but man, you were cold.

The first thing your eyes fixed upon was a bed, the one you slept in. Your vision was better after rubbing your eyes. There, beside the bed, you see Kat sitting in a chair that was propped up against the wall. She looked tired, you took a closer look and noticed she was asleep. You slowly walk over to her, and you say something.

"Kat? Are you ok?" You asked, your voice was airy. She opened her eyes, and she jumped up looking at you. She was so happy to see you, ok. Especially after what... happened? What actually happened? She practically tackled you, hugging you tightly.

"Big brother!" She squealed, tears were running down her eyes. She was so releived, that she did not realize she was forcing the air out of your lungs. Spinning around, she was lifting you out of the air. She set you back down as you regained your breath. You did not know why she was so exited.

"Oh my god! I thought you were gonna DIE!! Thank you, thank you, thank you for not!" She shrieked with joy. Die? She wasn't serious, right?

"Wait, DIE!?!" you shout.

"I don't know, you were just lying there, I didn't know what to do so I just put a blanket on you ." She responded quickly. You glance at the blanket and back at her. She is just a kid at mind, so she wouldn't know the situation you guess.

"What happened?" You asked, calmly. She explains everything to you in a heartbeat.
111212221212211122111211.title: You wake up a while later.

choices: A bell wakes you up. (End of the day! Time to sneak some food!)
Something jolts you awake! (Reader's Choice. Lightning? The vent? ...an anthro?)
111212222.content:
You look at the school. Anthros are very, very tall, must eat a lot. You'd rather not think of what they'd eat, but of how much they'd eat. Best option, because you're starting to get hungry... but how would you get over there?

Maybe... wait, nocturnal animals go out when dark... and day ones go out... there's a moment where I could dash to the school. Morning! Just when the sun goes up I need to make a dash for it! Perfect! Just the plan!

------------------------------

It's morning time, it seems to be a very cold day. What's the weather even like here? It was normal yesterday... not it looks like it's about to rain. The cold is keeping you awake, so not all is bad. You can barely see five feet in front of your face. At least you know no animal can see through fog!

You prepare yourself to run, you know that there may be some early-bird students there already. Let's try to stay out of sight, shall we? You find a way down the house and scamper to the school, jumping from bush to bush as you go. You stand near the entrance and take a quick look around... into fog. All this condensation hides your scent... or at least you think. You dive behind the wall and enter the school's walls, but not the actual building itself yet. You look around and try to find some sort of direction map-- but you can't. You are literally out in the open for all to see, yet, no one can see in this fog...

You enter the large building that was the school, and you look to see no one there. The lights are on and there's no fog in the building. You scan your surroundings to see many signs showing you where to go. Now, you're lucky not to have been spotted-- yet, so you need to make the most of it. You run down the hall to find the directional symbols indicating where to go. Being the strategist that you are, you find a perfect course to get to the lunch-room/cafeteria. Immediately you start in that direction. There seems to be no one here.

You run by a clock, '7:34', given when you went to school... eight was about the time it started. The halls are so long-- and wide... and tall. It also seems that the indoor lockers are also somewhat larger too.

You finally reach the lunchroom when you realize-- the lunch attendants-- they'll probably be there. Damn! All this planning, and yet you get stopped by the last thing you expected. our stomach grumbles, and you are thirsty beyond belief. O.k., o.k., find a fountain, and find a way to the roof... simple. At least, it sounded simple.

You hear footsteps in a couple of corridors, and you avoid them swiftly-- a fountain! You spot a fountain and run to it, disregarding whoever may be in the crossing section. You get to it and drink for a while. The best thing you've had in a day. You exhale happily, and quietly. It was then that you realize someone was watching you. It was a single person, a bird anthro. He looks at you with an astonished face. His beak opens, he doesn't know what to do. You see he's holding an instrument and has a backpack on. Green feathers.

"Uh..." You say, you immediately run backwards and away from the bird. You hear the scratching of his talons as they shuffle on the hard, smooth floor. Welp! Let's hope he was too stunned to say anything. You think back to the layout of the school, and thanks to your strategic brain, you remember where the roof entrance is. It's in the Janitor's Closet. You run there and, thankfully, you are able to open the door. You scramble up the miscellaneous shelves and get on the roof. You take a deep breath and try to calm down. The brisk cold hits your skin again, now indifferent thanks to last night. It is very cold... maybe you could grab the fire blanket you saw and use it.

You go down and grab it, only to come back up again, onto the school roof. You make sure the latch is closed before you try to get acquainted with the roof. You'll probably live here for all you know.

--------------------------------

The cold is a breathtaking reminder that not only are you on some other planet, you're also inferior to literally everything in this world. Maybe you could take on a shorter anthro that was your size, or a taller one where you had the drop on them... with a metal pipe... and protective gear... and they were alone... no luck, huh? You sit against a vent, looks like it's gonna be foggy all day. Wait, it looks like the ground is a bit darker than you remember... a bit-- wetter. You look up. Water lightly splashes your face as you sigh.

"Just one of those days..." You mumble. You find a way to attach the fire blanket to two very close vents, essentially creating a roof. You huddle up next to the warmer vent. You haven't slept in a long time... y'know, this actually... feels... really nice... you close your eyes.

You fall asleep really quickly.
111212222.title: Y'know, education iisss kind of important...

choices: Eat it. (Give it a shot?)
Look for a more reliable source of food. (Let's be safe...)
1112122221.content:
You are jump-scared awake by a noise. You shuffle like a bunny until you realize it's only the bell. You make a deep, disgruntled sigh.

"Talk about an alarm clock..." You grunt. You get up to see the fog has lifted... a little bit. You could see the building you were on the night before, but not past that. Let's say you could see about two-hundred feet in each direction. You stretch and yawn. Best sleep you've had in two days. It's still day, but it's slowly becoming dark. You crawl out of your rather small abode. You get up and walk over to the front of the school. The students are leaving, some getting into differently shaped cars as they drive off. You can see some of them talking, but you're so high up you can't hear anything but vents, or any loud cars.

This would be a perfect time to leave, the lunch attendants would've gone home a while ago. Only teachers would still be there, but what's a teacher when you can simply avoid them? You go back to the hatch. You open it slowly and silently so no one can hear. You climb down to see that the brooms have been taken. You slowly open the door back into the school. No one in the halls. You look both ways before darting to the lunch room. You are hungrier than you've ever been in a long time. If you can't get any food, you may just starve.

You slow down around corners, you may have a place to run too, but if you're caught it won't last for long... no one is in the lunchroom. You open the door to find a large, beautiful mess hall. You see the counter where anthros would get their food and you run over to it, closing the lunchroom door behind you. You slow down as you walk towards the glass. You see no food in the empty holes that large quantities of food would be in. You grunt.

"So much for hot food..." You groan. Your stomach cramps and you lean forward. You wince a bit, wheezing ever so lightly. You calm down and move around the counter and head for the drooping plastic that led to the kitchen. You smell food, but it's just aftermath. You salivate at the opportunity. Looking around, you see boxes almost as tall as you, brown cardboard, wrapped in a plastic lining. You ignore what it says, because you're so focused on trying to find something. You spot a small box, it looked to be a carton of sorts. You grab it and inspect it... suspicious, but you can't tell what it is. The side of it is labeled with English, or 'Zoplage', and it reads to be an unknown word. Must be an anthro thing... you open the carton. It was one of many where you pulled it out of, so no-one except a very perceptive lunch-lady would find out.

It doesn't smell bad... but it doesn't smell good either. There's a date of expiration on it-- it expires about twenty days from now. Good... but is it?

Try it? (It may have a side effect of knocking you out... I don't know why but I think that's a side effect-- don't ask me why I think that--!)
OR
Throw it away, look for something else. (Let's be safe on this one.)
1112122221.title: School's out!

choices: The next day...
(Reader's Choice)
11121222212.content:
You decide not to eat it, as enticing as it may be. You find a garbage can and throw it away before continuing through the kitchen. You groan, your stomach hurts from the hunger. You stumble through the kitchen, looking for anything...

There! You spot some... fruit? Never mind that, it's in a basket and it looks scarce, like multiple students took a fruit each. You grab the basket quickly and dumbly. You grab the most eatable-looking fruit and bite into it. You ignore the taste, regardless of however good or bad it is. You greedily chow down on the fruit. It's the best thing you've had in days now, and your vision starts to clear up.

After you ate the fruit, you threw away the cores, pits, and whatever seeds were in the fruits. You decide to not grab fruit for later, as it would go rotten the next day. Would you know that? No, of course not, you're just guessing at this point.

You sneak back down the hallway, you haven't drank since this morning-- despite the rain. You look around the hall this time, the image of the shocked bird anthro still fresh in your mind. No one here. You grab a drink from the same fountain and navigate your way back onto the roof.

-------------------------------------

You repeat this process over the course of three weeks. On the weekends, you could sneak in. They never seem to lock the janitor's closet and it also feels like the roof is non-existent to everyone. You are barely living and you feel as if this might just be your life at this point. The school was such a good hiding place, even the police that patrolled the area never thought about looking in their high-school.

You sigh as you sit atop the roof, under your hideout. It's grown since the first night. Over time you realized that the students actually may need the fire blanket more than you do in a dire situation. You relieved your inner tension after finding a type of fabric in the school's art classes. You were able to get enough wood and scrap metal from the school's crafts classes to create a better roof, and you have memorized the school like the back of your hand.

You haven't had anyone to talk too... for a long time. A month almost. You may be strong-willed, and somewhat of a lone wolf, but you're not one to go a long time without anyone at all. This sucks. You dare not to go outside of the school though, cops still roam the area for humans... and maybe you specifically.

-------------------------------------

What now?
11121222212.title: Not a chance!

choices: Go with it.
Come up with your own plan. (Reader's Choice)
111212222121.content:
You wake up to the sound of a bell. The morning bell. Dang it! You missed your chance to get water. You rub your eyes. Sitting up, you find that the morning looks better than it has in a while. It's fall, or at least it seems like it, the leaves on miscellaneous trees have turned many different colors.

There's nothing to do-- other than going back to sleep. You simply lay back down, waiting for the day to end. Normally you'd do something to entertain yourself, but recently there's been an upcoming of a long break. Definitely not summer, but an anthro-related holiday break. Maybe something to do with their history or simply just a break in general. You worry that they might not get a shipment of food because of this long break. It actually started to snow yesterday-- light, fluffy snow. It was only for about an hour, but you know this may spell bad things for you.

You suggest it to be some sort of winter break, meaning you'd have to double up the amount of sheets you have and not rely on the vents for heat. You don't sleep, but you do watch as the sun practically drags on the day until sunset. Over time, you wake yourself up and get ready for a massive break for things. You may be hungry, but you're smart not to grab anything more than a ton of food until everyone leaves. If you dared try to sneak anything large like more wood or cloth from the craftsman section of the school.

Three weeks has given you enough time to plot the layout and times of the school. You may be on the roof, but your strategic mind has gotten you a ton of information. Very rarely would you sneak down and steal binders-- you always put the student's binders back before they notice. By chance though, you stole a completely unused one and grabbed whatever paper you could find to make a calendar, draw a layout, and lay down the times of teacher's shifts. Not only teachers, but specifically the anthros who work the lunch room. This helped you so that you could virtually never be caught.

--------------------------

The bell rings and you go on the routine food run. You make sure no one is following you... but you can't get this one noise of scratching tile out of your head. You constantly look behind you for that scratching noise. Grabbing a box of labeled food, you make sure to grab a flat of water. Perfect, just enough for this long break.

You run back into the janitor's closet and onto the roof. You make a sigh of relief as the feeling of being followed subsided. You set down the flat of water and box of food. You believe night would be a good option to go back into the school.

--------------------------

A couple hours later you get to watch the beautiful sunset. Given-- it may be shattered a bit by the buildings on the ground, it's still beautiful in its own way. You lean against a resident vent, thinking about your life. After a while, you get so lost in thought that you didn't notice the latch opening. You stand looking at the sunset until you hear a thud. The latch! You whip your attention towards the vent and see a familiar sight. It's that bird-- from weeks ago! You stand there, gawking at the green bird. He looks at you with confidence in his eyes.

You look around, hoping to find an unnoticed exit, but there's nothing you can spot.

"I knew it wasn't my imagination!" He exclaims. He seems happy to relieve himself of his doubts, at the cost of scaring the life outta you. You don't know what to do, but you get ready to defend yourself. You stand in a defensive position. He notices this and immediately changes his expression to fearful. "Hey, hey, I'm not gonna tell anyone you're up here!" He blurts.

"What do you want?" You wheeze, you haven't talked in a while. He stutters a bit.

"I- I watched you over the course of three weeks-- " He admits. You are stunned at this. "I didn't say anything because I didn't know what to do-- so I thought about it for a while-- and-- I wanted to help you." He explains. You slowly let go of your defensive position, the anthro is just a teenager really.

"Why?" You ask, your voice is a bit better now.

"Well-- you've been living in horrible conditions, I've got no friends, and you're a mythical creature living in hiding." The bird tells you, he sounds like he's trying to convince you to do something. Coming up here must've taken a ton of courage... wait--

"Does anyone else know I'm up here?" You ask sharply. He shakes his head.

"Only I know. Not even the wolves in school know about you being here. Nor the teachers." He says. You are a bit relieved at that... but what does he want?

"My name is Kiba." You explain. The bird notices your setup by the vents.

"My name is Lano, and to think about it, it's becoming winter. You won't be able to survive up here during then, because they're going to lock every entrance to the school. Power will be out... no shipments of food..." He says in a slow way, like he's gonna say something else. "I can offer you a place to stay in secret, in turn, you can tell me about you-- and where you came from...?" He seems to drag away at the offer, he's shy and doubting.

You need to think about it for a moment... and you admit it will be hard to live here... "Why do you want to help me?" You question curiously.

"I don't know-- if I knew a creature such as you were living in horrible conditions and I could've done something about it, I couldn't stand that." He admits strongly. You find it hard to believe that an anthro wants to help you. A strong breeze whips by both of you and harshly reminds you that Lano's right. You look at your setup and back at the bird.

"Fine-- sure, I'll agree to that." You reluctantly admit. He smiles... or at least it looks like he does.

"Cool!" Lano exclaims. He's obviously happy with your decision. "The only problem now would be about how to get you around... and not get you caught by anyone..." He mumbles under his breath in thought for a moment. He stands two feet taller than you. You look around and take a good view of the area. Lano walks up to you. You watch him as he gets closer. You get a better look at this bird.

He suddenly goes down and comes back up with a rolling backpack. New backpack huh? You immediately realize how big the backpack is and what he might be thinking. Lano walks to you, bringing the backpack. He examines you and then his backpack.

"This could work. You can fit. Since this was the last day before our big break my backpack's pretty much empty." He offers with pride of his result. You think for a moment... this was weird but it could work...
111212222121.title: The next day...

choices: "What now."
Be silent for a moment.
1112122221211.content:
You’re silent for a moment. Your gaze switching between the green bird and his backpack. This is ridiculous, but it’s not like you have any better ideas. Honestly, this isn’t your only option, you could just say no and run around again, but why do that when the bird is offering to help you.

“Hehe… this is weird huh?” Lano pats the back of his head, “I agree.”


“O.k.” You reply. Lano opens the backpack using the zipper. You step forward, awkwardly. You’re going to get into a backpack… a rolling backpack… that a green, anthro bird owns.

“Uh… well I mean, do you want help?” Lano asks. You look up at the bird and nod. As he helps you in the backpack, you could swear you saw a blush on his face. The backpack starts to zip up, and before the zipper catches your hair you brush it away from the top of the backpack.

“O.k., now…” Lano says. A couple seconds go by, you hear nor feel the backpack or Lano move.

“Are we good?” You ask, slightly muffled.

“Sorry, but we gotta do this again.” Lano replies. You tilt your head at the statement as he unzips the backpack.

“Why?”

“We’re on the roof.”

------

You wait. You feel the constant roll of the backpack, and you’re leaning on some papers and one schoolbook. It’s a large, brand-new schoolbook, and it’s a math book, it seems. Hard to read when cramped in a dark backpack. You hear Lano’s footsteps; these are the same steps that made the scratching noise, so he was stalking you, eh?

The growing crowd of students seemed to disappear a bit. “I’ve got to grab my instrument.” Lano says, as if to himself. You don’t know if it was directed to you or not, but now you know. A minute or two later you hear the sound of opening cabinets and other students tuning their instruments. You know the sound of a tuned instrument since you’re sometimes entranced by the music made by anthros. Yeah, that’s some pretty good music. You think to yourself.

“Have a good break, teacher!” Lano calls, presumably to a teacher.

“You too, student!” The deep-voiced teacher replies, copying the student-teacher joke. You hear something smack. You wonder what it is until you hear Lano mumbling under his breath.

“Damn it- it’s Mr.Stan- not... “ Lano mumbles, then sighs. Turns out that Lano can curse. There is a large sound.

”Don’t forget, students must return their textbooks before they leave for break.” The announcement cuts off.

“Oh! Oh. Oh…” Lano states. You realize the book you’ve been laying on has to be returned. A bit of you feels untrustworthy to Lano still. “Don’t worry, I’ve got this.” He says. His voice was suddenly a lot louder and you jumped. (As much as you could inside a backpack). “Sorry!” Lano whispered clumsily. A minute or two later, Lano sets the backpack on its stands. You hear the backpack unzip and a green-feathered hand reaches down and slides a book from out of the backpack. You hope to god no one saw you..

There’s a bit more space, except for a few miscellaneous folders with different designs. The backpack is closed again.

------

You think Lano attached his instrument to the backpack, because every bump of the sidewalk that bounces, you feel a thump. It’s been a while, no more loud voices of young anthros, and no more ventilation whirring.

“O.k., Kiba, my house is close.” Lano whispers in the direction of his rolling bag. You don’t reply.

A couple moments later, you hear the twist of a doorknob. A healthy echo rings throughout a large space. An anthro house. You’re suddenly lifted off the ground with a grunt. The sudden feeling of being carried is weird. The next motion makes you feel as if you are going up a flight of stairs… which was true.

The steps stop and a door opens. You hear it close.. Lano sets the backpack on the floor. You breathe in.

“Alright, we’re here. My house.” Lano announces. “No one is here but us right now.” He says, trying to act nonchalant. You shuffle in position, as it is very cramped in a backpack. There is a zip and you look out of the backpack to see a room. The room is very large, because anthros are large, and it almost amazes you. His room is almost as tall as the school hallways. The walls are dark green, as is complementary to Lano’s color. Interesting that there would be a desk. Most children don’t have desks in their room, but more a dresser, or a t.v. on a shelf of sorts. There’s a bed with a logo, and it looks hastily made. The floor is carpet, you guess that’s because of the fact that Lano is a bird.

You stand up and step out of the backpack like a master contortionist performing for an audience. To be honest, you would’ve preferred to sit on the rough, hard concrete than a cramped, jumpy backpack, but no matter. You take another glance around the room, and see the door, which is white, and a closet. This, to Kiba, might have just been the most boring room to exist; Kiba would go crazy in such a boring room.

"No! Don't touch me!" You yell, you are not gonna let her do anything to you. Luna steps toward your direction. Deluma's tails are whipping behind her so fast you think she can cut something if she wanted to.

"Mayor Deluma!" Luna speaks up. Deluma looks back at Luna, expecting for her to say something.

"Well?" Deluma says, trying to calm her tone as she does not want to make a public scene.

"This is a police matter. We have to take her into custody." Luna starts. "We have a job to finish, Mayor."

"Not anymore. Humans are not anthros. Mythical, if you ask anyone. Humans should be put in labs and studied." Deluma commands.

commands her officers to arrest you.

You attempt to fix your hair, but you know your hands are cuffed, and now you have a ton of loose hairs messing with your eyelashes. At least Luna isn't so bad... in fact she was fascinated by you. Her huge paw covers your left shoulder, beckoning you to get into the back of the police van. You can tell she's uncomfortable as she constantly shifts around. Suddenly, you're pulled in front of her, and your mouth is covered by her right paw. You give a muffled scream, but you're forced to look up into the face of Luna, who is trying to shush you. Luna takes one more glance around, no one is looking, not even Deluma, who's distracted by two other officers who are bending to her needs. Luna looks down into your frightened eyes.

"Shh! Be quiet, ok? Listen closely if you want to get away..." Luna whispers, her wolf-like face bent over to tell you something. Now that you have a good look at her face, she actually looks cute, like a real wolf. Realizing she is not up to anything bad, you calm down. She takes her paw off of your mouth. "I can't tell you everything, but for now, I'm going to unlock your handcuffs, when I do, start running down that left alleyway. I'll fake a scene for you to get away." She finishes, while unlocking your cuffs. You nod, getting ready to run. Wait... The cuffs unlock. She pushes you away, almost tripping you with the sheer amount of anthro strength versus your own human body. You start running, quietly.

"Officers!" Luna shouts after about 5 seconds, giving you a head start. Deluma spins around, looking at Luna, then... to you. "The human i-"

"Get that human!!!" Deluma orders, pushing the four unaware officers with her tails towards you. They look around then look to you, realizing that you probably got away. 3 of them start running to grab you, Luna follows as well. Luna is attempting to keep up the act. She does a good job, as even Deluma is convinced. The last officer left is stunned, obviously he must be a new officer. The shark-like anthro shuffles at his belt as you're about to head down the left alleyway. You are very fast for a human, making do with the 5 - 6 seconds Luna generously gave you. Running by through the alleyways, you can't help but feel that even the trash cans are a bit overwhelming.

Deluma is furious, making fists with her hands and slamming the car door as she gets in. Deluma rolls down the window, and shouts to the last officer left. The shark-like anthro pulls out a pistol-looking thing out of his belt.

"Shoot it if you have to, but just get it into the lab!" She yells. The officer jumps at her tone, putting a hand against his heart like he just had a jump scare. He looks down at his pistol, he has an excellent grip on it.

"But ma'am, I- I don't want to hurt a creature so rare! I mean, do you even know what would hap--!"

"Your job is on the line, cadet, now get moving!!" She shouts, rolling the window up again. He opened his mouth to protest, but eventually he runs towards where he saw the others run. He stops for a second, considering his options.

"The human went down Zolpa street, target is continuing to climb the building at Zopla and Barko street." The radio on his vest says. He jumps again, but this time, into action.

-----------------------------------

Luckily, regardless of being in a completely different... universe, you know that the buildings around the area look very familiar. Looking down, the anthros are just under you. You won't be able to get to the top in time. So you look across the way. Another ladder, far. You keep looking down and across, debating on taking the jump. Luna sees what you're doing, and tries to tell you to stop, but you already took the jump. The other 3 officers look in awe as you jump across. Thanks to your amazing gymnast background, the jump was easy. You slam your feet onto the metal platform, taking a roll and slamming your back against the hardened metal poles. You get up, attempting to ignore the possible bruises you just received. The officers don't know what to do. You start to running down the ladder, as you are on the other side of a fence disconnecting the two ladder platforms.

You expect that those four officers are not the only part of this huge cities' police force. You run around the corner, and you look around. Luna got you to run, but what now? You start continue past the horrified, shocked, and even dumbfounded faces that stare at you. There are no officers in sight, but, a peculiar thing dawns you. Another human, just across the way. He looks to have glasses. You want to talk to him, but as he is on the opposite side of the street, you can't reach him. Both of you are causing quite a scene. But you notice something... he's grabbed, and pulled into the nearest alleyway. He doesn't make any sounds, but you don't know why. The sight of this very quick appearance stops you in your tracks. You must help whoever that was.

Looking both ways, you dash across the street. There seems to be nothing bad, focusing on the human with the glasses.

"Stop right there!" Yells a shaky voice. You freeze and look around, now you are open in the street. You catch sight of an officer, they seem to resemble what you think to be a shark. He has a gun! He now has your full attention, but you want to run and find out what happened to the human. "Get on the ground!" He obviously looks and sounds young... must be a cadet. Nevertheless, you don't want him to shoot you. Cars are now stopped, as this scene is about to unfold. The officer's walkie-talkie starts picking up feedback, he picks it up with one of his hands and tries to speak through it. You take this chance to decide what to do, as you have not gotten on the ground. Things just keep getting better and better... What do you do?

Run towards the other human's last location...
OR
Try to reason with this nervous cadet.

"Stop it! We're trying to help you!" The feminine voice whispers, right above your head. You slow your struggles. "You're safe, ok?"

"Yeah, don't worry, she's not gonna hurt us." Another voice adds. This voice was a man's voice. Us? You stop struggling. The grip loosens. You make this your chance and you force your way out of the grip. Spinning around, you can't see anyone. It's completely dark. You catch a reflection on something at your height level.

"Who are you?" You demand, yet in a quiet manner. Someone steps forward, into the light. A human, it's the one with the glasses!

"I'm Neil, Niel D'laundie. This is Agent Howlings." Niel states, gesturing towards the large anthro, who just steps forward and into the light. It was a husky-looking type anthro. She had blue eyes and dark hair.

"Natasha Howlings. That's my full name." She mentions. You sigh, and you take a breather, but it was hard to breath when your leg hurt like someone just put your leg on fire... in fact, it felt like it was being electrocuted, burned, frozen, and on top of that, slightly impaled.

"I'm-- Terra Westfield-" You manage to squeeze out, there is so much pain in your left thigh. "I s-saw you get-- augh!" You shudder. You pull up the left side of your gymnast shorts a bit, as you were in the acrobatics chamber when you were put here. There's a small amount of blood protruding from your thigh. You wince at it, as Niel gasps. You fall backwards a bit, finally hitting the floor. Niel rushes forward to help you. Natascha looks around in her -now more noticeable- vest. "I saw you g-et pulled out of th- the street," You inhale sharply. "So I tried t-- to find you-" You try to finish, but now you feel like you can't get anything more out than audible pain.

"What happened?" Niel asks with anxiousness. He tries to sit you up against a nearby wall. With him this close, you can see his face more clearly. He looks so- great, considering he is the first human you've seen within this whole disastrous situation. Obviously he does not know what to do. Natascha comes closer, kneeling down.

"I think she was shot. But I don't know what it is. Deluma keeps coming out with these new things almost every week... must have been something new." Natascha explains. She looks at you. "What happened?" She repeats Niel's question. She still looks to be at an astonishing height. Probably seven to nine feet tall?

"It looked l- like a taser--" You cry softly. You rub your eyes with your right hand, clenching your left hand in response. Natascha tilts her head like a confused puppy. Niel looks to Natasha as he is about to explain. For some reason, the pain is spreading into your left side, under your arm and around your hips. You can't move your left leg now. And the pain has stopped spreading. You're crying to much to hear what Niel is saying to Natascha. "It f-eels like I'm - burning, stunned-- I can't--" You start to explain, Niel and Natascha turn to look at you. You inhale sharply again. "I can't move my leg--!" You bawl.

"We've got to do someth-" Niel tries to say.

"I know! Just-- wait here with her. If what you said is true, Deluma may have made a twist on this 'taser'. We should not move her until we get a doctor to help. And luckily, our agency have a few people in their back pockets." Natascha cuts in. Niel listened. You feel tired, from both running and being shot. You start to close your eyes, but Niel shakes your shoulder.

"Don't go to sleep! We don't know what Deluma did." Niel starts.

"This place is safe, you stay here with Terra. Niel- I know you are very trustworthy, regardless of just meeting me. So, don't. Leave. This. Building. Got it?" Natascha says to Niel. She now regards that you are too distracted to consciously listen.

"How long are you going to be gone?"

"About a day, over there is some food and water. I hope our anatomies are close enough that it will do." Natascha says, pointing over to a small box in the corner. How'd that get there? She must know this place like the back of her hand.

"Ok. But what if someone tries to get in?" Niel responds.

"The door is locked."

"If they- do, get in though..."

"Here." Natascha finishes. She pulls out a baton looking thing. "This will electrocute anyone you hit, be careful." She hands it to Niel, and he practically uses all his might to hold it up. There is a switch on it, presumably to turn it on.

"I- I just-" Niel tries to say. Obviously he is just as confused and lost as you are in this world. "Thank you, for, well... just helping us."

"Don't worry, I'm here for that." She says in a kind, soft tone. She gets up, and heads to the same door you came in from. our eyes have adjusted to the light but are still fuzzy from your tears of pain. You are shuddering. Belting weakly as you keep trying to stay awake. The door makes a really light flash, and just as fast as it came, it left. The police were gone, so she was able to walk out perfectly. The door locks. Now, it's dark, with one small window too keep in light.

"Niel- please, don't leave me. I can't do anything by myself- I-I-" You ventilate. He looks to you in a sad, yet caring way. He shakes it off, and comforts you.

"Don't worry, what was your name?" Niel asks, obviously he wants to help.

"T- Terra." You get out. Niel sits down beside you.

"Don't worry, Terra. I won't leave you. But I need you to stay awake. Who knows what may happen if you fall asleep... how about this, tell me about yourself?" Niel says shyly. He noticed how tired you looked, and how red your face was from bawling. But now you're a bit calmer. You start to have a headache. You want to fall asleep so badly... but Niel is right. You don't know what would happen if you fell asleep.

"I- I used to be a gymnast." You start. Eventually you tell Niel all about your gymnastics career, and how you still look beautiful with all the hair products you use.

About an hour later, you and Niel have stopped talking. There's really nothing to do. Sitting for such a long time has gotten you very tired... this is your choice. You decide if you fall asleep. It is and will always be your choice to fall asleep or not. So... do you?

Stay awake, you are probably hungry or something.
OR
Try to sleep, Niel has a close eye on you, so you probably won't succeed.
111231.title: Help the human!

choices: The next day...
(Reader's Choice)
1112311.content:
You decide to stay awake...

Looking over at Niel, you realize how hungry you are. Not being able to move has its disadvantages. He is sitting on a crate about half his height.

"Niel?" You beckon. He snaps back into reality and looks at you.

"Yes, Terra?" He replies.

"Do you know if there's any edible food here?" You ask. You feel very tired, and hungry, and thirsty. That was just enough to keep you awake for the time being.

"Yes, right here." He says. Niel gets up and walks over to you with a box. It was a pretty big box. He opens it and reveals different kinds of packaged food. "I don't know if any of this is good for us... but if you're hungry she said this is what there was for the time being. Oh, and here." He hands you a water bottle, it was made of glass. Impressive.

"Thank you, Niel." You say. You hug him, and he is purely stunned. Probably doesn't get many girls. He eventually hugs back. After fixing his glasses, he walks back to his crate and sits down. You swear you saw a slight blush come from him as he pulled away. He's smiling. Afterwards, you dig into some of the miscellaneous foods. You leave him a big part of the box.

----------------------------

Later...

You feel so much better, thanks to staying awake. You couldn't see as it got dark, but Niel was vigilant; regardless of his personality. Looking up, you see that he dozed off in a funny position. He had his head drooping over the side of the massive crate. You start trying to get up now that he isn't telling you to sit down. You don't know what happened to your leg, but you can't move it. The pain subsided, but now you're very sore from staying awake on the cold, concrete floor. While moving, you notice that you had a blanket on your legs. Aww... thank you Niel! You pick the blanket up and move it to your right.

Time to move.

You put your arms out and stretch them, then suddenly you were preforming acrobatic stretching routines. You push against the ground and use your right leg to pick yourself up. Yep, your left leg can't move. You use the random shelves that were in place to support yourself over to Niel. His glasses fell on the floor, so you pick them up and put them next to him. You tap his shoulder and you shuffle his hair until he wakes up.

"Wha-- oh, hey Terra, I just had this scary dream..." Niel says drowsily. He squints at you and he says, "Wait, Terra? I don't know any Terras..." He looks around. "Oh, we're still here. Complete strangers in a strange world. How delightful..." He mumbles. You chuckle and find his hand. You give him his glasses after wiping them off with your shirt. "Wait-- how are you walking?!" He exclaims, you now have his full attention. He sits up and puts his glasses on, accidentally bumping himself in the head with the large baton-looking device. Looks as if he fell asleep with it in his hand.

"The pain is gone, so I decided to try and walk. It's morning." You say with glee. "Rise and shine, glasses!" You joke. He looks at his clothes and chuckles. You two talk for a bit. You end up convincing him to help you set traps. You constantly feel like you're being watched, and you felt that putting up traps around the door and the few scattered windows would make you feel comfortable. Niel helps make it your guy's turf. You sit back down in your spot after a good bit of moving.

"So. What now?" You ask Niel. He doesn't know what to say and shrugs.

"Meh, I really can't say. To be honest you made a good point, an anthro could sneak into this room at any mome-" He is cut off by a knock at the door.

"Hey, it's me." Says a familiar voice from the other side of the door. You hear the door unlock before you can react. Niel jumps up, with his baton in hand. The door swings open and you two are happy to see the familiar face of Natascha. There's another person with her, an otter-like anthro. The otter is about a foot smaller than Natascha.

"Thank god it's you, Natascha." Niel sighs. You look up to see them and smile.

"Hi!" You exclaim. You're very cheerful regardless of your situation. The otter rushes into the room and looks around. Niel jumps back and out of the way. The door shuts and Natascha turns on a light.

"Oh, that would've been nice to have." Niel mumbles sarcastically.

"Sorry, I forgot to tell you." She says.

"It's o.k.; it's actually good you didn't tell us. Think about it." Niel replies.

"Good point, Niel." She states. The otter anthro whipped out his bag, it had a medical cross on it.

"Don't mind him, he's very diligent, conscientious even." Natascha explains. The otter hurries over to you and kneels down. He's dressed in a white t-shirt and soft, dark blue pants while carrying a very discreet medical bag. Niel slowly heads over to observe the otter doctor. The otter doesn't speak, but he makes eye contact with you, then back to Natascha. "Oh, yes that's right." Niel looks to her. "He doesn't speak." Niel looks back at the otter, and the otter to you. You stay with a fixed vision onto the otter. "His name is Fallo."

He lifts up your left leg with his larger, fluffy paws. You look at him nervously. He looks up and slows down. He looks you into the eyes and you immediately think that he's very concerned. You nod and show him where you were bleeding. He opens his mouth then closes it. Then Fallo starts shuffling through his bag.

"Very interesting..." Niel says. Fallo pulls out a gauze and applies it to your leg.

"I can't move my left leg, it's as if it's paralyzed." You explain, Fallo looks up. "I don't feel anything there, or well, anywhere in my left leg." You finish. Fallo looks up to Natascha, who's now standing over and behind him. Niel is crouched along with you. Thinking about it, you forget that you feel captured. You wanted to be an acrobat to feel free when you move... and now your leg is stunned. Of course it isn't broken, it's straight, you just don't know what is wrong with it.

"What should we do, Fallo?" Natascha asks. She is equipped with the same vest as yesterday, but you notice that over it, she's wearing a different shirt, as if to blend in with people. Fallo stands up and pulls out a phone. You can't tell what he's doing as the two anthros are just so ridiculously tall to tell. Niel has been looking at you, gripping your hand. Now... you know his name and all, but he's still a stranger. He may feel differently about you, so you let him hold your hand. You look back up and see Natascha nodding.

"Terra, I'm smart, and I'd have to say this has stumped my knowledge of human anatomy. I don't know how your leg is stunned, but I will find some way to help." Niel assures. You look back down to the only human you've seen in one and a half days. You smile and hug him.

"Fallo, there's still one more human we know to be out there that we know of. What about that one?" Natascha asks. Fallo looks into her eyes with reassurance. He must be good with facial expressions, because whatever he just did, he convinced Natascha. You're sure of that, as Natascha walks out. She comes back in with two large coats. They were pretty bland coats, literally no color and both have hoods. Niel stands up.

"Hmm. I think we're supposed to wear those, huh?" Niel guesses. Fallo nods, he takes the coats and hands you both one. You put yours on with some effort, while Niel just puts it on in two seconds. Fallo kneels down next to you. He puts his paw on your left shoulder. You look into his eyes again. He starts to pick you up, putting his left arm around your legs, and his right around your torso. Niel looks at Natascha. "What now?"

"We're taking you to our facility. Terra needs to stay there while we figure out what happened. Niel, you will stay there too, Deluma wastes no time when she becomes ambitious. We cannot risk having you two here while there is still one more human out there." Natascha explains. Fallo holds you against his chest, carrying you. You feel a bit small in his arms. The four of you exit the building and get into a car.

----------------------

You are driven to the facility.

Eventually you are put in a room that resembles a hospital's room. Fallo stays with you while he figures out what is stunning your leg while Natascha and Niel meet with Natascha's boss.

Fallo is on a computer, there are multiple things skewed about this room you're in. Things such as: small glasses full of liquids, different kinds of medical supplies, and just pure clutter. Fallo is typing away at the computer he's on, he seems very focused... try to talk to him? I mean... he doesn't talk but surely there might be some way for him to tell you about where you are or why humans are considered mythical. You decide not to talk to him. But y'know... you must surely be able to go to sleep.

"Hey, Fallo." You say, trying to get his attention. He looks up as he straightens his back. "Can I sleep?" He looks from his computer to you then your leg, obviously thinking something. He nods. "Thank you." You say while smiling. He gets up and looks around the room for something. Fallo hands you a pillow, a rather generous offer. "Thank you again!" You repeat He smiles.

Soon, you doze off.
