You woke up gasping as if you'd woken up from a nightmare. "Where am I..." You groaned as you looked around and tried to remember what you last saw before your unscheduled nap.

         "Oh! You're awake!" Came a voice from the other side of the room. You looked over to find a woman in a white robe with matching white pants. What she wore was actually rather reminiscent of what karate students would wear during training. She was young, but older than you. You'd estimate late twenties if you had to guess. She had brunette hair and brown eyes. Given what she was wearing and her size, you assumed she was pretty athletic. Your mind didn't dwell on that as you were still preoccupied with how you'd arrived here and where exactly 'here' was. "You'll be happy to know that you didn't have any serious injuries," The woman continued.

         "Serious injuries?" You echoed as you looked down at your body. You suddenly became a little self conscious as for the first time since you'd awakened you found yourself in a robe similar to the one that the woman talking to you was wearing, the only difference being yours was navy blue as were your pants. You leapt to your feet and stare at yourself "What in the- Who took me out of my clothes!?" You demanded.

         "I did," The woman replied casually as she approached you to do... who knows what.

         "You what!?" You exclaimed backing away from her.

         "Oh calm down, I'm a doctor" The woman replied waving her hand in a dismissive way.

         "And what? I should just take your word for it?" You demanded incredulously.

         The woman smiled, "Now your getting it! Now hold still, time for your sedative."

         "You are not sedating me!" You growled. It was then that you realized you letting a little too much of your nature show.

         The woman's demeanor changed from carefree to surprised as she noticed your sudden change, "A fighter eh? Given this sudden change in attitude I don't suppose that you'll let me do this quietly."

         You'd always had a wild side, it got you into tons of trouble when you were younger and caused you a lot of loss when you were older. You tried to keep it covered up and concealed. You tried so hard to be the person you thought you should be, you tried to keep all of you're emotions in check all the time... but the truth was that it just wasn't who you were. You were one coin with two sides... maybe now it was time to show both sides instead of pretending to be a false coin. "No," You replied, "I'm afraid not." You're confidence in you're athletic abilities had shown clear as day in you're defiant smirk as you finished that sentence.

         "I can't say I'm disappointed," The woman replied, "I never see any action back here, safe and tucked away behind the walls of our hidden home where the other shinobi return to after their missions have been carried out."

         "And I've just been dying to know where here is," You commented. "I don't suppose you'd be willing to tell me?"

         The woman grinned and shook her head, "Afraid not, but I promise I'll be gentle with you." She then darted up to you with speed you wouldn't have believed her capable of. She was within arm's length of you when a syringe seemed to appear in her hand. You cringed as you saw it and grabbed her arm as she jabbed it at you before swinging her into the wall behind you while using the momentum to slingshot yourself a few feet away from her. She quickly shook off the impact and gave you a look that a teacher might give a student who'd solved an equation properly. "Not bad, you could use a little work but your reflexes are impressive considering you've had no formal training!" She growled as she launched herself at you.

Both in official sports"you thought as you remembered an instant where you dodged a tackle in a football game, "And unofficial," As those words hung in your mind an instance of you jumping from a building and onto a moving truck flashed through your mind. "And I can put it all to use here!" You thought as spun around to find your opponent bearing down on you. But more importantly, you noticed an open doorway behind her. You twisted yourself to the side to avoid the needle sending her arm shooting past you. She was quick to react however as she twirled the syringe in her fist and attempted to stab you with it. You noted the attack though and through instinct more than anything else, you were able to stop her arm before roughly shoving her in the back and sweeping your leg against one of her own. The maneuver left her face down on the ground. By the time she'd gotten up, she was just able to catch your left foot slipping through the doorway.

         "I'm sorry," The woman apologized to no one in particular, "I underestimated him and I'm out of practice. I will get Kalin and we'll secure him."

         "No wait," A deep but calm voice commanded, "Let the twins deal with him. I'd like to see how he responds to them."

         The woman nodded, "Okay then, I'll leave it to them." The woman rose up and left the room. But as she left, the form of a large anthro wolf remained behind in the center of the room. He sat cross legged in a black shinobi robe. His eyes were a piercing gold and his fur was a black as his shadow. He remained sitting quietly in the room awaiting the outcome of the current conflict, "I wonder if this human will be the one to turn the tides..."

Kiba dashed down the hallway of what looked like the interior of a large Japanese home. All of the hallways were lit by candles and torches along the walls. "This is nuts," Kiba muttered to himself as he tore across the hardwood floor. "I need to find a quiet place to rest and plot my next move..."

         Kiba glanced over his shoulder, checking for signs of pursuit but to his relief he found none. As he reached the end of the hallway he found a sliding door. With caution he opened the door before slipping through it and closing it without making a sound. Turning his attention to his surroundings, he found himself in a traditional Japanese garden. Cherry Blossom trees lined the inside of the courtyard while the center of the garden was taken up by a coy pond full of enormous and lazy fish who swam about as they bathed under the moonlight that lit the entire garden and courtyard, and in the center of the pond a large rock formation of some kind of black stone sat proudly above the water as if it were its own mountain surround by ocean. Deciding it was best to continue moving rather than to take too long absorbing the majestic sight, Kiba turned and began making his way along the inner wall of the courtyard that he'd entered through in hopes of finding an exit. The human didn't make it too far from his entry point as he felt an odd and subtle chill creeping down his spine. The kind of chill you get when you realize that your not alone when you thought you were.

         Trusting his instincts and the terrible feeling in his gut and heart, Kiba slowed his pace before turning to face the courtyard once more. Much to his displeasure and growing dread, he found a pair of twin shinobi standing atop of the stone formation that peaked out from the center of the coy pond. Both shinobi silently leapt from their perch and landed within an arms length of Kiba. Each stood patiently and quietly as they sized up the young man who had been clearly marked as the target of the shadow warriors. Kiba, fully aware that these were probably sent to capture him in response to his escape prepared himself for the inevitable fight that he would have to win for his freedom. A key feature that he noted of the two ninjas before him was that they were both anthro foxes. Neither wore shoes, opting to expose their paws rather than cover them with any type of protective covering. While they wore masks they only were partial masks, covering nothing more than each fox's muzzle leaving they're face from the muzzle up clearly exposed. One more thing Kiba noticed, was that these two anthros stood eye to eye with him in height....

1221112121111112.content:
Unable to avoid the coming attack Kiba turned his head to minimize the damage. The fist connected with his face, his eyes widened from the shock of the impact. "I didn't think anyone that size could hit like that!" Kiba thought as he stumbled to the ground. After crashing on the ground Kiba struggled to stay conscience. "One punch huh? That's all it took?" A voice in the back of his head asked. It sounded like that of a young woman, however there was a very familiar feel to it. "How can I fight an anthro? Let alone two? If they want me, I can't do anything to stop them." Kiba felt his body being lifted by the two shinobi. One grabbed his right shoulder and the other grabbed his left before dragging him down into the building once more. "You were the most stubborn and determined kid I ever had to deal with," Kiba's eyes opened a little at the words he heard as he realized who's voice he was hearing. "Sis?" Kiba muttered, looking around as if to find the source of the voice. He found no one other than the shinobi who now eyed him suspiciously. Kiba sighed and hung his head, allowing his eyes to droop closed.

         Surrounded in darkness, he waited for his fate. After a few moments he found himself sitting in a field of darkness with no light in sight. "Seriously? So this is it? You're going to sit here and give up because somebody punched you in the face?" Kiba looked into the dark looking around to find a young woman with long and curly black hair, green eyes and tan skin looking down at him with a disapproving smirk. She was dressed in sweat pants and a baggy black t shirt. "Sis?" Kiba questioned, "Where are we?"

         "Where do you think we are?" She demanded. She placed her hands on her hips before bending over and taking her right index finger and tapping Kiba's forehead with it. "We're in you're head." She stood up and looked down at him before smirking again, although this time it was in a friendly matter.

         "So what I'm getting out of this is that you're not real and I've gone crazy," Kiba muttered sarcastically before crossing his arms and looking away from his sister.

         "I'm as real as you want me to be kiddo," His sister countered, "And you're not crazy, you just need a little help."

         "Of the mental kind no doubt," Kiba scoffed.

         "Okay, enough of the pessimism. It's really starting to grind on my nerves," His sister warned.

         Kiba sighed, "Ok, 'Kayla'. Let's recount what's happened so far. I've been sent to some strange parallel world where the majority of animals have been turned in to anthropomorphic creatures who have the ability to learn and adapt like humans do. In addition to that the humans here are dominated by the anthros who hate them and both species are on the brink of going to war with one another. To make matters worse, I've been kidnapped by shinobi who are intent on keeping me here for god knows what and now I'm talking to a mental construct of my older sister in my own head!"

         Kayla nodded, "Must be one of the days," She shrugged.

         "Get real!" Kiba shouted.

         Kayla sighed, "Why are you giving up and letting them take you?"

         "Because I can't win. There's two of them and they've got training that I don't. And on the off chance that I could beat them both. I'd still have an entire compound of who knows how many ninja standing in my way. This is the very definition of a no win scenario."

         Kayla laughed, "And you are the very personification of will, Kiba. When things are at their worst like this is when you are at you're best. You never give up, and even if you have no formal training (which isn't entirely true...) you have experience, and your natural ability compliments your style."

         Kiba stared at Kayla in confusion, "My style?" he asked.

         Kayla gave a tired smile and sighed, "Honestly you can be so clueless sometimes. Think back to every fight you had with me that you thought you were going to lose... No... think back to every fight you ever had that you thought you were going to lose. Whether wrestling with me or fighting a bully at school. You never won every fight you got into."

         "No..." Kiba admitted quietly.

         "But I don't remember you ever losing or giving up a fight either," Kayla added. Kiba's eyes widened in realization. "You either won, tied or the fight was ended before a clear winner was decided. Do you remember why? It's because you never gave up, that's part of who you are. Your strength isn't in you strategic thinking, your speed or your physical strength..." Kayla then knelt down and placed a hand on Kiba's chest, "It's in your heart, there's a fire in here that refuses to go out no matter how badly the storm around it rages on it refuses to give in. I remember that time you had that accident in that mountain bike race, you were beaten and bloody, barely able to stand but you still pressed on... this is no different. If you're going to survive in this world you have to be strong enough to keeping moving forward or else you won't survive."

         Kiba nodded in understanding, "You're right."

         Kayla scoffed at her younger brother's words, "I'm always right. Now get up... GET UP!"

         Kiba's eyes snapped open as he left the realm of his subconscious and reentered the real world. Both shinobi jumped slightly at the sudden change in their prisoner's condition. Before either one of them could react, Kiba snatched his arms away from his captors and planted himself. Both foxes stumbled forward before regaining their footing. Taking advantage of their recovery time Kiba opted to attack the fox on his left. He rushed forward before throwing his shoulder into the ninja's back causing it to stagger forward uncontrollably and slam into a wall. He then turned to deal a blow to the second fox who had already moved to attack him. With a drawn dagger, the fox swiped at his chest and shoulder. Barely able to stumble away from the blade's edge, Kiba managed to avoid the initial strikes. "I'll never get out of this if I don't do something about that knife," Kiba muttered to himself.

         "Settle down and focus kid," Kayla's voice called to him, "Do what you do best, tire it out and take any openings you can get." Kiba smiled and rushed forward, a move that surprised his attacker. Kiba was able to throw a quick punch catching the side of the foxes muzzle. Annoyed with the sudden burst of energy it's prey had found, the ninja dashed forward, attacking with a flurry of stabs. Kiba was able to keep ahead of them, jumping backwards and twisting his body to avoid the dagger's point until he felt his back bump into something soft. He felt a set of arms shoot up and under his armpits followed by a pressure on his mid back effectively pining him to the body of his newfound captor. The fox he'd been fighting now approached with the knife in hand, if he weren't wearing a mask, Kiba would've assumed that he was smirking.

         "Sorry, I'm not ready to quit yet," Kiba muttered before slamming the back of his head into the front of his captor's muzzle. The impact stung him, but it had done far worse to the ninja that had been holding him. A sharp and distinctly canine whimper could be heard followed by what sounded like a young woman groaning. As much as Kiba wanted to look, he dared not take his eyes off of his opponent.
1221112121111112.title: The start of a new beginning

choices: Kiba want's answers now and refuses to go with Savannah and Seth
Kiba submits, if only to regroup and recover
12211121211111122.content:
The ninja that had been attacking with the dagger darted up to Kiba faster than he'd anticipated before backhanding him across his face. Kiba staggered backwards before he felt a sharp pain in his back. He fell on to his stomach before glancing back to find that the fox he'd knocked down a few moments earlier had recovered and shed her mask. With hazel eyes and short brunette hair. She gazed at Kiba, her face devoid of any emotion save for the faintest hint of a frown on her muzzle. Kiba got to his feet, a dumfounded expression written across his face before he realized that he was under attack from two opponents. Spinning around in time to find a black gloved fist driving itself into his stomach. Kiba doubled over and gasped for air before his attackers knee came up and connected with his face. A coppery taste filled Kiba's mouth, he didn't need to touch his lip to know that it was bleeding. The female fox crashed into Kiba's back before grabbing both of his wrists and forcing them behind his back in a similar way that a police officer might. She then kicked the human's legs out from under him while pushing him forward. This resulted in the fox kneeling on the injured human's back with both of his arms subdued. Kiba writhed and squirmed beneath her, but despite his efforts he couldn't break free. The fact was that she had the dominant position and there was nothing he could do about it.

         The second ninja; whos gender remained a mystery, cautiously approached Kiba's leg's to bind them. However, while the human may have been unable to stand or get free, he was still keenly aware that his legs were still capable of nearly a full range of movement. As the ninja knelt down to subdue the afore mentioned limbs Kiba swung both of his feet up so that the soles of his feet faced the ceiling. The result was a powerful kick to the face that neither of the foxes had expected. The fox on Kiba's back twisted her body to see what had happened, doing so meant shifting her weight which gave Kiba an opening. Kiba rolled the fox off of his body and got to his feet. THe other two foxes got to there feet as well, ready for the third round. However, before the fighting could begin... again... a gust of cool air swept through the room as one of the other doors opened.

         "Enough!" Came a powerful and deep voice. All three combatants looked n the doorway to find a large black wolf taking up most of the frame. He had luminescent gold eyes and pitch black fur. He was clothed in a white robe not unlike what most karate students wore where you came from.

         "But master!" The female fox exclaimed, "You told us that we were to bring the human before you as a test."

         "Yes Kara, I did say that," The wolf admitted, "Unfortunately you failed that test. There is much that you have to learn before becoming a full fledged shinobi. You and your brother should go think about your fight with this human. When you realize how he defeated you and what you did wrong then you may come and see me." Both foxes nodded and bowed before going away, presumably to their rooms, leaving Kiba alone with the large wolf.

         "So?" Another voice broke in, "This is the human?" An anthro tiger paced around Kiba who at this point nearly jumped out of his skin. She was large, that much was certain. She rivaled the wolf back in the police station for height. But she was much more powerful. Her orange eyes seemed to burn with an intense heat. She wore black robes almost identical to the wolf's, only her paws were wrapped in tape. Her hair was jet black and fell down to her shoulders, and her fur was the typical orange and black tiger striped pattern. The fur under her chin and down the front of her neck was white as were the insides of her paws. While her hand/paws were taped she wore nothing on her feet. Her feet remained exposed to show their carefully cared for and deadly claws.

         "How the heck did she get within an arms length of me without me noticing? She's huge! Nothing that big can move that quietly!" Kiba reasoned as he watched the tiger's movements, observing her as she observed him. She then paused in front of him before bending down to his level and moving so that her knows was inches away from his.

         "Stop it Samantha, you're scaring him," Another feminine voice called into the room.

         The tiger named 'Samantha' rolled her eyes and stood up, "He's fine, I just wanted a better look at him."

         "He's a human, not a goldfish," The voice chided. Just then, an anthro lioness walked in. She had hazel eyes and golden fur. her hair as similar in style to the tiger, but different in color as it was brown. Her body wasn't as well defined as the previous cat but she was no field mouse to be sure. She stood a few inches shorter than her feline friend, and seemed to be a bit more reserved. Kiba also noted that she was dressed in much more... normal clothes than the other two anthros. Wearing baggy denim jeans and a loose blue t shirt she stared disapprovingly at the tiger who now moved away from the comparatively small human.

         "Relax Savannah," The tiger then paused before glancing over at Kiba, "After all, if we're going to get along we need to be acquainted right?"

         The lioness cast her gaze over to the wolf who stood just ahead of her as if wanting him to reprove the tiger. The wolf, seeming to sense what was on her mind gave her a small smile. "It's fine Savannah, its natural to be curious about something or someone new."

         "Be that as it may," A deep but quiet voice interjected followed by the entry of yet a third anthro. This one was a raccoon, his classic gray and black fur pattern giving his typing away. He was clothed in a mesh exercise shirt while he wore baggy black sweat pants on his lower half. His foot paws were exposed, and sporting a set of claws that rivaled those of the tiger. His thick bushy tail swayed calmly from side to side giving Kiba plenty of time to confirm he was a raccoon once more by the black rings around his tail. If that wasn't a dead giveaway the 'mask' like patch of fur around his ice blue eyes definitely was. His stature was definitely smaller than the other three anthros in the room. Though he was obviously not the strongest, Kiba had a hard time doubting that he was certainly the quickest and most likely the most agile of the group. Muscles could be seen beneath his gray fur, and while not the biggest the human had ever seen, they were certainly toned and well maintained. A silent testament to their owner's training no doubt. "He is still a human being, he deserves to be treated like one instead of like a piece of art."

         "Alright already, I won't stare so much anymore," The tiger huffed as she rolled her eyes.

         The raccoon then moved to the center of the room where Kiba stood. He was but a head taller than Kiba, something that the human had found to be a rarity in this world, "I watched your fight a few moments ago and I must say.... well done. Though they are not full fledged ninja, Leo's nephew and niece are not to be taken lightly as they are very formidable with their tag team tactic as you've experienced. I didn't expect you to be conscious at the end of it, let alone resist them... I'm truly impressed."

         Kiba raised an eyebrow at the raccoon unsure of how to respond to his summation, "Thanks?"

         The lioness chuckled, "Don't take that lightly, Seth hardly gives compliments to anyone. In fact, from what we've seen he just tolerates most of us... so the fact that he's smiling at you and giving you praise is a rare sight for sure."

         Kiba gave a small and tired smile but remained tense, unsure of what to expect. After all, the battle weary human had been kidnapped, attacked and now he was being observed. "I don't mean to be rude or sound blunt. But what is it that you want from me? Why did you bring me here? And why did you have the two foxes attack me?" Kiba demanded, his voice raising a little more than he realized with his final question.

         The wolf nodded, "All very good questions that you deserve to have the answers to. And we will answer those questions soon enough. But at the moment, all you need to know is that we will not harm you and you must remain here for the time being. Savannah and Seth will escort you to your room, you can rest there, from what I've been told and as far as I can see you've had a busy night and some rest will do you good."

         Kiba scowled, "An escort? To show me where to go or to keep me from running away?"

         The wolf gave another gentle smile, "Both."

         Samatha grinned displaying a full set of razor sharp fangs to the human, "You just tried to run away on us once. Why would we risk you doing it again?"

Seth moved to Kiba's side while the Lioness moved to the door. The raccoon placed his palm on Kiba's shoulder, gently guiding him towards the door Savannah was walking through. The lioness paused as she waited for her comrade and the human they were to escort.
12211121211111122.title: Someone intervenes

choices: Follow Kiba as he plays Sam's game
Skip to the end of the game
122111212111111222.content:
Kiba narrowed his eyes and glanced around the room as he was guided through the door. At length he decided do as he was told for the time being. After he'd left the wolf then turned to the tiger, "Sam, I'd hate to impose but could you..."

         The tiger nodded, "Say no more, I'll handle it."

         Leo looked at her dubiously, "Be gentle Sam, he's still adjusting."

         The tiger shrugged as she walked out of the room, "Whether I'm gentle or not is entirely up to him."

         Kiba found himself standing in a Chinese style room. It was very basic with only a bedroll, seat pad and candle. However, what it lacked in luxury it made up for with space. There was enough room to put three king sized beds and a desk.

         "We'll be right outside if you need anything," Savannah said as she smiled warmly at the human.

         Kiba frowned as he spun around to face his escort, "Wait, you mean your going to stand outside the door to guard me?"

         "Naturally," Seth replied, "It's a known fact that you are... uncomfortable and unsatisfied with the information you've received about our abducting you and you are no doubt curious and anxious. I wouldn't put it past you to attempt an escape while we're asleep or begin an investigation and find yourself in an undesirable situation with one of the shinobi residing here that may mistake you for an intruder. That being said we well remain here through the night to ensure you're safety."

         A deadpan expression crossed Kiba's face as he stared blankly back at the raccoon, "Gee thanks."

         Savannah smiled sympathetically towards her 'captive', "Don't think of us as prison guards, think of us like body guards."

         "Uh-huh, right..." Kiba muttered as he went into the room and slid the bamboo framed door shut behind him. The shadow's of his 'guardians' shown on the paper-like material that made up the door's center. Kiba flopped down on the bedroll, recounting everything that had happened throughout the day. His expression softened from irate to on of sorrow, "I wonder... If I'll ever go home again..." With that final thought echoing through his mind, the tired human rolled onto his side before drifting to sleep. The candle in the room burned out shortly after, leaving Kiba in darkness with the exception of light that streamed in through the door panel. As the tired human dozed, time rolled on until for no reason in particular he stretched and sat up on the bedroll wondering what time it was. He then shifted his gaze to his bedroom door to find that the lights in the hallway were no longer on. "Did they finally leave?" Kiba wondered as he cautiously approached the door. placing his hands on the wooden frame softly, he gently slid the door a third of the way open, the hallway was empty. No sign of guards or shinobi. Deciding that he wouldn't catch a better break than this, Kiba slipped out of his room and closed his door before tip toeing down the hallway.

         He came to the end of the hall which turned into a ninety degree corner. Peeking around the corner he found what he'd been looking for, the final door at the end of the hallway that stood between him and the outside of the compound. He glanced over his shoulder before proceeding around the corner and bumping into something large and relatively soft. The human cursed himself under his breath before tilting his head skyward to find `a pair of glowing orange eyes with slitted pupils, somewhere below them a faint outline of grinning fangs could be made out. Kiba's stomach dropped as he realized who he'd ran into.

         "Well, well, What do we have here? An unscheduled tour after hours?" Sam asked with a hint of mirth in her voice. Kiba didn't respond, still frozen against Sam's furry stomach where he'd first ran into her. "I'm afraid I'm going to have to escort you back to your room," The cat continued, prompting the human to take two steps back from her. The tiger then rolled her eyes before drawing in a dramatic breath, "This is the part where I say 'it's in your best interest not to resist me' and that 'this is for your own good' and 'It'd be easier on both of us if you'd just come quietly' and blah blah blah..."

         "Doesn't sound like that's what you really want me to do..." Kiba observed.

         Sam grinned again, "My, what a perceptive little human you are!" a muffled clap followed her gleeful outburst indicating that she'd clasped her hands together.

         Kiba's eyes had finally adjusted to the dark, and he could now see the anthro in her entirety, "So what is it that you want me to do?" Kiba inquired, his voice laced with skepticism.

         The tiger crossed her arms, "Well we both know you want to escape and that it's my job to prevent that. And while I certainly don't want you to slip away I definitely don't want the boring alternative either. Sooooo, I propose we play a game.

         The human's faced changed from skeptical to blank, "A... game?"

         "Yeees~" Sam replied with even more excitement in her voice, "If I win, I'll return you to your room... conscious or incapacitated."

         Kiba raised an eyebrow, "And if I win?"

         Sam frowned and peered up at the ceiling while humming in thought, "I'll show you around the compound and give you a brief history lesson on what's happened with the humans and anthros here... and then I'll return you to you're room."

         Kiba crossed his arms, "That sounds like a cheap cop-out of a prize," The human argued.

         Sam gave Kiba a toothless smile, "Hmmhmm, well if you feel that way, I could always stuff you in a sack and hang you on the wall til' morning," She offered.

         Kiba sighed and shook his head, "There's no version of this where I get what I want is there?"

         "None whatsoever," Sam chirped as she continued to smile down on Kiba.

         "Fine," Kiba muttered, "I'll play your game."

         "Excellent!" The cat exclaimed, "The game we'll be playing is cat and mouse!"

         "Of course it is...." Kiba muttered as he rolled his eyes and threw a hand up into the air before allowing it to fall lazily at his side.

         "Oh cheer up already, I could have picked something like arm wrestling..." The tiger warned as she held up her paw for emphasis, which was more than twice the size of Kiba's hand. "In fact... I still can if you'd prefer it?" Sam offered as she held out her paw in an inviting gesture.

         Kiba protectively grasped his right arm with his left hand before turning the threatened appendage away from the anthro, "No, cat and mouse is fine..."

         "Smart kid..." The tiger chuckled. A surge of frustration welled up in the human's chest, but he let it go knowing full well that it'd be pointless to get into another argument with her at this point. "I'm going to count to fifty. After that I'll come in find you, if I can catch you before the sun comes up, I win. If the sun rises before I get you, you win. Any questions?"

         "Just one, how long until sunrise?" Kiba questioned.

         "About an hour and a half," Sam replied. "Oh, and before I forget. If you try to leave the compound, I'll know and I will come for you and when I catch you... well... use your imagination."

         "Message received..." Kiba muttered, "So when do we start?"

         Sam smirked at the human, "We already did.... I told you I'd count to fifty, now I'm on twenty." At hearing that, the human scrambled back up the hall he came down.

1221112121111112221.content:
Kiba ran down the hallway, making tons of noise. The human whips around corners and hallways. Sam mentioned 'I'll carry you back, conscious or incapacitated. this gets Kiba to run like crazy. He slides a door open, gets in, and closes it. It looks like any other room that was in this place. Kiba hides behind the door, if Sam came in, he'd make a mad dash past her. Let's hope that she doesn't expect it... she probably thinks I will fight her... Kiba thinks.

"Ok, Kiba. I'm at fifty!" Sam yells. There was an almost charming giddiness in her voice. Almost no sound comes from this Tiger anthro. Her paws probably pad the ground, essentially dampening her footsteps. Minutes go by, and it feels like hours. Eventually... it became an hour. Kiba is extremely tired, and has pretty much gone into his own world. Asking questions like: What am I doing here? Why can't I leave? Then eventually coming up with his own answers, like 'maybe they want to help me', or 'maybe they want to keep me, as I'm so different'. He hated thinking if he was just going to stay there forever.

Suddenly, the door opens. Sam walks in, looking around. Kiba immediately dashes behind her, and runs again. Sam turns around, smiling.

"There you are!" She meows. She starts chasing Kiba, and is as silent as ever. Kiba runs around many corners, and so does Sam.

"What if I..." Kiba thinks aloud, under his breath. He darts around another corner, out of Sam's sight. She attempts to run around to Kiba, but he suddenly switches direction. Sam is caught off guard for a moment, but she immediately fixes this. Kiba now has some more time. Running by a small desk in a hall, he grabs what looks to be a small, padded training stick and throws it back at Sam. She catches it, with a -thwap-. Kiba looks back and isn't really surprised. He keeps running.

"Good try! Ha! Now you gave me something to throw! On top of that, you're not that fast!" She says, she was really close. Kiba honestly felt like he was a mouse. Turning a corner, he tries to catch his breath. He knows he'll be caught. I'm too tired to run... even though I lose, I mean, what even would she do?
It's just a game, not like she'll hurt me or anything. With that in his head, he awaits for her to turn the corner. But she doesn't. Kiba looks left and right as he leans against the wall. He realizes he ran down a dead end. "You're trapped, mouse." Sam says while around the corner.

"Y'know, I am not a mouse." Kiba responds. He can hear Sam, she is out of breath.

"Y'know, you run really fast." Sam replies sarcastically. "I win."

"Oh really?" Kiba responds, he starts to get ready to run, he may be on one side of the hallway, but there's always another way. The opposite side of the hallway. "No you haven't."

"Yes I have. You're cornered." Sam says triumphantly. She is clearly impressed with herself and you.

"Never put a mouse in a corner." Kiba responds. He darts around the corner and whips past Sam, who glances between the alleyway and Kiba, hair whipping around.

"Hey!" Sam protests. She starts dashing towards the human. Kiba laughs, he's actually having a bit of fun. "That's not fair!" Sam whines.

Kiba loses Sam, but he is not convinced he lost her. On the other hand, Sam has no idea where Kiba is. Sam continues running, looking around walls and trying to listen to his footsteps. She hears him, and tries to run in his direction. Kiba looks towards an exit, he has a perfect view of the horizon, the game is almost over. He sighs with relief, and starts to find a place to hide for the rest of the time. Maybe the same place he hid the first time? He runs around a corner, but he looks back to see is Sam is chasing him. But little did he know, that at the opposite end of the hall, was Sam. She still had the stick in her hand. She runs at Kiba, throwing the stick. Kiba, who was obliviously running in Sam's direction, stumbles as the stick lands perfectly under his foot. He tries to catch himself. Sam takes this opportunity to try to catch him. She forgets that in that specific hallway, that there was a desk. She accidentally bumps the desk with all the training sticks, and slips on one too.

"Crap!" Sam exclaims. Kiba looks up, for sure he has stopped himself, but he's crouched. He tries to stand up, but Sam falls on him. He puts his hands out to stop her from falling, but his hands accidentally cram down her throat. The last thing Kiba sees is Sam's giant mouth engulf his head. Sam's eyes open wide, in surprise.

Kiba yells, but his voice is muffled. Sam is choking on human, the last thing she expected while in this 'cat and mouse' game. Sam puts her hands out, and gets up. She puts her hands on Kiba's hips as fast as she can. He kicks his legs to try to get out, but he's pulled out of her mouth, and dropped on the floor. He sits there in disgust, surprise, and fear. Sam gasps for breath, she looks just as surprised as Kiba. They make eye contact. Kiba starts crawling backwards, trying to get some space between the two.

"Kiba..." Sam says slowly, putting her paws out in a caring gesture. "I don't-- I don't know how that happened... but-"

"What the hell was that?!" Kiba responds, "You just-- you almost ate m-"

"I tripped!" Sam cuts in. "I'm sorry!" She's obviously shaken as well. Kiba looks up at Sam, and he picks himself off the ground. Now he's standing.

"What- what did you trip on?" Kiba questions. He tries to wipe off the saliva that covers him.

"A-a... training stick." She responds shyly. She messed up. "The same thing you tripped on..."

"Y-you, well, what would the others think?" Kiba starts to say. Sam looks to Kiba quickly, now she's listening. "You practically almost ate me... what do you think Leo would say... Savannah?" Sam's facial expression and body positioning is now completely different than it was before. It used to be tall and confident, but now she is a little nervous, like a little kid who just did something bad. Her ears flatten against her head.

"Uh- how about we just don't talk about this." Sam says after a bit. "Please don't tell them my mistake... or the game."

"What makes you say that I won't?" Kiba pushes on. He sees that he may just get some information because of her almost eating him. "You swallowed me down to my hips. I feel- violated." He puts up an act and looks away slowly.

"I'm -- sorry. Hey, hey!" She says desperately, Kiba looks back at her. "I can, tell you. I'll tell you why you're here... and where we are. And what we know but just- don't. Say. Anything!" She emphasizes 'anything'. Kiba smiles in his head. He's got her in the palm of his hand.

"Deal." Kiba says, putting down his act. She immediately frowns and realizes that he just played her. "Now, can you tell be where I can get this-" Kiba looks at Sam. "saliva-- off?"

"Sure." She uses her paw to wipe off her mouth. "This way..." She grits through her teeth. Kiba follows Sam as he looks outside, the sun is up. He grins, now ignoring that he was pretty much eaten.

122111212112.content:
Startled you wake up to the sounds of birds chirping and sunlight streaming in through wooden blinds. You find yourself wearing the same clothes you had on the night before. You also find yourself with a killer headache. You groan and collapse back on the bed.

         "I'm not a morning person myself, but even I don't think waking up in the morning is that bad," A deep voice chuckled.

         "Your eyes shot open as you scrambled into a upright position to see who it was that had spoken to you. Your vision was still clearing up, but you could make out a man in a green t-shirt and baggy black pants.

         "Who are you and where am I?" You demanded.

         "Quite the little ingrate, aren't ya?" The man asked.

         "I don't have time to play games..." You growled as you climbed out of the bed, "Now tell me whaaaaooow- Augh... You put a hand to your head as you slowly fell to the floor in a sitting position.

         "Might wanna slow down there Magellan, you got a double dose of equi-flashers last night. Those'll wreak havoc on a human's equilibrium for days, slightly less true for an anthro but still not a pleasant experience I assume..."

         "You were in the process of struggling to stand, but paused as what the man said sunk into your mind, "The events of the previous twenty four hours replayed themselves from your memory. You then realized that it hadn't been a dream and you were in a very unique and dangerous predicament. It also begged the question, 'what do these people want from you?'

         "I'm sure you have a million questions for me..." The man mused, "Buuut, I'm much to busy right now to answer them he said with a casual wave. So I'll take my leave now and I guess I'll see you around?"

         As the man got up to leave you snapped out of you're stupor, "Hey wait! Where are you going?"

         "I got stuff to do... I can't spend all day watching you try to relearn how to walk," He then turned towards the door but kept his head turned toward you, "They asked me to stay in here with you until you woke up and now you have and since you don't see to be dehydrated, hyperventilating or dying... I'd say that's job done for me." At that he turned and opened the wooden door that sealed the room off from the rest of... wherever the heck you are and walked out without even bothering to close the door.

         Well, you're alone and the door's open, any ideas?

And if they catch me while I'm putting it on? (Yousa point is well seen)
1221112121121.content:
"Like I'm gonna wait around for the next nutcase... headache or not, I gotta get out of here..." You pull yourself over to a wall before pushing yourself into a sitting position so that your back was braced against the wall. "Ok..." You muttered, "One... two..." pushing with all your strength, you were able to get on your feet. But you definitely noticed that there was a price to pay for it as the inside of your skull threatened to explode. "Augh! Man that thing really screwed my head up!" You tried to push the mind crushing pain aside as you walked out of the door. You found yourself in a small hallway. There was a door to your left, a door to your right and a door at the end of another hallway in front of you. "Talk about being at a crossroad..." You thought to yourself as you walked straight, figuring that direction was as good as any at this point. Using your hand to keep yourself steady you walked to the door at the end of the hallway. You're head was screaming for you to stop, but you wouldn't stop until you found a safe, calm and above all, isolated place to collapse. Eventually, many agony filled steps later, you reached the door. You paused to collect yourself and found that your headache was significantly weaker from the time you left the room. You'd also found that your balance had returned for the most part. You opened the door and proceeded through it before closing it behind you.

         You found yourself in a studio, almost like a home gym. It was a long rectangular room with four large square windows on either side lengthwise. Neon lights buzzed faintly overhead and a sea of wood covered the floor. There were floor mats and punching bags laying in organized piles at one end of the room, while the other had kendo sticks, an array of blades and chains as well as armor. Some of the armor was indistinguishable from what you saw the ninja from last night wearing. You walked over to the side of the room that had the armor before taking some of it into your hands. "I wonder if I could use this as a disguise to get out of here?" You glanced back at the door, "This might be the best way for me to get out unnoticed and it might come in handy if I'm attacked, it is armor after all. And beyond the walls of whatever this place is there's bound to be plenty of anthros with claws, teeth and guns trying to strangle, capture or eviscerate me..."

         So what'll it be? Put the armor on and become a shadow of a shinobe? Or ditch the armor and make your escape by any means necessary?

12211121211211.content:
"I'd rather get caught and try to explain this than get caught without it by someone in a bad mood with sharp blades/claws..." You mutter to yourself as you put the upper chest garment on. You the bent over to swap your jeans out for leggings. It was a bit of a challenge given you headache and slight lack of balance, but with perseverance you managed to get it done. All that was left now was the actual armor that went over the 'body sock' for lack of better word. You put the armor on section by section, limb by limb until all that was left was the mask. Just as you put the mask on you heard the door burst open.

         In walked a girl with black hair tied into a ponytail. She was wearing black sweatpants and a white tank top. She seemed to be American given that she had no foreign facial features and fair skin. She cast a glance in your direction and did a double take upon seeing you. Her eyes lit up as she rushed over to you. "You must ve zah new trainee! Velcome!" She exclaimed as she shook you're hand.

         "She's German..." You noted as you tried you're best to keep her from yanking your arm off.

          At length the woman released your arm and took a small step back, her blue eyes seemed to flash a look of sympathy towards you,"I'm very sorry about zee entrance interrogation. Vut vee can never be too careful. You never know ven vee might come under attack vrom a shpy." She explained, "Vee try to vee unnoticeable and stay out of zee vway... vut it does not alvays work. And ov course, not everyone likes us. Vee can't really blame them though, Vee steal their food some days ven vee have no food. Vut ve do aim to do vut is right in larger vay, ya?"

         You weren't quite sure how to respond, so you gave a single distinctive nod.

         "Oh, vhat do vee have here? Zee strong and shilent type eh?" She asked with a smirk, "Vell, to quote zee old cliche', vee have vays ov making you talk!"

         "I already hate where this is going," You thought to yourself as she took a few steps back and assumed a fighting stance that you'd never seen before.

         "Let's begin your training, Ve'll start vith hand to hand combat. Show me vhy our shcouts shelected you!"

         "I gotta fight her? Aw you've gotta be kidding me! You screamed within the confines of your mind.

         Becoming impatient you trainer decided that action was required on her part. "Very vell, you leave me no choice, I vill make zee virst move." With that she charged at you with the speed of a track star.

         You let out a sigh as you get into a boxer's stance, "This won't end well..." As she reels her fist back for a punch you duck your head low to avoid the blow, but to your surprise you feel a jolt in you stomach. You look down to find her fist digging into your abdomen. "She faked a punch so she could counter my reaction?!" You let yourself drop to the ground but only to rebound up, throwing yourself into her.

         Caught by surprise, she staggers backwards before recovering and standing upright. "Vell done, an evective counter as von might exshpect vrom a shinobe. Vut this vight has only just begun!"

         She dashed at you yet again but this time she simply attacked rather than feinting. She brought her leg up for a kick, you were fortunate enough to see it coming and get out of the way. But she didn't let you go, she followed up with an uppercut which you used both hands to stop by catching her fist in your palms as it came up. She countered with a second punch from her free fist which you were unable to stop. It connected with your jaw, causing your head to violently snap to the left. You staggered backwards as she came at you for another punch, by then you were back to center and ready for it. Rather than dodge or stop it your grabbed her by the wrist and elbow and using her own momentum you pulled her into your outstretched leg causing her to stumble and fall behind you.

         Unfazed she bounced back up and resumed her stance, "Vee are getting zah vorkout now," She chuckled as she came at you yet again with a flurry of punches. You backpeddaled and dodged as many as you could. Occasionally she would get a near miss or a glancing blow but it wasn't until she backed you into a wall that she got a good hit in. The armor had saved you twice before, but that last punch forced the back of your head to slam into the wall disorienting you and reawakening your enraged headache. Taking advantage of you momentary lapse, your German 'trainer' grabbed you by the arm before judo flipping into the ground behind her. You lay their dazed before you realized that she would probably attack again, and you were right. She was crouching over you with her bent knees on ether side of your rib cages. Raised just above your face was her fist as she prepared to strike you with another damaging blow. You were quicker though, as you tilted your head to the side and listened to her fist slam into the wood floor you tightened your abdomen and coiled your legs. You somehow got your feet underneath her stomach and literally kicked her off of you. As you stood up you found a pair of daggers streaking towards you. Throwing yourself to the right you managed to avoid them, though one of them did clip your shoulder it harmlessly glanced off your armor. You stared back at the woman in disbelief, "Vhat?" She asked innocently "Do you exshpect zee enemy to vight fair?"

         "This lady's crazy...but she has a point" You muttered to yourself as she through another pair of daggers at you, you rolled to the side as you found a pair of daggers embedded in the wooden floor where you were before. Your head was starting to pound again, but at this point, that was the least of your worries. A sharp pain in your shoulder grabbed your attention. You glanced over at it to find a ninja star. It'd pierced the armor, but it hadn't gone deep enough to cause any real damage. You look back at you 'trainer' who was now grinning wildly with several stars wedged between her fingers. "Uh-oh..." You muttered. As she drew an arm back to throw you jumped to you feet before dashing across the room toward the punching bags. You heard a metallic clinging noise before several stars peppered the ground around your feet. She drew back her other arm as you made it to the bags. You lifted up one of the bags in front of you as she flung the deadly metal shards at you. You felt the bag vibrate slightly as the stars sunk into it. You then charged her using the bag as a shield, "Probably has more hidden crap that I haven't seen yet," you reasoned. As the thought crossed your mind, a sword's point pierced through the bag just under your right armpit. "Whoa!" You exclaimed as you released the bag, causing the woman to nearly drop her katana under the weight of the bag. You took this as your opportunity and tackled her to the ground causing her to drop blade and bag. After pinning her you got to your feet and plucked the star from your shoulder pad before assuming a throwing stance, "I win..." You quietly stated.

         "That is a matter ov opinion," She replied. You wondered what she was thinking when you heard a click and found a gun in her left hand, trained on you. It was probably the smallest and weakest pistol you'd ever seen, but it could probably do enough damage to put you down. "I vould say that vis vould be vhat you call a draw. However! You know zat there is no such thing as zee draw in vreal combat! Vut, I vill admit zat you did vhell." She then stood up and shook your hand, "Same time tomorrow?" She asked.

         "This woman isn't crazy, she insane! She's a certifiable psychopath!" You thought as she shook hands with you.

         Before you can leave though.

122111212112111.content:
The cat had a coat of short, black fur. It hair was also black, falling to about shoulder length. This made hard to see where the hair began and the fur ended. It was entirely possible that its hair was actually just long strands of fur. It's eyes were green with slitted pupils. However, you were only able to see one eyes as the other was covered by strands of fur. The next thing you noticed was the dark purple body glove the cat was wearing. It covered everything but its feet, hands, neck and tail. The final aspect that stood out to you was that it was a she, made obvious by her body shape. The cat glanced down at the man, "The scent ends here," She stated, her voice was quiet with an even tone.

         The man sighed and scratched his head, "You couldn't just stay in your room could ya? Had to get loose, cause a panic, start a manhunt and get me yelled at.... I swear kid, you're bringing me more trouble than the plague! I've already missed five of my seven daily naps!"

         You weren't sure how to respond to his rant, but you honestly were thinking about your current surroundings more than this guy's personal problems. That cat was easily a foot taller than you, and it was a safe bet that she'd easily overpower you in a fight. And speaking of fights, you were standing next to a psychotic German killing machine (In your opinion at least). You could probably out run her, but not her knives. She'd throw them faster than you'd reach the door; the door which is guarded by an anthro cat and the strange nutcase. You turned to take a step back when the glare of sunlight slipped under your visor and hit your eyes, causing your headache to flare up again. It was then you realized your only way out of this nightmare scenario you've found yourself in.

         "Vhat is going on here?" You're trainer demanded.

         "Yeah I guess I should probably tell ya," The man shrugged.

         "Tell me vhat?"

         "You remember that kid that we're keeping here? The one we got from that police station?"

         "Vhat does zhat have to do with anything?"

         After awhile, seemingly irritated with her companion the cat finally spoke, "Hilda, he's missing... and we've been looking for him. I've tracked his scent here which means he's probably in this room," She then looked pointedly at you. Her visible eye seeming to pierce through you. In turn, Hilda was also prompted to turn to you as well.

         A clap echoed throughout the room, "Right, everyone's all caught up," The man said almost gleefully. He then crossed his arms and leaned against the doorpost, "So now that that's out of the way, why don't you just come along quietly and calmly hm? You wouldn't want Cleo-" He paused to jab a thumb at the anthro cat standing next to him, "-to get upset would you?"

         The cat, who was apparently named Cleo sighed before approaching you, "I won't harm you," She promised. She wore a gentle smile and began moving towards. Her steps were slow and deliberate, she held her arms outward with her palms turned toward you to show she was unarmed.

         You remained tense and on guard, though it was hard to do so with a headache shooting through your head at random intervals. But even in your less than-stellar-state, you were able to sense that something wasn't right... "They really do seem nice. I don't sense any- Where's the German psychopath?" It then dawned on you that at some point, they gave a cue to set a trap, and you were standing in the middle of it. "If they think I'm onto them they'll pounce on me right away... If I wait too long, it won't matter what I do because I'll have been caught anyway...

Caught between a rock and hard place, eh? So what do you do? Jump the gun and rush your escape or take your time and move when they do?

1221112121121112.content:
You realized that sense you couldn't see her, 'Hilda' was more than likely behind you. And given that 'Cleo' was approaching you from the front, it was a safe bet that they would try a pincer attack. And you figured while they did that, the strange man you'd met earlier would probably guard the door in case they missed you. You knew at this point that the window was your best bet, but there were two problems. You weren't sure what was on the other side of the window. And even if it wasn't a two hundred foot drop, which it very well could have been. You still had to escape the pincer attack first, and you're odds of that were slim at best.

         You hear the floor boards creak behind you an the floor vibrate beneath your feet. Taking this is you're opportunity you shift your weight and dart to the side before transitioning into a run. You make a sprint for the window. It was narrow, which didn't leave a lot of room for error. You were either going to make it through on you're first try or have a very awkward conversation with the group you just left behind.

         Praying that you got you're timing right you jumped as you tucked your limbs in like you were doing a cannon ball into a pool. You shattered the window as before crashing down a fair distance below it onto the dirt, grass and leaves below. You coughed and sputtered is you recovered from the fall knowing it would only be a matter of seconds before they were on top of you again. You stood in place, instinctively clutching your side. Though clad in armor, you knew that you'd hurt something as your ribcage throbbed, making you painfully aware that you were definitely better off before you're fall. You surveyed your surrounding area and found that you were in a forest. There was no telling how far it went on, where the city was in relation to you or what the place you'd just escaped was. Deciding it was best to start moving again you broke into a light jog heading deeper into the forest. You didn't look back or slow down, you just kept running. As you kept your pace, seconds turned into minutes, and minutes turned into hours. The pain in your side became increasingly intense as you continued to run while your headache ebbed on inn the back of your head reminding you that though not as strong as it was before, it was still present. Finally, after what you assumed to be an hour and a half of running you came to a small river and slowed to a stop. You realized that you now had a choice to make. You could follow the river, or cross it. You turned to look at the woods you'd trekked through, you knew you had a head start since they'd have to come down from where you'd jumped the long way before picking up your trail and following it. But you'd been moving slower than they would be which meant your head start wouldn't last long. In addition to that, every second you spent standing still was a second they spent moving. You needed to get moving again, and despite the pain and exhaustion, you did just that. But which way did you go.

         So? Did you go across the river and through the woods? Or follow the river instead?

12211121211211121.content:
Deciding that you'd be better off in the woods where you can hide, you wade into the river. You nearly fall over as the current pushes against your legs but your able to maintain your balance. As you continue to cross the river you find yourself waist deep, you've noticed the pull in the current has also doubled in force. You assume that this is because your at the deepest point of the riverbed and since there's more water here there's more force as well. Still though, you press on. Crossing the river and fighting the current reminds you of when you used to play whirlpool with your friends in your swimming pool when you were younger. It always was a struggle to get it going, and even harder to make it stop without falling. After a few more moments of wading, you find yourself in the shallows on the other side of the river. Your movement becomes increasingly easier as you're able to move more freely now that the water level has dropped to your knees. After a few more seconds of sloshing through the water you find yourself on the muddy riverbank. Deciding resting would cost you more time than you actually had, you renew your jog into the tree line and continue on.

         After another twenty minutes of jogging you slow to a stop. You check your surroundings to make sure that you're alone, and as far as you can tell; you are. It's then that you notice the air is rather brisk, and it seems that the water had managed to penetrate your body suit. "Guess it was just water resistant instead of waterproof," You mused. A cool breeze harshly reminded you of the difference, as the damp spots on your suit went from a mild chill to an icy cold sting. You also noticed that your breathing was now labored and you were having a hard time concentrating. "You'd better find some shelter, I'm not going to make much more progress than you already have," a voice in the back of your mind stated. You wanted to keep going, but a jolt of pain from your right ribcage made you think twice. You decided that walking until you found a place to stay the night was the best thing you could do. Tired, injured, cold and wet you continued to trudge on. You looked up at the sky through the treetops, watching as it slowly darkened. You knew that it would only be a couple of hours until night fell, and that was when the shinobe were at there best.

122111212112111212.content:
You decide to give up on finding shelter for the night. Your legs are burning and your lungs are cramping. You haven't rested since you woke up that morning and you've been moving nonstop since you escaped the place you woke up in. You decided that you were better off just resting in the open rather than continuing on to find decent shelter, which may or may not exist. Even if it did exist, the odds of finding it with only the moonlight to guide you in an unfamiliar environment were pretty much nil. You eventually come across an unusually large tree. Not seeing any better options in the area, you slowly get into a sitting position with your back against the tree and prop yourself up in as comfortable of a position that you can manage. You settle down and get comfortable, initially you have a hard time getting relaxed with the crickets and frogs chirping and croaking. You do you're best to ignore them and begin to drift off into a dreamless sleep. After who knows how long, you suddenly find yourself awake, laying down sideways on the forest floor. Moonlight and dark surroundings indicate that it's late in the night, so you couldn't have been asleep too long. You examine yourself and realize that you're heart is racing, you're hands are trembling and under you're armor you're sweating. "Why did I wake up?" You wondered as you transition from a laying to a sitting position. "Maybe it was a nightmare?" you speculate. You look around yourself and find that you're still just as alone as you were when you arrived. You spend a few more minutes quietly waiting and listening before deciding that nervousness and paranoia are the blame for you're sudden awakening. Deciding that it's safe to go back to sleep, you lay back and close your eyes once more, letting the silence of the night calm you're mind. Just as you're eyes were closing they shot open once again, "Why aren't the crickets chirping? you asked yourself as you sat up and looked around yourself.

         The more you thought about it the more you realized that nothing was making any noise. A very troubling revelation to you, as it was normally only this quiet in a forest when a predator was lurking around. You slowly stood and put your back against the tree you'd been sleeping under. You looked down at yourself, hoping that the armor you wore had some type of hidden weapon. Fortunately for you, it appeared that for once, your life decided to toss you some good news. Strapped to the outside of each boot you wore, you found daggers. Not that you were a proficient knife fighter, but it was nice to know that you had something you could use to protect yourself if you had to. You stood and waited, minute after minute ticked by but nothing moved or made a sound. Eventually you got fed up with the waiting, "I know you're there! So why don't you just come out so we can get this over with!" You shouted into the darkness. The moonlight dully lit the armor you wore as it shined down on you in broken rays.

         After a few more moments of silence you heard the clatter of chains. As a few more seconds passed, you could hear footsteps accompanying them. "It's very rare that somebody notices me before I make my move," A masculine voice called out, "It's a sign that you are very aware of surroundings, I applaud you for that." Out of the darkness came an anthro, one you hadn't met before. The first feature that stood out to you were the large pointed ears that nearly stood straight up on his head. He wore a thin leather coat that stopped at his knees and a pair of black pants to match it. Thick leather boots covered his feet and grey fingerless gloves covered his hands. He had a coat of messy brown fur and a mess of scruffy black hair on his head at the base of his ears. Brown eyes sat atop his thin muzzle which housed his fangs. He wasn't much bigger than you, but he was slightly larger, a detail that didn't go unnoticed by either of you it seemed judging by the smirk on his face.

         "Who are you?" You demanded.

         "Ah, see that's an interesting question isn't it?" The jackal replied, "Because while it is legitimate, it's also one that I could ask you. You look like a member of that ninja group... but you aren't one are you?"

         "What makes you so sure that I'm not?" You demanded.

         The jackal laughed heartily at you're retort, "You mean besides the fact that the first shinobe I've ever met that's actually talked?" You quietly growled, you'd completely forgotten about that fact. "Let's see, the shinobe normally work in small groups or pairs. You appear to be all alone. Then there's the fact that you're injured... I can tell by the way you're standing. I've never seen an injured shinobe get left behind... all of this means one of two things. You're either a spy for the people I work for who's cover has been blown..." The jackal then narrowed his eyes and dropped all hints of playfulness from his voice, "Or you're the human that everyone's been fussing about. And conveniently, the one I was sent to capture." You growled outwardly this time and took a step back, "So, we can do this the sensible way... or the difficult way. Take that anyway you like" The jackal continued, grinning as he finished his sentence.

So will you run or fight?

1221112121121112121.content:
You knew you weren't gonna be able to out run him anyway, so you figured if you had to fight you might as well make sure you're ready for it and its on your terms. "Fine," you called, "I'll surrender myself, if only to get it over with. I've been running all day and quite frankly I'm tired of it."

         The jackal was initially taken aback but grinned and laughed, "Resourceful and smart! You're definitely not like the humans we have around here! Maybe you did come from another world. Still though, just for the sake of protocol I'm going to have you put these on." The jackal reached into his pocket and pulled out a pair of handcuffs. "They're specially made just for humans like you, now come 'ere and let's get on with it."

         You nodded and started walking towards the jackal with a halfhearted trudge. The jackal waited patiently, his furry tail swishing around behind him. When you got within five feet of him he started to reach out with the handcuffs. You extended you're arms, as if to slip them into the cuffs. Once you were standing just in front of him you jerked your arms over your head before bringing them down and slapping the cuffs out of the jackal's hands and onto the ground. You then hauled back and punched him square in the jaw. He stumbled backwards in shock, but you weren't done yet. You followed up with another punch with you're left fist and fired another one from your right. You would've hit him again if he hadn't tripped and fallen. The jackal touched a hand to his lower lip and looked at it in shock as he found blood on his fingertips. He then looked at you with disdain, prompting you to shrug, "Did you really think it'd be that easy?"

         The jackal chuckled, "Did you?" He asked as his tail swept against you're legs and knocked you down. You tried to get up as fast as you could but the jackal was quicker. He grabbed you by the edges of the chest plate before hoisting you to your feet and tossing you across the ground. You rolled until your side slammed into a tree, thankfully it wasn't the injured side. Again, you tried to get up as you rolled onto your stomach and got you're hands and knees under you. Before you could get to your feet you felt a crushing pressure on you're back that forced you onto your stomach. "This could have been avoided you know," The jackal snarled as he grabbed you by the collar of the back plate and lifted you onto your feet. He went to punch you, but somewhere in the blur of motion, you managed to stop that punch with both of your arms. However, the jackal simply uses his freehand to backhand you across the face and send you staggering backwards. The armor along your jaw took the brunt of the blow, but the pain that came after the initial blow was still there. You managed to get your feet back under you and you're balance stabilized before you went too far backwards. But you'd lost sight of the jackal. Before you knew it you felt a spine shattering pain in your back which threw your body forward. You didn't even get a chance to hit the ground before you felt another strike hit your right side. You were sent crashing into a tree that happened to be nearby. You tried to orient yourself and catch your breath, but find yourself unable to do either as vice like force clamps down around your throat and your back was forced against the tree you'd just been knocked into. Your vision clears enough to see the jackal glaring at you with a hand clearly clamped around you're throat. You're already empty lungs were screaming for oxygen, your left ribcage felt as though there were a hole ripped in it and your neck felt as though it was being sawed off. The jackal wasn't finished with you yet though, he applied even more pressure to your throat and lifted you so that your feet were no longer touching the ground. "But you had to go and make me angry, to be honest... I'm supposed to take you alive. But I'm starting to have second thoughts about that!" He shouted. You began desperately bending your knees, trying to bring one of you're hidden daggers within arm's reach before you lost consciousness.

         "Come on! Come one! You mentally shouted as your fingers writhed and flexed to reach the hilt of at least one of the blades. To the jackal, it just seemed like spastic jolts, but to you... those jolts meant the difference between life and death.

         "Struggle all you like!" The jackal shouted, "But nothing's going to change! You- will die here! Cold and alone! I- will deliver you're body and collect my bounty, and NOBODY- will know what happened here tonight!"

         You continued to strain and reach for you're blades until finally, you're effort was rewarded, "Got it!" You screamed within the confines of you mind as you slashed at the jackal's arm. He howled in pain before falling backwards and holding his arm. You choked and gasped as you backed away from the anthro. "Too close..." You wheezed to yourself.

         The jackal looked down at his arm as he slowly removed his now bloodied hand. A long and clean cut ran through his jacket sleeve. He then looked at you with an expression that screamed 'rage'. He stood up and began walking towards you. You got to your feet and attempted another slash with your blade. But having already seen that trick once before, the jackal caught your right arm in mid swing. He then applied pressure to your arm until you could no longer grasp your dagger. It fell from you're hand making a muffled thud as it hit the ground. He then slung you by the arm and tossed you into a nearby log. You drew your second dagger in your left hand just as he reached you. You slashed at him but he stopped short of the daggers edge before grabbing your left wrist and smashing it against the log causing you to drop your other dagger.

         Snarling at you with his blood stained teeth from your first attack he extended the claws on his free hand, "Now then, this is the end for you!"
