12211121211211121211.content:
"That's it..." You think, "I've got nothing left...". Random memories from your life flashed through your mind. The memories were like fragments of shattered glass falling all around you. Each glimpsing into a moment of your past. Happiness, sorrow, pain, regret, love and hate blurred together in a montage of your most memorable moments, all leading up to where you were now. Time seemed to slow as the jackal released your shoulder and shifted his grip to pin you down by your throat. "So this is it huh? I gave my best, and in the end it was only good enough to buy myself an extra minute or two... how pitiful... Somewhere in the back of your mind you hear a faint voice, "If you gave your best then there's nothing to regret... right?" You smile to yourself as a small chuckle escapes you, "Right..."

         The jackal then thrusts his other hand toward you're chest. You know the armor won't stand up to an attack like that. So you close you're eyes and wait to be put to death. But the sharp pain never came. You open your eyes to find the jackal's claws, poised and ready to strike. But they are unable to do so as a thick, black and rubbery rope is laced around his wrist like a lasso. You look to the source of the rope to find an actual shinobe standing with the rope firmly grasped in its (Again, hard for you to make the gender out) hands, effectively preventing the jackal from killing you. The jackal briefly turns to cut the rope from his wrist. But as he does this he's knocked to the ground by a blur of motion. You slump over on your side now that you're free from the jackal's grasp. You look toward the direction that the jackal had been thrown in and find Cleo; the cat from earlier, standing between you and the jackal.

         "Really? Killing innocent humans?" She demanded, "I thought you were better than that Ray..."

         "Cleo, in my way as always," The jackal growled.

         "Do you even know why you were sent for this human?" Cleo asked.

         "I may have been a little curious before he hit me, but I don't really care anymore. I'm only interested in vengeance and retribution against that," Ray spat as he jabbed a finger at you accusingly.

         "What has he done to deserve your rage?" Cleo demanded.

         Ray scoffed, "He sliced a hole in my arm and knocked my fangs out of alignment!"

         "No doubt right after you tried to rip a hole in him and beat his bones out of alignment," Cleo countered. Ray fumed silently at her retort, "You can always dish it, but you're the first to call for beheadings when someone retaliates against you, you haven't changed at all."

         "And you, always getting in my way and acting all self righteous! How you and Terra are related will always be beyond me!"

         You watched as the two anthros went back and forth. You tried to keep yourself awake, but you were exhausted and heavily injured. You faded in and out of consciousness, only hanging by a thread in the conscious realm. Time seems to start running together when you find Ray standing over you maliciously. But as he reaches out for you he's kicked to the side as Cleo attacks him. The two fight and move out of you're range of vision. You can hear the fighting, but you lack the energy to track and observe it. You start to fade from consciousness but manage to open your eyes once more. You find yourself being helped along by a shinobe and the man who was with you when you first woke up. Each had draped one of your arms over their shoulders and were currently dragging you through the river. As they crossed the river you hear a series of splashes. Looking to you're right, you find Ray dashing through the river and coming right for you. Cleo cuts him off however, and dashes between you're small group and the menacing predator. Forcing him to engage her in combat, she buys your group the time it needs to get out of the river and into the woods again. This is as much as you're able to see before you start to black out again. You're vision brightens and starts to clear again as you find yourself being dragged through hallways with hardwood floors and wood paneling. Again though, you are unable to keep you're eyes open for long.

         You see images of Ray attacking you while you run through the forest alone and in the dark. You run for as long as you can but find a large waterfall blacks you from going any further as Ray approaches you from behind. You try to run but find your ankles have literally been chained to the ground by shackles. You pull, twist and yank yourself in every conceivable direction as you desperately struggle to get loose. He grinned maniacally as he extended his claws and walked toward you at an unsettlingly slow pace. It was then that you shot straight up in bed and found your breathing to be heavy and your body riddled with bruises and scrapes. You groan and lay back in your bed.

         "I hate mornings too, but even I don't think getting up is that bad." You're eyes shot open as you glared across the room at the man who seemed to keep reappearing in your life whether you wanted him to or not. "I get the vibe that we've been here before, don't you?"

         You sigh and place a hand over you're eyes as if keeping you're eyelids covered would allow you to go back to sleep, "I feel like I've been hit by a train and thrown into a river...." You groaned.

         "Mondays, am I right?" The man asked.

         You removed you're from your eyes and just glowered at the man, "Could you please just, like, shut up... for five minutes?"

         The man sighed, "You know that was pretty rude. I saved you from a psychopath last night ya know. You should at least show me a little gratitude."

         "No," You reply, "Cleo saved me from a psychopath, you helped drag me back to safety because you were told to."

         The man scratched his head, "Well... that's another version of the story... But to be honest, Cleo's fighting is decent but she lacks form and discipline. When we had first dragged you out of there I had to go back and help her. She was fighting gallantly, but I knew she had bitten off more than she could chew in taking that guy on. I ordered the shinobe that you'd first seen to keep moving no matter what happened to me. And I went back for Cleo. She was so glad to see me come back to help her that she took her eyes off of that jackal and he knocked down. He would've dealt the finishing blow if I hadn't gone back to stop him!"

         "Really? Is that how you remember it?" A cool feminine voice asked from just outside the doorway. Cleo then walked in with her hand on her hip and a raised eyebrow as she stared down at the man.

         "Oh, hey Cleo! You should've knocked or somethin'! I would've told my story a bit differently!" The man laughed.

         "Which part? The one where you saved my life? Or the part where I was glad to see you?" Cleo questioned as she crossed her arms.

         "Ouch," The man replied, "You know I have feelings too. That really hurt. I can't believe that you would wound me so deeply over a couple of minor inconsistencies. But, that's okay, I forgive you." He then yawned, "All of this reconciliation is taking a lot out of me. I'm gonna go sleep it off for an hour or three... later!" And with that he left.

Theoretically, if you could get humans and anthros to get along on a small scale, you could also do it on a large scale. However, there are certain anthro officials and human groups that would hinder our efforts. And as if that weren't problematic enough, the humans that live here refuse to trust anthros outside of this compound. But we couldn't ask them to return to a prejudice world either. So we trained as shinobe, we take what we need from those who have it in abundance as quietly and quickly as we can. It's been our way of life from a few years now."

         "I'm sorry to hear that," You replied. "It sounds like you're caught between a rock and a hard place. You can't go back to how things were before and you can push ahead with you're plan to unify both races...."

         "Well, we were," Cleo admitted, "That is, until you came along."

         "What? Me?" You asked, "What good am I to you?"

         "You harbor no animosity or prejudice. You don't hate anthros and you're a human. Humans can accept you and you have no reservations about talking with an anthro," Cleo explained. Our plan is a bit drastic, but using the shinobe we have, we plan to kidnap the anthros who hold authority in the surrounding cities. After that, the rest will be up to you."

         "And what do you expect me to do?" You asked skeptically.

         "After we bring them here we expect you to do what you're doing right now; talk to an anthro. Show them that humans aren't their enemy. But prove to them that they are not the vermin that some believe them to be."

         You shook you're head, "You're asking me to represent my entire race."

         "No, I'm asking you to change the future of both of our races," Cleo countered. "If things are aloud to continue, a war will eventually break out. A war that will result in the genocide of one, if not both species. Human children grow up being taught that anthros are powerful and vicious monsters who stole the world from humankind. Anthros grow up being taught that they were cursed and enslaved by humanity until they fought back. This cycle will continue unless you break it. Right now, you are the only human in existence that is untainted by the dark past that humans and anthros have woven. I need you to do this... please..."

12211121211211121212.content:
He growls fiercely as he slams his fist into your chest, probably breaking more of your ribs. You cough blood from your mouth. His teeth are bare. He then proceeds to swing at your leg, you catch this at the last moment as it hits you. You cry out in pain as you hear and feel a distinct break. Tears start rolling down your cheeks. When is he just gonna end it? He grips your neck, and you look into his eyes as they pierce through your soul with an undeniable, uncontrollable anger. He raises his free hand and you notice his claws. Oh, Jackals have claws...

"You're going to die human!" He grits. You watch as his claws swipe and drag across your arms, ensuring that even if you had lived, you'd have to live with these scars. This is it... You can't think of anything else but of what is happening right now. He stops choking you. You bleed from many places on your body. He starts to get up, but with the last of your strength you grab his fur by his neck with your right arm. He didn't expect you to move--

"Look-- at me..." You gasp, "Look in-to-- my-- eyes--," You choke, having to force yourself to keep speaking, "Watch me-- as-- I die--! Have-- you, ever-- watched-- as the life-- drifted away from-- someone?" You crack, your head is shaking as he keeps looking into you. His facial expression almost looks as if it's changing, but you can't tell. Your eyes are filled with blurry tears and you can't breath. "I-- I'm not-- I never-- I--" You attempt to say, he tries to get out of your grip, but you hold on with the last of your will. "I never-- I didn't want-- to die. But because of you--, I will never-- get-- to go home." You bawl, blood cackling from your mouth as you speak. It is obvious that the life from you is slowly fading, your arms-- weak.

"Get off me!" He yells, his voice is breaking away from anger.

"Watch me-- die... do-- do you know what-- death-- is like?" You gasp. "I do..." You let go as you slump back onto the log. Your heart is pounding, and so is your head. You hear nothing from him, you forget why your there in this world. You try to think of something happy as you slowly fade into sleep...

122111212112111212122.content:
Everything is fuzzy. There is nothing but blank space. It is morning. Off in the distance you think you hear the crunching of leaves. You gasp for breath, but it feels like you’re being stabbed in the lugs. You look at your arms and then your body whilst staying still. Coughing only spurts blood onto your clothes. The footsteps come closer as if they were running. You don’t move, maybe because you can’t, or maybe you just don’t want to continue.

You lock eyes with a figure. You think you can recognize it… but there is no discernable features to grasp onto as you can barely see two feet in front of your face. You cough again. The figure kneels beside you, and you recognize it as one of the anthros from where you escaped. You don’t know how to feel.

You were the one who ran away. You were the one who didn’t listen.

“I’m sorry.” You wheeze. The anthro looks away. You think they’re upset.

“Damnit!” One of them shouts. They get up. You’re a bit surprised.

“Shh-” You whisper, trying to catch their attention. “Don’t speak, you’re not supposed to speak.” You cough. You close your eyes for a moment and open them once more. The figures seem smaller now. The one anthro kneels down once more, but it’s no longer an anthro.

It’s someone from your family; your mother. Your eyes go wide for a moment, but then you feel calm.

“It’s alright, Kiba, let’s go home.” She speaks. You smile.

“Sorry, mom, that I got into this mess.” You say, your voice feels normal again.

“It’s alright, son.” The other figure says. It crouches down, and you see your father.

“Oh hey, dad.” You exclaim.

“Get up, we’re going somewhere.” He says whilst holding his wife’s hand.

“Alright! Cool!” Your voice sounds younger. You spring up and hug your parents.





Meanwhile, the two anthros who had come to help realized that the human is too far gone to save.

123.content:
"Are you done yet?" Kira asked as he braced the large metal door with metal table.

"I told you this was a delicate process," Neil growled as peered down at the focus of his attention through a magnifying glass. He sat a top of a eight foot tall armored, mechanical humanoid which lay face up and lifeless on the ground. The armor on its chest, upper arms and face had opened to reveal the innards of the metallic warrior to reveal that it needed a wearer.

"They'll be here any minute!" Terra warned as she helped Kiba drag a large metal beam towards the door. With some difficulty, the two managed to affix the beam across the door to act as an oversized deadbolt lock.

"I'm working as fast as I can!" Neil called as he ran to the side of the machine's head and closed a panel before moving around to its side to plug an oversized black extension cord into its arm. He then ran to a computer that the extension cord was attached to and began furiously typing and punching in keys.

Kiba and Terra watched with anticipation until they heard a loud thud at the door.

"We're out of time," Kiba announced, his tone was grave and his expression stoic. Terra nodded in agreement.

"So what now?" Neil asked, "I'm still not ready yet."

"We'll buy as much time for you as we can," Terra replied, "But, I doubt it'll be anything significant."

"Regardless of what happens here, we did our job," Kiba stated, "The hideout was evacuated with three of the four units. This is about finding ourselves an opening to get out now."

As soon as Kiba finished his sentence, two German shepherd anthros came busting through the door. Kiba was the first to react, throwing a hammer as hard as he could at the first officer. The head of the hammer thudded against the canines chest. He gave an audible help and whine before clutching his chest and growling at Kiba. Terra followed up with a wrist mounted slingshot, firing a showere of rocks and ceramic chips from it. While it did slow the officers it did little to stop them. Terra the switched tactics and picked up a metal rod laying nearby.

         Leaping into the air she brought the pole down on the officer closest to her. He easily blocked the overhead attack with one arm and reached out to grab Terra with the other. Unable to dodge in the air, Terra founder herself suspended by the hood of her hoodie. This was a mistake on the part of the officer however as his prey still held onto her makeshift staff. Taking the staff, Terra smashed it against the side of the shepherd's face. He howled in agony as he dropped the human and clamped his hands over his face. Taking the opening, Terra struck him again under his chin and twirled the rod around herself as though it were a propeller that she controlled with the accuracy of ballerina. She struck the Shepherd again and again, each time in a different place.

         As Terra occupied the officer in front of her, Kira kept the other one busy with his own methods. Though he wasn't as agile as Terra, he was still far more talented than the average human. He disappeared into the shadows of the building, prompting the officer to follow him. As the officer adjusted to the dark and found his target, Kira shined a flashlight directly into his eyes. The canine whimpered and covered his eyes allowing Kiba to rush in and whack him in the snout with the steel flashlight casing. As the Canine clutched his nose Kiba ran behind him and limbed a file cabinet, using it as a stepping stone to throw himself onto his attackers back. Mustering all the strength he could, Kiba put the the officer into a chokehold. It took all of his strength to hold his grip. The attack was effective, but short lived as he was ripped from the officer's back and tossed to the cold stone ground. Shaking the dizziness from his head, he found that Terra now stood next to him, brandishing her rod defensively against not one, but two officers. Tired and slightly battered, the two humans realized that they had done all they could. The three anthros closed in on them, but suddenly stopped when a whirring noise was her followed by a high pitched whine, almost like a jet engine. Eventually the noise died down to a faint hum.

"Why don't you pick on somebody your own size?" Neil's voice echoed as if through a loudspeaker. A large silhouette rose above Kira and Terra, heavy footsteps were heard as the figure moved past them to reveal a large mechanical humanoid with a yellow visor over where it's eyes would be and a metal faceplate covering its mouth. It wore a helmet that was swept back in a tear drop design while the rest of its armor was rounded and sleek looking to match. It was painted a matte grey and stood at a level height with the officers. On its back it wor a sleek, metallic backpack which had several vent slots running along its sides and top. On the back of the pack the Number '01' was printed in white and above the numbering were the words 'Silent Echo'.

         "So?" Neil asked as he pounded one metallic fist into the palm of his other hand in front of his chest, "Who wants some?"

Breathing in, you look around. A rather beautiful place with a great view. A very relative feeling, as you and your friend both lived and worked in this area for a long time. You two have a mutual friendship and respect for each other's opinion on this new aircraft you two have co-created. You feel the air whip around your body as you close your eyes. The sun pierces through every crack in the field of miscellaneous flowers. You open your eyes and avoid direct contact with the sun as you soak it up. You glance over to the small building that was the control station.

The plan is to test the aircraft. You, your friend, and a retired pilot are all in to test this new aircraft. You and your friend get forty-eight percent each, while the pilot who risks their life will get one percent of stock profits, whilst the last one percent will go to donations and taxes. Aircraft business is a very profiting business, therefore the large gap between stocks.

You are the smarter of the two, you and him. Ever since high-school you both realized that you'd be doing a lot of the equations, while he'd be putting together the architecture of the plane. Whatever the process, you two were both proud of this and are already about to make profit, but that wasn't your goal. You both loved the idea of allowing safe flight. You implemented an alloy-- one you created, the first of its kind, no-one else has it, but what does that matter? It's a strong, safe metal! It has special properties, but you believe there aren't any more to figure out, as you've tested the crap outta it already.

"Hey!" Your friend shouts from a couple fifty feet away. You spin around and adjust your eyes to his small stature from so far away. You walk towards him and step out of your beauty-stricken trance of the land around. The wind feels so good, you start jogging a bit. Mostly from excitement. 132.content:
Breathing in, you look around. A rather beautiful place with a great view. A very relative feeling, as you and your friend both lived and worked in this area for a long time. You two have a mutual friendship and respect for each other's opinion on this new aircraft you two have co-created. You feel the air whip around your body as you close your eyes. The sun pierces through every crack in the field of miscellaneous flowers. You open your eyes and avoid direct contact with the sun as you soak it up. You glance over to the small building that was the control station.

The plan is to test the aircraft. You, your friend, and a retired pilot are all in to test this new aircraft. You and your friend get forty-eight percent each, while the pilot who risks their life will get one percent of stock profits, whilst the last one percent will go to donations and taxes. Aircraft business is a very profiting business, therefore the large gap between stocks.

You are the smarter of the two, you and him. Ever since high-school you both realized that you'd be doing a lot of the equations, while he'd be putting together the architecture of the plane. Whatever the process, you two were both proud of this and are already about to make profit, but that wasn't your goal. You both loved the idea of allowing safe flight. You implemented an alloy-- one you created, the first of its kind, no-one else has it, but what does that matter? It's a strong, safe metal! It has special properties, but you believe there aren't any more to figure out, as you've tested the crap outta it already.

132.title: The New Plane!

choices: "Terrance McCario", The protector who will save all, at any cost.
"Vincent McCario", The multi-linguist, whose language talents may save the day.
"Clair McCario", The militaristic savior who must fight for what she believes.
"Jessica Tremont", The curvaceous dream who can build a safe path for everyone.
"Antonio Tremont", The talkative cook may be able to get everyone off the hook.
14.content:
Everything feels...far away. Dream-like. Almost as if it was an illusion...

No. You can still feel the flames of the fire, the feeling of smoke in your lungs, and the shaking of everyone near you. The sounds of the sirens are outside, the door door being kicked in...

It was too late. You couldn't hold on. You simply started to...slip away. Slip away into the dark abyss.

"Hey, ______, do you think we could come over to your place? We haven't been over in ages!"

What?

"Yeah! We have Friday off this week, and no one has to work!"

A second voice?

"Sure, let me get their permission."

A third...wait, isn't that...your voice?

"I don't see them saying no, as long as we don't trash the house."

Another one? Their voice sounds very familiar.

"We won't do that. Have some faith ________."

Yet another person. This one is familiar but...not quite right.

"Yeah, they said it was ok to use the house for our little get together. As long as we don't burn down the house or empty the fridge."

"Relax, everything will be fine."

The voices stop. Who were they? All the voices were familiar, but they sounded echo-like, and hard to make out what they were really talking about. Do you know them? Are they important?

"Yes. You will do nicely."

As if all the voices weren't enough, now there's another one. But this one feels...frightening.

"This is the human I've been searching for."

Human?

"Yes, this specimen will give me the keys to complete-"

"The voice abruptly cuts off. Specimen? You?

"______? _______ can you hear me?"

Yes? What's wrong? You feel worried. Their voice, whoever it is, is in trouble!

"______! _______ help! Th-they're going to-"

What's wrong? What's going on? Who's going to do what?

"_______ run! Don't let them catch you!"

Let who catch you? Why can't-

"They're trapped."

You weakly open your eyes. That's when you feel yourself plummeting. The wind whips your arms and legs. Ahead however, is something you haven't seen before. A massive silver-colored creature floats down with you. It's shape...indescribable due to its body morphing constantly.

"All of them are going to be trapped. Can you save them?"

Wait! Those voices...!

"Tell me, who are you?" the creature asks, "What is your name?"

Your name? That's simple. Your name is...

This person is desired for greatness. Whos survival will determine the fate of their siblings and friends. Tell me reader, which unlikely person will be tasked with his family and friend's fates, and perhaps the fates of many others they have not even met yet? Be warned, the world this person is about to enter may not be the most forgiving, and due to action or inaction, the lives of the five may be forever lost.

Terrance McCario - Terrance "Terry" McCario, 6'2" age 19, the youngest within his friends and family. Terry lives with his older brother, Vincent McCario , his adoptive sister, Clair McCario , and hangs out with his two best friends, Jess and Antonio Tremont . Terry, while the youngest within his siblings and friends, has just graduated from his high school, a whole two years later than everyone else in his class range. Due to him being older than everyone in his peer range, a lot of ridicule was thrown at him all through his life, starting from second grade. While this ridicule has left an affect on his trust in others, he is the most intelligent, practical, level-headed, and loyal. He is also very kind toward others, helping anyone who has given up in their life with a smile and heartwarming personality.
The few issues that Terry has, aside from his trouble to trust many others is his weight, resentment, and guilt. Terry is 30 pounds over what is 'acceptable.' While Terry can not run fast, he can run for a long time. While simple ridicule and taunts Terry has learned to ignore, the effect from when he was in school has built a fierce rage deep within him. When Terry was 14, he was beaten up by a thug who was trying to rob Clair. When Terry was stabbed, he flew into a rage befitting a berserker, and killed the thug by ripping the knife from his stomach and repeatedly stabbing the thug. Terry was then kept a close eye on for a year, in which nothing serious happened while he came to the realization that he killed someone. Terry will do anything to protect the ones he cherishes. Anything.

Vincent McCario - Vincent "Vince" McCario, 5'5" age 21, the middle child between Terrance and Clair. Vince is the most average person in the group, but in school he was one of the best track members on his high school team, as well as the only person who took Spanish, French, German, Japanese, Chinese, ans Korean AP courses and passed with some of the highest scores in his age range. His relationship with Terry and Clair is a mixed one. Terry was the student that can do anything he could set his mind to, Clair was the student that could get good grades and is currently in the process of enrolling in the military, Vincent was the one who was in the circumstance as a translator for the government, an awkward position to talk about with his siblings. Due to this, he has not talked with either of them for a while and is beginning to distance himself from them.
While Vincent is a rather plain man, his biggest faults lie with his indecision. When faced with the decision of cereal or oatmeal, it can take up to 10 minutes for him to decide on what he wants.

Clair McCario Clair "Cara" McCario, 5'11" age 23, the oldest of the group. Cara enjoys protecting people and guns. She was currently attempting to get into the military and become a protector of the people. Her inspiration to do this is because of the traumatic incident with the thug and Terry. She blamed herself for nearly getting Terry killed and swore that she would never let that happen to him, or anyone while she was around. In school, she is decent, getting nice grades, but when she was scouted for the military she believed this was her brake. She could finally join the military and protect those she cared about.
Unfortunately Clair is single-minded. While not necessarily bad, she tends to ignore or miss little items in her pursuit of her goals.

Jessica Tremont Jessica "Jess" Tremont, 5'6" age 20. Jess is what many would call a bimbo, a person with an intellect comparable to dish-soap, while her figure looks like it should be in a magizine for...'reasons.' Despite what many believe, she is a hard worker, with a rational mind. In the group, she has the most practical advice. She first met Terry in high school, and feeling sorry for him, started dating him. While they eventually broke up, due to their feelings of wanting to be very good friends with each other, they stayed together all through high school.
Of all the claims thrown at her, she can not deny that her academic record is not the best. She can only be called a sub-average student, unless it comes to anything construction based. She is also very cold at times with dry humor at the worst of times. Regardless, she loves her brother, and has a massive crush on Vincent McCario, one she is not sure how to express.

Antonio Tremont Antonio "Tony" Tremont, 5'7" age 20. Tony is what many call the "Social Expert." He can talk, and talk, and talk. He is the only one within the group that has not finished high school, but is working as a chef. While not a bad student before he dropped out, Tony has little motivation to do anything outside talking and cooking.
14.title: Storyline 4: Who...are you?

info.brief_description: You are transported to a world of anthros... how will they react? How will you react?
info.description:
Okay, I may be starting this prematurely but I'm anxious to get started on it. In this story you are transported to I new world filled with anthros. How they will react? Will they try to befriend you? Or will they see you as a threat and attack you? Or will they become fascinated with you and try to capture you? The possibilities are endless. All I ask is that like my other story you keep everything PG-13.

Rules:

1. No swearing.

2. No simple single sentence chapters, if you're going to write then write.

3. Try not to end the story, if you do that then what fun is it?

4. Use proper grammar and English, it doesn't have to be perfect but I do want you to at least try.

5. No random, off the wall subject changes or paragraphs.
